quote: Everything in space obeys the laws of physics. If you know these laws  and obey them  space will treat you kindly. And don't tell me man doesn't belong out there. Man belongs wherever he wants to go - and he'll do plenty well when he gets there.
author: Wernher von Braun

quote: An unlearned carpenter of my acquaintance once said in my hearing: 'There is very little difference between one man and another  but what there is is very important.'
author: William James

quote: One of the laws of paleontology is that an animal which must protect itself with thick armour is degenerate. It is usually a sign that the species is on the road to extinction.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: The Family of Man is more than three billion strong. It lives in more than one hundred nations. Most of its members are not white. Most of them are not Christians. Most of them know nothing about free enterprise  or due process of law  or the Australian ballot.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Man is as full of potentiality as he is of impotence.
author: George Santayana

quote: That man is an aggressive creature will hardly be disputed. With the exception of certain rodents  no other vertebrate habitually destroys members of its own species.
author: Anthony Storr

quote: Every man is more than just himself  he also represents the unique  the very special and always significant and remarkable point at which the world's phenomena intersect  only once in this way  and never again.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Man is a gaming animal. He must be always trying to get the better in something or other.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Man makes holy what he believes  as he makes beautiful what he loves.
author: Ernest Renan

quote: Man is an abyss  and I turn giddy when I look down into it.
author: Georg Buchner

quote: There is a secret person undamaged in every individual.
author: Paul Shepard

quote: We are governed not by armies and police but by ideas.
author: Mona Caird

quote: For seasons and seasons and seasons all our movement has been going against our self  a journey into our killer's desire.
author: Ayi Kwei Armah

quote: What comes from the heart  goes to the heart.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: It's better to be quotable than to be honest.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: Of all feats of skill  the most difficult is that of being honest.
author: Comtesse Diane

quote: To be honest  one must be inconsistent.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: He that resolves to deal with none but honest men  must leave off dealing.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: 'Tis my opinion every man cheats in his way  and he is only honest who is not discovered.
author: Susannah Centlivre

quote: There is one way to find out if a man is honest - ask him. If he says 'yes'  you know he is crooked.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: The honester the man  the worse luck.
author: John Ray

quote: Let none of us delude himself by supposing that honesty is always the best policy. It is not.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: Honesty's praised  then left to freeze.
author: Juvenal

quote: Wealth makes everything easy - honesty most of all.
author: Comtesse Diane

quote: Honesty is as rare as a man without self-pity.
author: Stephen Vincent Benet

quote: One must not cheat anybody  not even the world of one's triumph.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: People who are brutally honest get more satisfaction out of the brutality than out of the honesty.
author: Richard J. Needham

quote: Anger cannot be dishonest.
author: George R. Bach

quote: I'm frank  brutally frank. And even when I'm not frank  I look frank.
author: Lord Thomson

quote: The young man turned to him with a disarming candour  which instantly put him on his guard.
author: Saki

quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Honesty is the best policy.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: When rogues fall out  honest men get into their own.
author: Sir Matthew Hale

quote: An honest man's the noblest work of God.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I hope I shall always possess firmness and virtue enough to maintain what I consider the most enviable of all titles  the character of an "Honest Man."
author: George Washington

quote: Honor lies in honest toil.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: I could not love thee  dear  so much  Loved I not honor more.
author: Richard Lovelace

quote: No person was ever honoured for what he received. Honour has been the reward for what he gave.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: A man has honour if he holds himself to an ideal of conduct though it is inconvenient  unprofitable or dangerous to do so.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: God sells knowledge for labour - honour for risk.
author: Arabic proverb

quote: Fame is something which must be won  honour is something which must not be lost.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Dignity does not consist in possessing honours  but in deserving them.
author: Aristotle

quote: I could not love thee  dear  so much Loved I not honour more.
author: Richard Lovelace

quote: Would that ... a sense of the true aim of life might elevate the tone of politics and trade till public and private honour become identical.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: No revenge is more honorable than the one not taken.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: An act of God was defined as something which no reasonable man could have expected.
author: A. P. Herbert

quote: It is a long lane that has no turning.
author: Old saying

quote: Hope is a pleasant acquaintance  but an unsafe friend.
author: Thomas Chandler Haliburton

quote: We do not really feel grateful toward those who make our dreams come true  they ruin our dreams.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: For what human ill does not dawn seem to be an alleviation?
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Hope  deceitful as it is  serves at least to lead us to the end of life along an agreeable road.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: One need not hope in order to undertake  nor succeed in order to persevere.
author: William the Silent

quote: Hope! of all ills that men endure The only cheap and universal cure.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: Hope is the poor man's bread.
author: George Herbert

quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast  Man never is  but always to be blest.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I suppose it can be truthfully said that hope is the only universal liar who never loses his reputation for veracity.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Every thing that is done in the world is done by hope.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Hope is a good breakfast  but it is a bad supper.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Man's many desires are like the small metal coins he carries about in his pocket. The more he has the more they weight him down.
author: Satya Sai Baba

quote: One of the best safeguards of our hopes  I have suggested  is to be able to mark off the areas of hopelessness and to acknowledge them  to face them directly  not with despair but with the creative intent of keeping them from polluting all the areas of possibility.
author: William F. Lynch

quote: The human body experiences a powerful gravitational pull in the direction of hope. That is why the patient's hopes are the physician's secret weapon. They are the hidden ingredients in any prescription.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: Some one once said to me  'Reverend Schuller  I hope you live to see all your dreams fulfilled.' I replied  T hope not  because if I live and all my dreams are fulfilled  I'm dead.' It's unfulfilled dreams that keep you alive.
author: Robert Schuller

quote: The slow compromise  or even surrender  of our fondest hopes is a regular feature of normal human life.
author: Leston L. Havens

quote: Hope is an echo  hope ties itself yonder  yonder.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: 'Hope' is the thing with feathers That perches in the soul - And sings the tune without words And never stops - at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: It is characteristic of genius to be hopeful and aspiring.
author: Harriet Martineau

quote: If it were not for hopes  the heart would break.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: None are completely wretched but those who are without hope  and few are reduced so low as that.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Wonder ... music heard in the heart  is voiceless.
author: Rosemary Dobson

quote: At first we hope too much  later on  not enough.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: He who does not hope to win has already lost.
author: Jose Joaquin Olmedo

quote: We should not let our fears hold us back from pursuing our hopes.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Man needs  for his happiness  not only the enjoyment of this or that  but hope and enterprise and change.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Without hope men are only half alive. With hope they dream and think and work.
author: Charles Sawyer

quote: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world. Someone to love  something to do  and something to hope for.
author: Tom Bodett

quote: Great hopes make great men.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Hope is one of those things in life you cannot do without.
author: LeRoy Douglas

quote: A leader is a dealer in hope.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The important thing is not that we can live on hope alone  but that life is not worth living without it.
author: Harvey Milk

quote: Hope and patience are two sovereign remedies for all  the surest reposals  the softest cushions to lean on in adversity.
author: Robert Burton

quote: It has never been  and never will be  easy work! But the road that is built in hope is more pleasant to the traveler than the road built in despair  even though they both lead to the same destination.
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope or confidence.
author: Helen Keller

quote: We want to create hope for the person ... we must give hope  always hope.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Take hope from the heart of man and you make him a beast of prey.
author: Ouida

quote: Hope! Of all the ills that men endure  the only cheap and universal cure.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: Our greatest good  and what we least can spare  is hope.
author: John Armstrong

quote: Hope is the last thing that dies in man.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Hope is the major weapon against the suicide impulse.
author: Dr. Karl Menninger

quote: Refusal to hope is nothing more than a decision to die.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: We must have hope or starve to death.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: When hope is taken away from the people  moral degeneration follows swiftly after.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Man can live about forty days without food  about three days without water  about eight minutes without air ... but only for one second without hope.
author: Hal Lindsey

quote: To eat bread without hope is still slowly to starve to death.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Hope is the last thing ever lost.
author: Italian proverb

quote: Faith walks simply  childlike  between the darkness of human life and the hope of what is to come.
author: Catherine de Hueck Doherty

quote: My faith is important. I have nothing without it.
author: Kathy Ireland

quote: Hope is the belief  more or less strong  that joy will come  desire is the wish it may come.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: There is nothing that fear or hope does not make men believe.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Hope is the parent of faith.
author: C. A. Bartol

quote: No hope  no action.
author: Peter Levi

quote: Hope is one of the principal springs that keep mankind in motion.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Hope arouses  as nothing else can arouse  a passion for the possible.
author: William Sloane Coffin

quote: Hope is the first thing to take some sort of action.
author: John Armstrong

quote: Hope is a vigorous principle ... it sets the head and heart to work  and animates a man to do his utmost.
author: Jeremy Collier

quote: It is the around-the-corner brand of hope that prompts people to action  while the distant hope acts as an opiate.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Hope is the pillar that holds up the world. Hope is the dream of a waking man.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: Hope is a waking dream.
author: Aristotle

quote: Hope is but the dream of those that wake.
author: Matthew Prior

quote: Hope is not a dream  but a way of making dreams become reality.
author: L. J. Cardinal Suenens

quote: Hope is the second soul of the unhappy.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Hope is the positive mode of awaiting the future.
author: Emil Brunner

quote: All shall be well  and all shall be well  and all manner of things shall be well.
author: Julian of Norwich

quote: If we were logical  the future would be bleak indeed. But we are more than logical. We are human beings  and we have faith  and we have hope  and we can work.
author: Jacques Cousteau

quote: Clouds and darkness surround us  yet heaven is just  and the day of triumph will surely come  when justice and truth will be vindicated. Our wrongs will be made right  and we will once more taste the blessings of freedom.
author: Mary Todd Lincoln

quote: If winter comes  can spring be far behind?
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: There is no medicine like hope  no incentive so great  and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something tomorrow.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: "Wait'll next year!" is the favorite cry of baseball fans  football fans  hockey fans  and gardeners.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Hope and patience are two sovereign remedies for all  the surest reposals  the softest cushions to lean on in adversity.
author: Robert Burton

quote: Stars will blossom in the darkness  Violets bloom beneath the snow.
author: Julia Dorr

quote: Patience is the art of hoping.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Hope is patience with the lamp lit.
author: Tertullian

quote: All human wisdom is summed up in two words-wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: Hope is some extraordinary spiritual grace that God gives us to control our fears  not to oust them.
author: Vincent NcNabb

quote: Where no hope is left  is left no fear.
author: John Milton

quote: There is no hope unmingled with fear  and no fear unmingled with hope.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: I steer my bark with hope in my heart  leaving fear astern.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: When you say a situation or a person is hopeless  you are slamming the door in the face of God.
author: Charles L. Allen

quote: There are no hopeless situations  there are only men who have grown hopeless about them.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: Hope never abandons you  you abandon it.
author: George Weinberg

quote: Other men see only a hopeless end  but the Christian rejoices in an endless hope.
author: Gilbert M. Beeken

quote: Never despair.
author: Horace

quote: One should ... be able to see things as hopeless and yet be determined to make them otherwise.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Hell is the place where one has ceased to hope.
author: A. J. Cronin

quote: Extreme hopes are born of extreme misery.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Hope is brightest when it dawns from fears.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: Hope is like a road in the country  there was never a road  but when many people walk on it  the road comes into existence.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: While there's life  there's hope.
author: Terence

quote: When you're depressed  the whole body is depressed  and it translates to the cellular level. The first objective is to get your energy up  and you can do it through play. It's one of the most powerful ways of breaking up hopelessness and bringing energy into the situation.
author: O. Carl Simonton

quote: Every area of trouble gives out a ray of hope  and the one unchangeable certainty is that nothing is certain or unchangeable.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Hope is the poor man's bread.
author: Gary Herbert

quote: Oh  what a valiant faculty is hope.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Hope is a risk that must be run.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Hope is an adventure  a going forward  a confident search for a rewarding life.
author: Dr. Karl Menninger

quote: Appetite  with an opinion of attaining  is called hope  the same  without such opinion  despair.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Hope is a satisfaction unto itself  and need not be fulfilled to be appreciated.
author: Dr. Fred O. Henker

quote: Hope is desire and expectation rolled into one.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: To hope is to enjoy.
author: Jacques Delille

quote: Hope  that star of life's tremulous ocean.
author: Paul Moon James

quote: Hope is the word which God has written on the brow of every man.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul and sings the tune without words and never stops at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Hope is not the conviction that something will turn out well but the certainty that something makes sense  regardless of how it turns out.
author: Vaclav Havel

quote: Hope is a light diet  but very stimulating.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Hope is the power of being cheerful in circumstances which we know to be desperate.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Honor begets honor  trust begets trust  faith begets faith  and hope is the mainspring of life.
author: Henry L. Stimson

quote: Hope is a song in a weary throat.
author: Pauli Murray

quote: Hope ... is not a feeling  it is something you do.
author: Katherine Paterson

quote: Hope is the thing with feathers That perches in the soul  And sings the tune without the words  And never stops at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Hope  like the gleaming taper's light  adorns and cheers our way  And still  as darker grows the night  emits a lighter ray.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Grass grows at last above all graves.
author: Julia Dorr

quote: The happy ending is our national belief.
author: Mary McCarthy

quote: Nobody really cares if you're miserable  so you might as well be happy.
author: Cynthia Nelms

quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Just as dumb creatures are snared by food  human beings would not be caught unless they had a nibble of hope.
author: Petronius

quote: Ten thousand men possess ten thousand hopes.
author: Euripides

quote: Hope has as many lives as a cat or a king.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Have hope. Though clouds environs now  And gladness hides her face in scorn  Put thou the shadow from thy brow - No night but hath its morn.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: In time of trouble avert not thy face from hope  for the soft marrow abi-deth in the hard bone.
author: Hafez

quote: In the face of uncertainty  there is nothing wrong with hope.
author: O. Carl Simonton

quote: Hope is the only bee that makes honey without flowers.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Hope is a very unruly emotion.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: The hopeful man sees success where others see failure  sunshine where others see shadows and storm.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: The wind was cold off the mountains and I was a naked man with enemies behind me  and nothing before me but hope.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: I always entertain great hopes.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Hold your head high  stick your chest out. You can make it. It gets dark sometimes but morning comes. ... Keep hope alive.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: Forgiving means to pardon the unpardonable  Faith means believing the unbelievable  And hoping means to hope when things are hopeless.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The gift we can offer others is so simple a thing as hope.
author: Daniel Berrigan

quote: Even the cry from the depths is an affirmation: why cry if there is no hint of hope of hearing?
author: Martin Marty

quote: It's never too late-in fiction or in life-to revise.
author: Nancy Thayer

quote: In the night of death  hope sees a star  and listening love can hear the rustle of a wing.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Man's mind is not a container to be filled but rather a fire to be kindled.
author: Dorothea Brande

quote: We live on the leash of our senses.
author: Diane Ackerman

quote: Just because a man lacks the use of his eyes doesn't mean he lacks vision.
author: Stevie Wonder

quote: True vision is always twofold. It involves emotional comprehensions as well as physical perception.
author: Ross Parmenter

quote: We all live under the same sky  but we don't all have the same horizon.
author: Konrad Adenauer

quote: My imagination makes me human and makes me a fool  it gives me all the world and exiles me from it.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: A fool sees not the same tree that a wise man sees.
author: William Blake

quote: Little girls are cute and small only to adults. To one another they are not cute. They are life-sized.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: You can always trust information given you by people who are crazy  they have an access to truth not available through regular channels.
author: Sheila Ballantyne

quote: Who is the wise man? He who sees what's going to be born.
author: Solomon

quote: Guido the plumber and Michelangelo obtained their marble from the same quarry  but what each saw in the marble made the difference between a nobleman's sink and a brilliant sculpture.
author: Bob Kail

quote: A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it  bearing within him the image of a cathedral.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: By going over your day in imagination before you begin it  you can begin acting successfully at any moment.
author: Dorothea Brande

quote: A daydreamer is prepared for most things.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: All acts performed in the world begin in the imagination.
author: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison

quote: The engineering is secondary to the vision.
author: Cynthia Ozick

quote: Dreams grow holy put in action  work grows fair through starry dreaming. But where each flows on unmingling  both are fruitless and in vain.
author: Adelaide Proctor

quote: Man can only become what he is able to consciously imagine  or to "image forth."
author: Dane Rudhyar

quote: I believe that you cannot go any further than you can think. I certainly believe if you don't desire a thing  you will never get it.
author: Charleszetta Waddles

quote: To the sick  while there is life there is hope.
author: Cicero

quote: Abandon hope  all ye who enter here.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: A woman's hopes are woven of sunbeams  a shadow annihilates them.
author: George Eliot

quote: Hope for the best  but prepare for the worst.
author: English proverb

quote: Youth fades  love droops  the leaves of friendship fall  A mother's secret hope outlives them all.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Hope says to us constantly  "Go on  go on " and leads us thus to the grave.
author: Mme. de Maintenon

quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick.
author: Proverbs

quote: Who against hope believed in hope.
author: Romans

quote: The sickening pang of hope deferr'd.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Hope is the poor man's bread.
author: Thales

quote: You may lead a horse to water but you can't make him drink.
author: English proverb

quote: One white foot - buy him: Two white feet - try him  Three white feet - look well about him  Four white feet - go without him.
author: Old English Rhyme

quote: Let me live in my house by the side of the road  And be a friend to man.
author: Sam Walter Foss

quote: For 't is always fair weather When good fellows get together With a stein on the table and a good song ringing clear.
author: Richard Hovey

quote: I was an hungered  and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty and ye gave me drink. I was a stranger  and ye took me in.
author: Matthew

quote: For I  who hold sage Homer's rule the best  Welcome the coming  speed the going guest.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Houses are built to live in  and not to look on.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Fools build houses  and wise men buy them.
author: English proverb

quote: He that lives in a glass house must not throw stones.
author: English proverb

quote: A foolish man... built his house upon the sand.
author: Matthew

quote: A sudden  bold  and unexpected question doth many times surprise a man and lay him open.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Charity is injurious unless it helps the recipient to become independent of it.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Diplomacy is the art of saying "nice doggie" until you can find a rock.
author: Will Rogers

quote: I present myself to you in a form suitable to the relationship I wish to achieve with you.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: I respect only those who resist me  but cannot tolerate them.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: I wish everybody would go back into the closet.
author: Josefa Heifetz

quote: It is in vain to hope to please all alike. Let a man stand with his face in what direction he will  he must necessarily turn his back on one half of the world.
author: George Dennison Prentice

quote: Modern dancers give a sinister portent about our times. The dancers don't even look at one another. They are just a lot of isolated individuals jiggling in a kind of self-hypnosis and dancing with others only to remind themselves that we are not completely alone in this world.
author: Agnes de Mille

quote: One kind word can warm three winter months.
author: Japanese saying

quote: The easiest kind of relationship for me is with 10 000 people. The hardest is with one.
author: Joan Baez

quote: The opinions which we hold of one another  our relations with friends and kinsfolk are in no sense permanent  save in appearance  but are as eternally fluid as the sea itself.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: The ultimate indignity is to be given a bedpan by a stranger who calls you by your first name.
author: Maggie Kuhn

quote: There is no society or conversation to be kept up in the world without good nature  or something which must bear its appearance and supply its place. For this reason  mankind have been forced to invent a kind of artificial humanity  which is what we express by the word Good Breeding.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: When you live next to the cemetery  you cannot weep for everyone.
author: Old saying

quote: Almost all of our relationships begin  and most of them continue  as forms of mutual exploitation  a mental or physical barter  to be terminated when one or both parties run out of goods.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: When you meet anyone in the flesh you realize immediately that he is a human being and not a sort of caricature embodying certain ideas. It is partly for this reason that I don't mix much in literary circles  because I know from experience that once I have met and spoken to anyone I shall never again be able to feel any intellectual brutality towards him  even when I feel I ought to - like the Labour M.P.s who get patted on the back by dukes and are lost forever more.
author: George Orwell

quote: The wisest man I have ever known once said to me: 'Nine out of every ten people improve on acquaintance ' and I have found his words true.
author: Frank Swinnerton

quote: I am a part of all that I have met.
author: Lord Tennyson

quote: At the heart of our friendly or purely social relations  there lurks a hostility momentarily cured but recurring in fits and starts.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: We rarely confide in those who are better than we are.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A sense of duty is useful in work  but offensive in personal relations. People wish to be liked  not be endured with patient resignation.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The fact is that the possession of a highly social conscience about large-scale issues is no guarantee whatever of reasonable conduct in private relations.
author: Lewis Hastings

quote: With three or more people there is something bold in the air: direct things get said which would frighten two people alone and conscious of each inch of their nearness to one another. To be three is to be in public - you feel safe.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Acquaintance  n: a person whom we know well enough to borrow from  but not well enough to lend to.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: In any relationship we feel an unconscious need to create  as it were  a new picture  a new edition of ourselves to present to the fresh person who claims our interest  for them  we in a strange sense wish to  and do  start life anew.
author: Ann N. Bridge

quote: Only the person who has faith in himself is able to be faithful to others.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: We accept every person in the world as that for which he gives himself out  only he must give himself out for something. We can put up with the unpleasant more easily than we can endure the insignificant.
author: Goethe

quote: Each of us keeps  battened down inside himself  a sort of lunatic giant -impossible socially  but full-scale. It's the knockings and batterings we sometimes hear in each other that keep our intercourse from utter banality.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: We wander through this life together in a semi-darkness in which none of us can distinguish exactly the features of his neighbour. Only from time to time  through some experience that we have of our companion  or through some remark that he passes  he stands for a moment close to us  as though illuminated by a flash of lightning. Then we see him as he really is.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: A loving person lives in a loving world. A hostile person lives in a hostile world: everyone you meet is your mirror.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: It is always safe to assume that people are more subtle and less sensitive than they seem.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: A modest man is usually admired - if people ever hear of him.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: When the Quaker Penn kept his hat on in the royal presence  Charles (King Charles II) politely removed his  explaining that it was the custom in that place for only one person at a time to remain covered.
author: Arthur Bryant

quote: If you treat men the way they are you never improve them. If you treat them the way you want them to be  you do.
author: Goethe

quote: See everything: overlook a great deal: correct a little.
author: Pope John XXIII

quote: A hundred times every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life depend on the labours of other men  living and dead  and that I must exert myself in order to give in the same measure as I have received.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: At bottom the world isn't a joke. We only joke about it to avoid an issue with someone  to let someone know that we know he's there with his questions  to disarm him by seeming to have heard and done justice to his side of the standing argument.
author: Robert Frost

quote: I reckon there's as much human nature in some folks as there is in others  if not more.
author: Edward Noyes Westcott

quote: If only there were evil people somewhere  insidiously committing evil deeds  and it were necessary only to separate them from the rest of us and destroy them. But the line dividing good and evil cuts through the heart of every human being. And who is willing to destroy a piece of his own heart?
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: Science may have found a cure for most evils: but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all - the apathy of human beings.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The go-between wears out a thousand sandals.
author: Japanese proverb

quote: Life is livable because we know that wherever we go most of the people we meet will be restrained in their actions toward us by an almost instinctive network of taboos.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: It is well to remember that the entire population of the universe  with one trifling exception  is composed of others.
author: John Andrew Holmes

quote: Our concern is not how to worship in the catacombs but how to remain human in the skyscrapers.
author: Abraham J. Heschel

quote: Our humanity were a poor thing but for the divinity that stirs within us.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: I love my country better than my family  but I love humanity better than my country.
author: Francois Fenelon

quote: Wen you see a man in woe  Walk right up and say "hullo." Say "hullo" and "how d'ye do " "How's the world a-usin' you?"
author: Sam Walter Foss

quote: He held his seat  a friend to human race.
author: Homer

quote: Humanitarianism consists in never sacrificing a human being to a purpose.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Oh  God! that bread should be so dear  And flesh and blood so cheap!
author: Thomas Hood

quote: Every human heart is human.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: After all there is but one race - humanity.
author: George Moore

quote: The world is my country  all mankind are my brethren  and to do good is my religion.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Humanity is the Son of God.
author: Theodore Parker

quote: I am not an Athenian  nor a Greek  but a citizen of the world.
author: Socrates

quote: The age of chivalry has gone  the age of humanity has come.
author: Charles Sumner

quote: I am a man  I count nothing human foreign to me.
author: Terence

quote: Our true nationality is mankind.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: After crosses and losses  men grow humbler and wiser.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: 'Umble we are  'umble we have been  'umble we shall ever be.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: In humility imitate Jesus and Socrates.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: I believe the first test of a truly great man is his humility.
author: John Ruskin

quote: My wife never lies about her age. She just tells everyone she's as old as I am. Then she lies about my age.
author: Robert Orben

quote: The best contraceptive for old people is nudity.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: My health is good  it's my age that's bad.
author: Roy Acuff

quote: He's so old his social security number is two digits.
author: Brian Morgan

quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to forget it once.
author: E. Joseph Cossman

quote: There are three signs of old age: loss of memory ... I forget the other two.
author: Red Skelton

quote: If you want to know how old a woman is . . . ask her sister-in-law.
author: Edgar Howe

quote: My wife loves Europe  but to me it's a bad day at a theme park.
author: Jay Leno

quote: Hollywood is a place where people from Iowa mistake each other for movie stars.
author: Fred Allen

quote: It is possible to live in San Francisco for $35 000 a year. Obviously  that doesn't include food or lodging.
author: Kenn Carlson

quote: Flying from the U.S. to Tokyo takes approximately as long as law school.
author: Dave Barry

quote: France is the only country where the money falls apart and you can't tear the toilet paper.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: When people ask me if I have any spare change  I tell them I have it at home in my spare wallet.
author: Nick Arnette

quote: My wife is a sex object - every time I ask for sex  she objects.
author: Les Dawson

quote: You're not drunk if you can lie on the floor without holding on.
author: Dean Martin

quote: My sister says she never seems to get it together . . . either her rear looks good or her face does.
author: Sally Bucko

quote: I wanted to marry her when I saw the moonlight shining on the barrel of her father's shotgun.
author: Eddie Albert

quote: I was the best man at the wedding. So why is she marrying him?
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: Father giving advice to son: Never do anything once around the house that you don't want to do for the rest of your life.
author: Frank Briggs

quote: Marriage is like a violin. After the beautiful music is over  the strings are still attached.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: My husband will never chase another woman. He's too fine  too decent  too old.
author: Grade Allen

quote: Never get married in the morning  because you never know who you'll meet that night.
author: Paul Hornung

quote: American women expect to find in their husbands a perfection that English women only hope to find in their butlers.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Behind every successful man you'll find a woman who has nothing to wear.
author: Harold Coffin

quote: Men have a much better time of it than women. For one thing  they marry later. For another thing  they die earlier.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: A man is a person who will pay two dollars for a one-dollar item he wants. A woman will pay one dollar for a two-dollar item she doesn't want.
author: William Binger

quote: A man should be taller  older  heavier  uglier and hoarser than his wife.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Men like cars  women like clothes. Women only like cars because they take them to clothes.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Men don't get cellulite. God might just be a man.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Boys don't make passes at female smart asses.
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

quote: Can you imagine a world without men? No crime and lots of happy fat women.
author: Marion Smith

quote: People who work sitting down get paid more than people who work standing up.
author: Ogden Nash

author: Thomas Szasz

author: Woody Allen
