author: Winston Churchill

quote: Nobody is poor unless he stand in need of justice.
author: Lactantius

quote: The hungry judges soon the sentence sign  and wretches hang that jurymen may dine.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: There is no such thing as justice - in or out of court.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: Justice is too good for some people  and not good enough for the rest.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: Injustice never rules forever.
author: Seneca

quote: Acquittal of the guilty damns the judge.
author: Horace

quote: There is no virtue so truly great and godlike as justice.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The path of the just is as the shining light  that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
author: Proverbs

quote: There is no such thing as justice - in or out of court.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: Delay of justice is injustice.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: The spirits of just men made perfect.
author: Hebrews

quote: God's mill grinds slow  but sure.
author: George Herbert

quote: The sword of the law should never fall but on those whose guilt is so apparent as to be pronounced by their friends as well as foes.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Render therefore to all their dues.
author: Romans

quote: He who decides a case without hearing the other side  though he decide justly  cannot be considered just.
author: Seneca

quote: Let justice be done  though the heavens fall.
author: William Watson

quote: Have you had a kindness shown? Pass it on  'Twas not given for thee alone  Pass it on  Let it travel down the years  Let it wipe another's tears  Til in Heaven the deed appears  -  Pass it on.
author: Rev. Henry Burton

quote: Their cause I plead - plead it in heart and mind  A fellow-feeling makes one wondrous kind.
author: David Garrick

quote: Kindness gives birth to kindness.
author: Sophocles

quote: Gin a body meets a body Comin' through the rye. Gin a body kiss a body Need a body cry?
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Come  lay thy head upon my breast  And I will kiss thee into rest.
author: Lord Byron

quote: It was thy kiss  Love  that made me immortal.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: Give me a kisse  and to that kisse a score  Then to that twenty  adde a hundred more  A thousand to that hundred  so kisse on  To make that thousand up a million  Treble that million  and when that is done  Let's kisse afresh  as when we first begun.
author: Robert Herrick

quote: A long  long kiss  a kiss of youth  and love.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Stolen kisses are always sweetest.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: Jenny kissed me when we met  Jumping from the chair she sat in  Time  you thief  who love to get Sweets into your list  put that in. Say I'm weary  say I'm sad  Say that health and wealth have missed me  Say I'm growing old  but add Jenny kissed me.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: See! the mountains kiss high heaven  And the waves clasp one another  No sister flower would be forgiven If it disdained its brother  And the sunlight clasps the earth  And the moonbeams kiss the sea: -  What are all these kissings worth  If thou kiss not me?
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Lord! I wonder what fool it was that first invented kissing.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Drink to me only with thine eyes And I will pledge with mine  Or leave a kiss but in the cup  And I'll not look for wine.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: Soul meets soul on lovers' lips.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: All men by nature desire to know.
author: Aristotle

quote: I have tried to know absolutely nothing about a great many things  and I have succeeded fairly well.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: Little minds are interested in the extraordinary  great minds in the commonplace.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Our knowledge can only be finite  while our ignorance must necessarily be infinite.
author: Karl Popper

quote: Pocket all your knowledge with your watch and never pull it out in company unless desired.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: President Reagan didn't always know what he knew.
author: Oliver North

quote: Ten lands are sooner known than one man.
author: Old saying

quote: The public do not know enough to be experts  yet know enough to decide between them.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: There are times I think I am not sure of something which I absolutely know.
author: Mongkut, King of Siam

quote: There are two kinds of statistics  the kind you look up and the kind you make up.
author: Rex Stout

quote: There was never an age in which useless knowledge was more important than in our own.
author: Cyril Joad

quote: We're drowning in information and starving for knowledge.
author: Rutherford D. Rogers

quote: You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough.
author: William Blake

quote: Zeal without knowledge is fire without light.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Our knowledge is a receding mirage in an expanding desert of ignorance.
author: Will Durant

quote: As we acquire more knowledge  things do not become more comprehensible  but more mysterious.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Grace is given of God  but knowledge is bought in the market.
author: Arthur Hugh Clough

quote: If a little knowledge is dangerous - where is the man who has so much as to be out of danger?
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: We owe almost all our knowledge not to those who have agreed  but to those who have differed.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Sit down before fact as a little child  be prepared to give up every preconceived notion  follow humbly wherever and to whatever abyss nature leads  or you shall learn nothing.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: The learned is happy  nature to explore  the fool is happy  that he knows no more.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: One of the greatest joys known to man is to take a flight into ignorance in search of knowledge.
author: Robert Lynd

quote: I do not pretend to know what many ignorant men are sure of.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: A man only understands what is akin to something already existing in himself.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Everybody gets so much common information all day long that they lose their common sense.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Anyone who stops learning is old  whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. The greatest thing in life is to keep your mind young.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The first problem for all of us  men and women  is not to learn  but to unlearn.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: We should live and learn  but by the time we've learned  it's too late to live.
author: Carolyn Wells

quote: The specialist is a man who fears the other subjects.
author: Martin H. Fisher

quote: All that men really understand is confined to a very small compass  to their daily affairs and experience  to what they have an opportunity to know  and motives to study or practise. The rest is affectation and imposture.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: There is much pleasure to be gained from useless knowledge.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Every great advance in natural knowledge has involved the absolute rejection of authority.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: It isn't what we don't know that gives us trouble  it's what we know that ain't so.
author: Will Rogers

quote: In all affairs  love  religion  politics or business  it's a healthy idea  now and then  to hang a question mark on things you have long taken for granted.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The simplest questions are the hardest to answer.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: They know enough who know how to learn.
author: Henry Adams

quote: I take all knowledge to be my province.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: To be conscious that you are ignorant is a great step to knowledge.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: For knowledge  too  is itself a power.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: The only good is knowledge  and the only evil ignorance.
author: Diogenes

quote: One cannot know everything.
author: Horace

quote: He who knows others is learned  He who knows himself is wise.
author: Lao-Tsze

quote: It ain't the things you don't know what gets you into trouble  it's the things you know for sure what ain't so.
author: Negro Saying

quote: He that hath knowledge spareth his words.
author: Proverbs

quote: Then I began to think  that it is very true which is commonly said  that the one-half of the world knoweth not how the other half liveth.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: Know thyself.
author: Socrates

quote: As for me  all I know is that I know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: They can expect nothing but their labor for their pains.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: For as labor cannot produce without the use of land  the denial of the equal right to use of land is necessarily the denial of the right of labor to its own produce.
author: Henry George

quote: A truly American sentiment recognises the dignity of labor and the fact that honor lies in honest toil.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: Shall you complain who feed the world? Who clothe the world? Who house the world? Shall you complain who are the world  Of what the world may do? As from this hour You use your power  The world must follow you!
author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

quote: Labor conquers all things.
author: Homer

quote: God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb.
author: English proverb

quote: Mary had a little lamb It's fleece was white as snow  And everywhere that Mary went The lamb was sure to go.
author: Sarah J. Hale

quote: Like lambs to the slaughter.
author: Jeremiah

quote: The small landholders are the most precious part of a state.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The land shall not be sold for ever: for the land is mine  for ye are strangers and sojourners with me.
author: Leviticus

quote: That which is built upon the land goes with the land.
author: Legal maxim

quote: I am the King of Rome  and above grammar.
author: Holy Roman Emperor Sigismund

quote: Language  as well as the faculty of speech  was the immediate gift of God.
author: Noah Webster

quote: Language is not an abstract construction of the learned  or of dictionary-makers  but is something arising out of the work  needs  ties  joys  affections  tastes  of long generations of humanity  and has its bases broad and low  close to the ground.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Rise with the lark  and with the lark to bed.
author: James Hurdis

quote: Hail to thee  blithe Spirit! Bird thou never wert  That from Heaven  or near it  Pourest thy full heart In profuse strains of unpremeditated art.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: He laughs best who laughs last.
author: Old English Proverb

quote: To provoke laughter without joining in it greatly heightens the effect.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: I hasten to laugh at everything  for fear of being obliged to weep.
author: Pierre Beaumarchais

quote: The man who cannot laugh is not only fit for treasons  strategems  and spoils  but his whole life is already a treason and a stratagem.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Man is the only creature endowed with the power of laughter.
author: Charles C. Grevvile

quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you  Weep and you weep alone  For the sad old earth must borrow its mirth  But has trouble enough of its own.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: Nothing is more silly than silly laughter.
author: Catullus

quote: Appeal in law: to put the dice into the box for another throw.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Divorce is a game played by lawyers.
author: Cary Grant

quote: Far more has been accomplished for the welfare and progress of mankind by preventing bad actions than by doing good ones.
author: William Lyon Mackenzie King

quote: In England  justice is open to all - like the Ritz Hotel.
author: Sir James Mathew

quote: It is as if the ordinary language we use every day has a hidden set of signals  a kind of secret code.
author: William Stafford

quote: It usually takes 100 years to make a law  and then  after it's done its work  it usually takes 100 years to be rid of it.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Law is the witness and external deposit of our moral life. Its history is the history of the moral development of the race.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Laws are the spider's webs which  if anything small falls into them they ensnare it  but large things break through and escape.
author: Solon

quote: Lawyers are the only persons in whom ignorance of the law is not punished.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Lawyers spend a great deal of time shovelling smoke.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Revenge is a kind of wild justice  which the more man's nature runs to  the more ought law to weed it out.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: That is the beauty of the Common Law  it is a maze and not a motorway.
author: Lord Diplock

quote: The law of England is a very strange one  it cannot compel anyone to tell the truth. . . . But what the law can do is to give you seven years for not telling the truth.
author: Lord Darling

quote: You are remembered for the rules you break.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: Law ... begins when someone takes to doing something someone else does not like.
author: Karl Llewellyn

quote: Show me the man and I'll show you the law.
author: David Ferguson

quote: A man may as well open an oyster without a knife  as a lawyer's mouth without a fee.
author: Barten Holyday

quote: No matter whether the Constitution follows the flag or not  the Supreme Court follows the election returns.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: When you have no basis for an argument  abuse the plaintiff.
author: Cicero

quote: The adversary system is a kind of warfare in mufti.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: A jury consists of twelve persons chosen to decide who has the better lawyer.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Lawyers are men who hire out their words and anger.
author: Martial

quote: Litigant: a person about to give up his skin for the hope of retaining his bone.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: In America  an acquittal doesn't mean you're innocent  it means you beat the rap. My clients lose even when they win.
author: F. Lee Bailey

quote: Law and order is one of the steps taken to maintain injustice.
author: Edward Bond

quote: Whatever is enforced by command is more imputed to him who exacts than to him who performs.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The life of the law has not been logic: it has been experience.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Every new time will give its law.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Lawyers and painters can soon change white to black.
author: Danish proverb

quote: No man is above the law and no man is below it: nor do we ask any man's permission when we ask him to obey it.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Fragile as reason is and limited as law is as the institutionalized medium of reason  that's all we have standing between us and the tyranny of mere will and the cruelty of unbridled  undisciplined feeling.
author: Felix Frankfurter

quote: A lawyer's dream of heaven - every man reclaimed his property at the resurrection  and each tried to recover it from all his forefathers.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: A vague uneasiness  the police. It's like when you suddenly understand you have to undress in front of the doctor.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: A successful lawsuit is the one worn by a policeman.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Those who are too lazy and comfortable to think for themselves and be their own judges obey the laws. Others sense their own laws within them.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Every skilled person is to be believed with reference to his own art.
author: Legal maxim

quote: An excess of law inescapably weakens the rule of law.
author: Laurence H. Tribe

quote: A judge is a law student who marks his own examination papers.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: I understand you undertake to overthrow my undertaking.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: I know of no method to secure the repeal of bad or obnoxious laws so effective as their stringent execution.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: Law school taught me one thing: how to take two situations that are exactly the same and show how they are different.
author: Hart Pomerantz

quote: To some lawyers  all facts are created equal.
author: Felix Frankfurter

quote: And whether you're an honest man  or whether you're a thief  depends on whose solicitor has given me my brief.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: The law  in its majestic equality  forbids the rich as well as the poor to sleep under bridges  to beg in the streets  and to steal bread.
author: Anatole France

quote: In cross-examination  as in fishing  nothing is more ungainly than a fisherman pulled into the water by his catch.
author: Louis Nizer

quote: Well  I don't know as I want a lawyer to tell me what I cannot do. I hire him to tell me how to do what I want to do.
author: J. P. Morgan

quote: The law must be stable and yet it must not stand still.
author: Roscoe Pound

quote: An appeal is when ye ask wan court to show its contempt for another court.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: Law is nothing unless close behind it stands a warm  living public opinion.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: If there were no bad people  there would be no good lawyers.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The aim of law is the maximum gratification of the nervous system of man.
author: Learned Hand

quote: Laws  like the spider's web  catch the fly and let the hawk go free.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Law is a bottomless pit.
author: J. Arbuthnot

quote: Possession is eleven points in the law.
author: Colley Cibber

quote: After an existence of nearly twenty years of almost innocuous desuetude these laws are brought forth.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: Reason is the life of the law  nay  the common law itself is nothing else but reason. The law which is perfection of reason.
author: Sir Edward Coke

quote: "If the law supposes that " said Mr. Bumble  "the law is a ass  a idiot."
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Be you never so high  the law is above you.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Laws too gentle are seldom obeyed  too severe  seldom executed.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The English laws punish vice  the Chinese laws do more  they reward virtue.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Laws grind the poor  and rich men rule the law.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: I know no method to secure the repeal of bad or obnoxious laws so effective as their stringent execution.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: If the law is upheld only by government officials  then all law is at an end.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: The execution of the laws is more important than the making of them.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The laws sometimes sleep  but never die.
author: Law Maxim

quote: All things obey fixed laws.
author: Marcus Manilius

quote: Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Cae-
author: Matthew

quote: There is no man so good  who  were he to submit all his thoughts and actions to the laws would not deserve hanging ten times in his life.
author: Michel Montaigne

quote: Where law ends  there tyranny begins.
author: William Pitt

quote: Our wrangling lawyers are so litigious and busy here on earth  that I think they will plead their clients' causes hereafter  some of them in hell.
author: Henry Burton

quote: It is a secret worth knowing that lawyers rarely go to law.
author: Moses Crowell

quote: A lawyer's opinion is worth nothing unless paid for.
author: English proverb

quote: Most good lawyers live well  work hard  and die poor.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: The lust for comfort  that stealthy thing that enters the house a guest and then becomes a host  and then a master.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: The lazy man gets round the sun as quickly as the busy one.
author: R. T. Wombat

quote: Tomorrow is often the busiest day of the year.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: The lazy are always wanting to do something.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Some folks can look so busy doing nothin' that they seem indispensable.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: Indolence is a delightful but distressing state. We must be doing something to be happy.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Failure is not our only punishment for laziness: there is also the success of others.
author: Jules Renard

quote: He who would rule must hear and be deaf  see and be blind.
author: German proverb

quote: I know I have the body of a weak and feeble woman  but I have the heart and stomach of a King  and of a King of England too.
author: Elizabeth I

quote: It is a characteristic of all movements and crusades that the psychopathic element rises to the top.
author: Robert Lindner

quote: It is much safer to obey than to rule.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: It is said that Mr. Gladstone could persuade most people of most things  and himself of anything.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: It is the characteristic excellence of the strong man that he can bring momentous issues to the fore and make a decision about them. The weak are always forced to decide between alternatives they have not chosen themselves.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: Nothing is more difficult  and therefore more precious  than to be able to decide.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: There are two levers for moving men - interest and fear.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: To get others to come into our ways of thinking  we must go over to theirs  and it is necessary to follow  in order to lead.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: With a good conscience our only sure reward  with history the final judge of our deeds  let us go forth to lead the land we love asking His blessing and His help  but knowing that here on earth God's work must truly be our own.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Achilles absent  was Achilles still.
author: Homer

quote: To lead the people  walk behind them.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: I suppose leadership at one time meant muscles  but today it means getting along with people.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: When you come into the presence of a leader of men  you know that you have come into the presence of fire - that it is best not uncautiously to touch that man - that there is something that makes it dangerous to cross him.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: I've got to follow them - I am their leader.
author: Alexandre Ledru-Rollin

quote: The reward of a general is not a bigger tent - but command.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: A leader may symbolize and express what is best in his people  like Pericles  or what is worst  like Hitler  but he cannot successfully express what is only in his heart and not in theirs.
author: Charles Yost

quote: A true leader always keeps an element of surprise up his sleeve  which others cannot grasp but which keeps his public excited and breathless.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: If I advance  follow me! If I retreat  kill me! If I die  avenge me!
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: If I advance  follow me! If I retreat  cut me down! If I die  avenge me!
author: Benito Mussolini

quote: Follow me  if I advance  kill me if I retreat  revenge me if I die!
author: Ngo Dinh Diem

quote: A frightened captain makes a frightened crew.
author: Lister Sinclair

quote: As for the best leaders  the people do not notice their existence. The next best  the people honour and praise. The next  the people fear  and the next the people hate. When the best leader's work is done  the people say  'we did it ourselves!'
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: The slave begins by demanding justice and ends by wanting to wear a crown. He must dominate in his turn.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A leader is a dealer in hope.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: To lead means to direct and to exact  and no man dares do either - he might be unpopular. What authority we are given now is a trinity: the grin  the generality  and God (the Word).
author: Marya Mannes

quote: Dictators are rulers who always look good until the last ten minutes.
author: Jan Masaryk

quote: A chief is a man who assumes responsibility. He says  'I was beaten'  he does not say 'My men were beaten.'
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Every man of action has a strong dose of egotism  pride  hardness and cunning. But all those things will be forgiven him  indeed  they will be regarded as high qualities  if he can make them the means to achieve great ends.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: Dictators ride to and fro upon tigers from which they dare not dismount.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: I have no family. My only responsibility is the welfare of Quebec. I belong to the province.
author: Maurice Duplessis

quote: It is better to have a lion at the head of an army of sheep  than a sheep at the head of an army of lions.
author: Daniel Defoe

quote: Where there are no tigers  a wildcat is very self-important.
author: Korean proverb

quote: 'Ah  John A.  John A.  how I love you! How I wish I could trust you!
author: Canadian Liberal politician

quote: I really believe my greatest service is in the many unwise steps I prevent.
author: William Lyon Mackenzie King

quote: I have nothing to offer but blood  toil  tears and sweat.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I have never accepted what many people have kindly said  namely that I have inspired the nation. It was the nation and the race dwelling all around the globe that had the lion heart. I had the luck to be called upon to give the roar.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Winston has written four volumes about himself and called it 'World Crisis'.
author: Arthur Balfour

quote: Winston Churchill - fifty per cent genius  fifty per cent bloody fool.
author: Clement Attlee

quote: The final test of a leader is that he leaves behind in other men the conviction and the will to carry on.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: In Pierre Elliott Trudeau  Canada has at last produced a political leader worthy of assassination.
author: Irving Layton

quote: Every woman's man  and every man's woman.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: When we think we lead we most are led.
author: Lord Byron

quote: An army of stags led by a lion would be better than an army of lions led by a stag.
author: Latin proverb

quote: If the blind lead the blind  both shall fall into the ditch.
author: Matthew

quote: Reason and judgment are the qualities of a leader.
author: Tacitus

quote: It is always in season for old men to learn.
author: Aeschylus

quote: All wish to be learned  but no one is willing to pay the price.
author: Juvenal

quote: Reading maketh a full man  conference a ready man  and writing an exact man.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Wear your learning like your watch  in a private pocket  and do not pull it out and strike it  merely to show that you have one.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: And still they gazed  and still the wonder grew  That one small head should carry all it knew.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: They have learned nothing  and forgotten nothing.
author: Chevalier de Panat

quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing  Drink deep  or taste not the Pierian spring  Their shallow draughts intoxicate the brain  And drinking largely sobers us again.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Men learn while they teach.
author: Seneca

quote: Increased means and increased leisure are the two civi-lizers of man.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Leisure is the mother of philosophy.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: If you lend you either lose the money or gain an enemy.
author: Albanian Proverb

quote: Better give a shilling than lend and lose half a crown.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I have made this letter longer than usual because I lack the time to make it shorter.
author: Pascal

quote: Travellers from afar can lie with impunity.
author: French proverb

quote: Truth is the safest lie.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: All men are born truthful  and die liars.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: It takes a wise man to handle a lie. A fool had better remain honest.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: We pay a person the compliment of acknowledging his superiority whenever we lie to him.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Who lies for you will lie against you.
author: Bosnian proverb

quote: The cruellest lies are often told in silence.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: I do not mind lying  but I hate inaccuracy.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: A little inaccuracy sometimes saves tons of explanations.
author: Saki

quote: A half-truth is a whole lie.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: A liar should have a good memory.
author: Quintilian

quote: Oh  don't tell me of facts - I never believe in facts  you know Canning said nothing was so fallacious as facts  except figures.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Liberalism is trust of the people tempered by prudence  conservatism  distrust of the people tempered by fear.
author: William E. Gladstone

quote: A liberal is a man who is willing to spend somebody else's money.
author: Carter Glass

quote: Liberality consists less in giving much than in giving at the right moment.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: The liberal soul shall be made fat.
author: Proverbs

quote: I am not so much concerned with the right of everyone to say anything he pleases as I am about our need as self-governing people to hear everything relevant.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Rights that do not flow from duty well performed are not worth having.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: So free we seem  so fettered fast we are!
author: Robert Browning

quote: The liberty of the individual must be thus far limited  he must not make himself a nuisance to other people.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: We look forward to a world founded upon four essential human freedoms. The first is freedom of speech and expression - everywhere in the world. The second is freedom of every person to worship God in his own way everywhere in the world. The third is freedom from want...everywhere in the world. The fourth is freedom from fear... anywhere in the world.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Yes  'n' how many years can some people exist before they're allowed to be free? Yes. 'n' how many times can a man turn his head pretending he just doesn't see? The answer  my friend is blowin' in the wind.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: These are the times that try men's souls. The summer soldier and the sunshine patriot will  in this crisis  shrink from the service of their country  but he that stands it now  deserves the love and thanks of man and woman. Tyranny  like hell  is not easily conquered  yet we have this consolation with us  that the harder the conflict  the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: It is a fair summary of history to say that the safeguards of liberty have frequently been forged in cases involving not very nice people.
author: Felix Frankfurter

quote: The spirit of liberty is the spirit which is not too sure that it is right.
author: Learned Hand

quote: Liberty is always dangerous - but it is the safest thing we have.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: Let the word go forth from this time and place  to friend and foe alike  that the torch has been passed to a new generation of Americans - born in this century  tempered by war  disciplined by a hard and bitter peace  proud of our ancient heritage - and unwilling to witness or permit the slow undoing of those human rights to which this nation has always been committed  and to which we are committed today at home and around the world. Let every nation know  whether it wishes us well or ill  that we shall pay any price  bear any burden  meet any hardship  support any friend  oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty. All this will not be finished in the first 100 days. Nor will it be finished in the first 1 000 days  nor in the life of this administration  nor even perhaps in our lifetime on this planet. But let us begin. Now the trumpet summons us again - not as a call to bear arms  though arms we need - not as a call to battle  though embattled we are - but a call to bear the burden of a long twilight struggle  year in and year out  "rejoicing in hope  patient in tribulation"- a struggle against the common enemies of man: tyranny  poverty  disease and war itself. And so  my fellow Americans  ask not what your country can do for you - ask what you can do for your country . My fellow citizens of the world: ask not what America will do for you  but what together we can do for the freedom of man.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: None can love freedom heartily  but good men - the rest love not freedom  but licence.
author: John Milton

quote: One should never put on one's best trousers to go out to battle for freedom and truth.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Man was born free and everywhere he is in shackles.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: For two decades the state has been taking liberties  and these liberties were once ours.
author: E. P. Thompson

quote: By physical liberty I mean the right to do anything which does not interfere with the happiness of another. By intellectual liberty I mean the right to think wrong.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: There can be no real freedom without the freedom to fail.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Liberty  as it is conceived by current opinion  has nothing inherent about it  it is a sort of gift or trust bestowed on the individual by the state pending good behaviour.
author: Mary McCarthy

quote: The right to be heard does not automatically include the right to be taken seriously.
author: Hubert Humphrey

quote: If liberty has any meaning it means freedom to improve.
author: Philip Wylie

quote: Those who expect to reap the blessings of freedom must  like men  undergo the fatigue of supporting it.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Let every nation know  whether it wishes us well or ill  that we shall pay any price  bear any burden  meet any hardship  support any friend  oppose any foe  in order to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The most stringent protection of free speech would not protect a man in falsely shouting fire in a theatre and causing a panic... The question in every case is whether the words used are used in such circumstances and are of such a nature as to create a clear and present danger that they will bring about the substantive evils that Congress has a right to prevent.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Send these  the homeless  tempest toss'd  to me. I lift my lamp beside the golden door.
author: Emma Lazarus

quote: To be truly free  it takes more determination  courage  introspection and restraint than to be in shackles.
author: Pietro Bellusch

quote: Equality of opportunity is an equal opportunity to prove unequal talents.
author: Viscount Samuel

quote: The greatest right in the world is the right to be wrong.
author: Harry Weinberger

quote: We who lived in concentration camps can remember the men who walked through the huts comforting others  giving away their last piece of bread. They may have been few in number  but they offer sufficient proof that everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of human freedoms - to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances - to choose one's own way.
author: Viktor Frankl

quote: The world must be made safe for democracy. Its peace must be planted upon the tested foundations of political liberty. We have no selfish ends to serve. We desire no conquest  no domination. We seek no indemnities for ourselves  no material compensation for the sacrifices we shall freely give. We are but one of the champions of the rights of mankind. We shall be satisfied when those rights have been made as secure as the faith and freedom of nations can make them.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: A free man is as jealous of his responsibilities as he is of his liberties.
author: Cyril James

quote: All free men  wherever they may live  are citizens of Berlin. And therefore  as a free man  I take pride in the words 'Ich bin ein Berliner.'
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Liberty is the right to do what the law permits.
author: Baron de Montesquieu

quote: Once freedom lights its beacon in a man's heart  the gods are powerless against him.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Equality is the result of human organization. We are not born equal.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: When you have robbed a man of everything  he is no longer in your power. He is free again.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: The effect of liberty on individuals is that they may do what they please: we ought to see what it will please them to do  before we risk congratulations.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: We are in bondage to the law in order that we may be free.
author: Cicero

quote: People hardly ever make use of the freedom they have  for example  freedom of thought  instead they demand freedom of speech as a compensation.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: The tree of liberty grows only when watered by the blood of tyrants.
author: Bertrand Barere

quote: The people never give up their liberties but under some delusion.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Liberty's in every blow! Let us do or die.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Eternal vigilance is the price of liberty.
author: John Philpot Curran

quote: Those who would give up essential liberty to purchase a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Give me liberty  or give me death.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: The God who gave us life  gave us liberty at the same time.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Give me your tired  your poor  Your huddled masses  yearning to breathe free  The wretched refuse of your teeming shore. Send these  the homeless  tempest tossed  to me: I lift my lamp beside the golden door.
author: Emma Lazarus

quote: Give me the liberty to know  to think  to believe  and to utter freely according to conscience  above all other liberties.
author: John Milton

quote: 0 liberty! how many crimes are committed in thy name!
author: Mme. Jeanne Roland

quote: Liberty is the only thing you cannot have unless you are willing to give it to others.
author: William Allen White

quote: Liberty and Union  now and for ever  one and inseparable!
author: Daniel Webster

quote: 1 have always in my own thought summed up individual liberty  and business liberty  and every other kind of liberty  in the phrase that is common in the sporting world  "A free field and no favor."
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: If anything happens to me  tell every woman I've ever gone with I was talking about her at the end. That way  they'll have to reevaluate me.
author: Albert Brooks

quote: They say such nice things about people at their funerals that it makes me sad to realize I'm going to miss mine by just a few days.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: I am prepared to meet my Maker. Whether my Maker is prepared for the ordeal of meeting me is another matter.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I don't want to achieve immortality through my work  I want to achieve it through not dying.
author: Woody Allen

quote: I don't want to tell you how much insurance I carry with Prudential. All I can say is: When I go  they go!
author: Jack Benny

quote: The trouble with life in the fast lane is that you get to the other end in an awful hurry.
author: John Jensen

quote: Memorial services are the cocktail parties of the geriatric set.
author: Harold Macmillan

quote: I won't mind dying if I can tell St. Peter a joke he hasn't heard.
author: Red Skelton

quote: My mother always said that every time you do a good deed here on Earth  you're storing up a treasure in heaven. Which means Mother Teresa's probably got some beachfront property up there and I'm up to a box of Milk Duds and a Pez dispenser.
author: Robert G. Lee

quote: Why this fuss about death? Use your imagination  try to visualize a world without death.
author: Charlotte Gilman

quote: Ninety percent of living is just showing up.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Everybody's gotta die sometime. That's life.
author: Archie Bunker

quote: Planned obsolescence isn't a new idea -  God always used it with people.
author: Robert Orben

quote: I want to die like my grandfather died . . . peacefully in his sleep. Not like the other three people screaming in the car.
author: Joey Adams

quote: I don't want to put my life in the hands of any doctor who believes in reincarnation. Give me a good old-fashioned American doc who'll make sure you live to pay that bill.
author: Glen Super

quote: The only thing I regret about my life is the length of it. If I had to live my life again  I'd make all the same mistakes - only sooner.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: Life doesn't imitate art  it imitates bad television.
author: Woody Allen

quote: When fate's got it in for you  there's no limit to what you may have to put up with.
author: Georgette Heyer

quote: I do not believe in an afterlife  although I am bringing a change of underwear.
author: Woody Allen

quote: If life was fair  Elvis would be alive and all the impersonators would be dead.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: The best way to get praise is to die.
author: Italian proverb

quote: No matter how rich you become  how famous or powerful  when you die the size of your funeral will still pretty much depend on the weather.
author: Michael Pritchard

quote: I'm not afraid to die. I just don't want to be there when it happens.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Life is like a B-movie. You don't want to leave in the middle of it  but you don't want to see it again.
author: Ted Turner

quote: Life is something that happens to you while you're making other plans.
author: Margaret Miller

quote: Life is not a dress rehearsal.
author: Rose Tremain

quote: St. Teresa of Avila described our life in this world as like a night in a second-class hotel.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: If your time hasn't come  not even a doctor can kill you.
author: M. A. Perlstein

quote: I know a man who gave up smoking  drinking  sex  and rich food. He was healthy right up to the time he killed himself.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: Death is just nature's way of telling you to slow down.
author: Dick Sharpies

quote: The world is a beautiful place to be born into if you don't mind some people dying all the time or maybe only starving some of the time which isn't half so bad if it isn't you.
author: Laurence Ferlinghetti

quote: A tragedy means always a man's struggle with that which is stronger than man.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: After the game  the king and pawn go into the same box.
author: Italian proverb

quote: All men should strive to learn before they die what they are running from  and to  and why.
author: James Thurber

quote: And how am I to face the odds of man's bedevilment and God's? I  a stranger and afraid in a world I never made.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: I like life. It's something to do. Somewhere on this globe every 10 seconds  there is a woman giving birth to a child. She must be found and stopped.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Cats and monkeys - monkeys and cats - all human life is there.
author: Henry James

quote: Clay lies still but blood's a rover  Breath's a ware that will not keep Up  lad  when the journey's over There'll be time enough to sleep.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: Don't do things to not die  do things to enjoy living. The by-product may be not dying.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: Every man's road in life is marked by the graves of his personal likings.
author: Alexander Smith

quote: Everything I did in my life that was worthwhile I caught Hell for.
author: Earl Warren

quote: I haven't heard of anybody who wants to stop living on account of the cost.
author: F. McKinney Hubbard

quote: I try to take one day at a time  but sometimes several days attack me at once.
author: Ashleigh Brilliant

quote: If there is another world  he lives in bliss If there is none  he made the best of this.
author: Robert Burns

quote: If way to the Better there be  it exacts a full look at the Worst.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: If you won't be better tomorrow than you were today  then what do you need tomorrow for?
author: Rabbi Nahman of Bratslav

quote: Is not this the true romantic feeling - not to desire to escape life  but to prevent life from escaping you.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: Life is a long lesson in humility.
author: Sir James M. Barrie

quote: Life is all memory  except for the one present moment that goes by you so quickly you hardly catch it going.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Life is better than death  I believe  if only because it is less boring and because it has fresh peaches in it.
author: Thomas Walker

quote: Life is for each man a solitary cell whose walls are mirrors.
author: Eugene O'Neill

quote: Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you represents determinism  the way you play it is free will.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: Life is made up of sobs  sniffles and smiles  with sniffles predominating.
author: O. Henry

quote: Life is not having been told that the man has just waxed the floor.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Life is the only art that we are required to practise without preparation  and without being allowed the preliminary trials  the failures and botches  that are essential for the training of a mere beginner.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Magnificently unprepared for the long littleness of life.
author: Frances Cornford

quote: Man arrives as a novice at each age of his life.
author: Sebastien Chamfort

quote: Man wants but little here below nor wants that little long.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Oh for a life of sensations rather than of thoughts.
author: John Keats

quote: Our insignificance is often the cause of our safety.
author: Aesop

quote: Population  when unchecked  increases in a geometrical ratio. Subsistence only increases in an arithmetical ratio.
author: Thomas Robert Malthus

quote: Real life is to most men  a long second best  a perpetual compromise between the ideal and the possible.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Sometimes I wish life had a fast-forward button.
author: Dan Chopin

quote: St. Teresa of Avila described our life in this world as like a night at a second-class hotel.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: The character of human life  like the character of the human condition  like the character of all life  is "ambiguity": the inseparable mixture of good and evil  the true and false  the creative and destructive forces - both individual and social.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: The closing years of life are like the end of a masquerade party  when the masks are dropped.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The expression often used by Mr. Herbert Spencer of the Survival of the Fittest is more accurate and is sometimes equally convenient.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: The flower is the poetry of reproduction. It is the example of the eternal seductiveness of life.
author: Jean Giraudoux

quote: The great business of life is to be  to do  to do without and to depart.
author: John Morley

quote: The Indian Summer of life should be a little sunny and a little sad  like the season  and infinite in wealth and depth of tone - but never hustled.
author: Henry Adams

quote: The loveliest of trees  the cherry now is hung with bloom along the bough  and stands about the woodland ride wearing white for Eastertide.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: The real reason for not committing suicide is because you always know how swell life gets again after the hell is over.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win  you're still a rat.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: The vanity of human life is like a river  constantly passing away  and yet constantly coming on.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The world is made up of people who never quite get into the first team and who just miss the prizes at the flower show.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: There are days when it takes all you've got just to keep up with the losers.
author: Robert Orben

quote: This is the Law of the Yukon  that only the strong shall thrive  That surely the weak shall perish  and only the fit survive.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: We live in what is  but we find 1 000 ways not to face it. Great theatre strengthens our faculty to face it.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: When the world has once begun to use us ill  and afterwards continues the same treatment with less scruple or ceremony  as men do to a whore.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Without duty  life is soft and boneless  it cannot hold itself together.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Life only demands from the strength you possess. Only one feat is possible - not to have run away.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life. It goes on.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Life is ours to be spent  not to be saved.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Life is a luminous halo  a semi-transparent envelope surrounding us from the beginning.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Life is ever since man was born  licking honey from a thorn.
author: Louis Ginsberg

quote: Life is like playing a violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: The first half of our lives is ruined by our parents and the second half by our children.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: The great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: Life is action and passion  therefore  it is required of a man that he should share the passion and action of the time  at peril of being judged not to have lived.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: I have measured out my life with coffee spoons.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: If there is a sin against life  it consists perhaps not so much in despairing of life as in hoping for another  and in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Life can only be understood backwards  but it must be lived forwards.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: O Life! thou art a galling load  Along a rough  a weary road  to wretches such as I.
author: Robert Burns

quote: I am on the side of the unregenerate who affirm the worth of life as an end in itself  as against the saints who deny it.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: The natural rhythm of human life is routine punctuated by orgies.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Were the offer made true  I would engage to run again  from beginning to end  the same career of life. All I would ask should be the privilege of an author  to correct  in a second edition  certain errors of the first.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Life is what happens to us while we are making other plans.
author: Thomas la Mance

quote: The man who has no inner life is the slave of his surroundings.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: People in the West are always getting ready to live.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: You've got to keep fighting - you've got to risk your life every six months to stay alive.
author: Elia Kazan

quote: Unless you can find some sort of loyalty  you cannot find unity and peace in your active living.
author: Josiah Royce

quote: Life  as it is called  is for most of us one long postponement.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Life as we find it is too hard for us  it entails too much pain  too many disappointments  impossible tasks. We cannot do without palliative remedies.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Be intent upon the perfection of the present day.
author: William Law

quote: Life is a long preparation for something that never happens.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: You only live once - but if you work it right  once is enough.
author: Joe E. Lewis

quote: Growth is the only evidence of life.
author: Cardinal Newman

quote: Life is a stranger's sojourn  a night at an inn.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If you're on the merry-go-round  you have to go round.
author: Kent Thompson

quote: Most people get a fair amount of fun out of their lives  but on balance life is suffering and only the very sound or the very foolish imagine otherwise.
author: George Orwell

quote: The truth that many people never understand  until it is too late  is that the more you try to avoid suffering the more you suffer because smaller and more insignificant things begin to torture you in proportion to your fear of being hurt.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: The tragedy of life is not so much what men suffer  but rather what they miss.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: He who despairs of the human condition is a coward  but he who has hope for it is a fool.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Basically  I'm interested in friendship  sex and death.
author: Sharon Riis

quote: Measurement of life should be proportioned rather to the intensity of the experience than to its actual length.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Life is seldom as unendurable as  to judge by the facts  it logically ought to be.
author: Brooks Atkinson

quote: Birth  copulation and death. That's all the facts when you come to brass tacks.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Life is an offensive  directed against the repetitious mechanism of the universe.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: There is no cure for birth and death  save to enjoy the interval.
author: George Santayana

quote: The art of living is more like that of wrestling than of dancing. The main thing is to stand firm and be ready for an unforeseen attack.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: We never live  but we are always in the expectation of living.
author: Voltaire

quote: Life  we learn too late  is in the living  in the tissue of every day and hour.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: There is time for work. And time for love. That leaves no other time.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: It is not the years in your life but the life in your years that counts.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: A single event can awaken within us a stranger totally unknown to us. To live is to be slowly born.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: One hour of life  crowded to the full with glorious action  and filled with noble risks  is worth whole years of those mean observances of paltry decorum.
author: Walter Scott

quote: The good life  as I conceive it  is a happy life. I do not mean that if you are good you will be happy - I mean that if you are happy you will be good.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: He alone deserves liberty and life who daily must win them anew.
author: Goethe

quote: One returns to the place one came from.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: The true meaning of life is to plant trees  under whose shade you do not expect to sit.
author: Nelson Henderson

quote: It is now life and not art that requires the willing suspension of disbelief.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: The great use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.
author: William James

quote: Life is painting a picture  not doing a sum.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Go placidly amid the noise and the haste  and remember what peace there may be in silence. As far as possible without surrender  be on good terms with all persons. Speak your truth quietly and clearly  and listen to others  even the dull and ignorant  they too have their story. Be yourself. Especially do not feign affection. Neither be cynical about love - for in the face of all aridity and disenchantment it is as perennial as the grass. Take kindly the counsel of the years  gracefully surrendering the things of youth. Nurture strength of spirit to shield you in sudden misfortune. But do not distress yourself with imaginings. Many fears are born of fatigue and loneliness. Beyond a wholesome discipline  be gentle with yourself. You are a child of the universe no less than the trees and the stars  you have a right to be here. And whether or not it is clear to you  no doubt the universe is unfolding as it should. Therefore be at peace with God  whatever you conceive Him to be  and whatever your labours and aspirations  in the noisy confusion of life keep peace with your soul. With all its sham  drudgery and broken dreams  it is still a beautiful world.
author: Max Ehrmann

quote: At any given moment life is completely senseless. But viewed over a period  it seems to reveal itself as an organism existing in time  having a purpose  tending in a certain direction.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Without a measureless and perpetual uncertainty  the drama of human life would be destroyed.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: It is better to wear out than to rust out.
author: George Whitefield

quote: My advice to those who are about to begin  in earnest  the journey of life  is to take their heart in one hand and a club in the other.
author: Josh Billings

quote: One must choose in life between boredom and suffering.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: All of life is more or less what the French would call s'imposer - to be able to create one's own terms for what one does.
author: Kenneth Tynan

quote: The power of habit and the charm of novelty are the two adverse forces which explain the follies of mankind.
author: Comtesse Diane

quote: Real life seems to have no plots.
author: Ivy Compton-Burnett

quote: There are two ways to slide easily through life  to believe everything or doubt everything. Both ways save us from thinking.
author: Alfred Korzybski

quote: Life is one long process of getting tired.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Oh  how daily life is. (Ah  que la vie est quotidienne.)
author: Jules Laforgue

quote: Death and taxes and childbirth. There's never any convenient time for any of them.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: We're all in this together - by ourselves.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: Normal day  let me be aware of the treasure you are. Let me learn from you  love you  savour you  bless you before you depart. Let me not pass you by in quest of some rare and perfect tomorrow. Let me hold you while I may  for it will not always be so. One day I shall dig my nails into the earth  or bury my face in the pillow  or stretch myself taut  or raise my hands to the sky  and want  more than all the world  your return.
author: Mary Jean Irion

quote: A proverb is no proverb to you till life has illustrated it.
author: John Keats

quote: Sloppy  raggedy-assed old life. I love it. I never want to die.
author: Dennis Trudell

quote: It is not true that life is one damn thing after another- it's one damn thing over and over.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: In our life there is a single color  as on an artist's palette  which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time  for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: To fear love is to fear life  and those who fear life are already three parts dead.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: We are most alive when we're in love.
author: John Updike

quote: For one human being to love another: that is perhaps the most difficult of our tasks  the ultimate  the last test and proof  the work for which all other work is but preparation.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: And whatever it is that keeps widening your heart  that's Mary  too  not only the power inside you but the love. And when you get down to it  Lily  that's the only purpose grand enough for a human life. Not just to love - but to persist in love.
author: Sue Monk Kidd

quote: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Loving people live in a loving world. Hostile people live in a hostile world. Same world.
author: Wayne W. Dyer

quote: Neither a lofty degree of intelligence nor imagination nor both together go to the making of genius. Love  love  love  that is the soul of genius.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

quote: Love is like pi - natural  irrational  and very important.
author: Lisa Hoffman

quote: What the world really needs is more love and less paperwork.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: I love humanity but I hate people.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: To live is like to love - all reason is against it  and all healthy instinct for it.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Life without love is like a tree without blossom and fruit.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Love looks through a telescope  envy through a microscope.
author: Josh Billings

quote: In the arithmetic of love  one plus one equals everything  and two minus one equals nothing.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: There is only one happiness in life: to love and be loved.
author: George Sand

quote: To love means not to impose your own powers on your fellow man but offer him your help. And if he refuses it  to be proud that he can do it on his own strength.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: Love is like the truth  sometimes it prevails  sometimes it hurts.
author: Victor M. Garcia

quote: If love is the answer  could you please rephrase the question?
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: The Grand essentials of happiness are: something to do  something to love  and something to hope for.
author: Allan K. Chalmers

quote: Love is the master key which opens the gates of happiness.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: I have been so great a lover: filled my days So proudly with the splendour of Love's praise  The pain  the calm  and the astonishment  Desire illimitable  and silent content  And all dear names men use  to cheat despair  For the perplexed and viewless streams that bear Our hearts at random down the dark of life.
author: Rupert Brooke

quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
author: Henry Miller

quote: There can be no peace of mind in love  since the advantage one has secured is never anything by a fresh starting-point for further desires.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: What I cannot love  I overlook.
author: Anais Nin

quote: A loving relationship is one in which the loved one is free to be himself - to laugh with me  but never at me  to cry with me  but never because of me  to love life  to love himself  to love being loved. Such a relationship is based upon freedom and can never grow in a jealous heart.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
author: Voltaire

quote: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: We are all born for love  it is the principle of existence and its only end.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Love is the only thing that we can carry with us when we go  and it makes the end so easy.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Among those whom I like or admire  I can find no common denominator  but among those whom I love  I can: all of them make me laugh.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Life isn't long enough for love and art.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: The essence of love is kindness.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Love . . . includes fellowship in suffering  in joy and in effort.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power  the world will know peace.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: Love is anterior to life Posterior to death Initial of creation  and The exponent of breath.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Who will tell whether one happy moment of love or the joy of breathing or walking on a bright morning and smelling the fresh air  is not worth all the suffering and effort which life implies.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love and to work and to play and to look up at the stars.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: Love is ever the beginning of Knowledge as fire is of light.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Life in common among people who love each other is the ideal of happiness.
author: George Sand

quote: I wonder what memories of yours will persist as you go on in life. My hunch is that the most important will have to do with feelings of loving and being loved - whoever's been close to you. As you continue to grow  you'll find many ways of expressing your love and you'll discover more and more ways in which others express their love for you.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: Where love is  no room is too small.
author: Talmud

quote: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love  something to do  and something to hope for.
author: Tom Bodett

quote: It is love  not reason  that is stronger than death.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Love feels no burden  regards not labors  strives toward more than it attains  argues not of impossibility  since it believes that it may and can do all things. Therefore it avails for all things  and fulfils and accomplishes much where one not a lover falls and lies helpless.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: Love your neighbor as yourself  but don't take down the fence.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Love does not dominate  it cultivates.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Life is pain and the enjoyment of love is an anesthetic.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: Love is letting go of fear.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: If we all discovered that we only had five minutes left to say all that we wanted to say  every telephone booth would be occupied by people calling other people to tell them that they loved them.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: Love doesn't make the world go round  Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love  to some extent  protects you from age.
author: Jeanne Moreau

quote: And remember  my sentimental friend  that a heart is not judged by how much you love  but by how much you are loved by others.
author: L. Frank Baum

quote: Love's like the measles - all the worse when it comes late in life.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Ofttimes the test of courage becomes rather to live than to die.
author: Vittorio Conte Alfieri

quote: Every man's life is a fairy-tale written by God's fingers.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: We come and we cry  and that is life  we yawn and we depart  and that is death!
author: Ausone de Chancel

quote: It matters not how long we live  but how.
author: Francis Bailey

quote: Life is a long lesson in humility.
author: Sir James Matthew Barrie

quote: It is a misery to be born  a pain to live  a trouble to die.
author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux

quote: Life is but a day at most.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: One life - a little gleam of Time between two Eternities.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Hurried and worried until we're buried  and there's no curtain call  Life's a very funny proposition  after all.
author: George M. Cohan

quote: For life in general  there is but one decree: youth is a blunder  manhood a struggle  old age a regret.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Our whole life is like a play.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: No one is to be despaired of as long as he breathes. (While there is life there is hope.)
author: Erasmus

quote: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time  for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A useless life is an early death.
author: Goethe

quote: Life is a tragedy for those who feel  and a comedy for those who think.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Every life is many days  day after day. We walk through ourselves  meeting robbers  ghosts  giants  old men  young men  wives  widows  brothers-in-love. But always meeting ourselves.
author: James Joyce

quote: Tell me not  in mournful numbers  Life is but an empty dream!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Christian life consists in faith and charity.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Strait is the gate and narrow is the way which leadeth unto life.
author: Matthew

quote: My candle burns at both ends  It will not last the night  But  ah  my foes  and  oh  my friends -  It gives a lovely light.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Ah Love! could you and I with him conspire To grasp this sorry Scheme of Things entire Would we not shatter it to bits - and then Re-mould it nearer to the Heart's Desire?
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Life is the game that must be played: This truth at least  good friends  we know  So live and laugh  nor be dismayed As one by one the phantoms go.
author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

quote: I wish to preach not the doctrine of ignoble ease  but the doctrine of the strenuous life.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: As is a tale  so is life: not how long it is  but how good it is  is what matters.
author: Seneca

quote: His saying was: live and let live.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: May you live all the days of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: The white flower of a blameless life.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Life is a game of whist. From unseen sources The cards are shuffled  and the hands are dealt. I do not like the way the cards are shuffled  But yet I like the game and want to play.
author: Eugene F. Ware

quote: All the things I really like to do are either immoral  illegal or fattening.
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: Lead  kindly Light  amid the encircling gloom  Lead Thou me on! The night is dark  and I am far from home -  Lead Thou me on! Keep Thou my feet  I do not ask to see The distant scene  - one step enough for me.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: And this I know  whether the one True Light Kindle to Love  or Wrath consume me quite  One flash of it within the Tavern caught Better than in the temple lost outright.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Nature and Nature's laws lay hid in night: God said  "Let Newton be!" and all was light.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The one important thing I have learned over the years is the difference between taking one's work seriously and taking one's self seriously. The first is imperative and the second is disastrous.
author: Margot Fonteyn

quote: Man  unlike the animal  has never learned that the sole purpose of life is to enjoy it.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: There is no cure for birth or death save to enjoy the interval.
author: George Santayana

quote: Life's better when it's fun. Boy  that's deep  isn't it?
author: Kevin Costner

quote: An ounce of cheerfulness is worth a pound of sadness to serve God with.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Years back someone said cod liver oil was the cure-all! Cheerfulness is more palliative and with no unpleasant aftertaste.
author: Sr. Mary Christelle Macaluso

quote: Cheerfulness keeps up a kind of daylight in the mind  filling it with a steady and perpetual serenity.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The highest wisdom is continual cheerfulness  such a state  like the region above the moon  is always clear and serene.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Let us be of good cheer  remembering that misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never come.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Burdens become light when cheerfully borne.
author: Ovid

quote: A happy woman is one who has no cares at all  a cheerful woman is one who has cares but doesn't let them get her down.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: Even if we can't be happy we must always be cheerful.
author: Irving Kristol

quote: Nature intended you to be the fountain-spring of cheerfulness and social life  and not the mountain of despair and melancholy.
author: Sir Arthur Helps

quote: You find yourself refreshed by the presence of cheerful people. Why not make an earnest effort to confer that pleasure on others? Half the battle is gained if you never allow yourself to say anything gloomy.
author: Lydia Maria Child

quote: If God came in and said  "I want you to be happy for the rest of your life " what would you do?
author: Bernie Siegel

quote: True happiness is to understand our duties toward God and man  to enjoy the present  without anxious dependence on the future  not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears  but to rest satisfied with what we have  which is abundantly sufficient.
author: Seneca

quote: Many people think that if they were only in some other place  or had some other job  they would be happy. Well  that is doubtful. So get as much happiness out of what you are doing as you can and don't put off being happy until some future date.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: You're happiest while you're making the greatest contribution.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: The happiest and most contented people are those who each day perform to make the best of their abilities.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

quote: None but those who are happy in themselves can make others so.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Do you want a world with . . . more joy and happiness? Then find your own joy and happiness and contribute to the joy and happiness of others.
author: Bo Lozoff

quote: One thing I know  the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Remember that happiness is as contagious as gloom. It should be the first duty of those who are happy to let others know of their gladness.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Those who are happiest are those who do the most for others.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: Make people happy and there will not be half the quarreling  or a tenth part of the wickedness there now is.
author: Lydia Maria Child

quote: Lead the life that will make you kindly and friendly to everyone about you  and you will be surprised what a happy life you will lead.
author: Charles Schwab

quote: If you want to be happy  set yourself a goal that commands your thoughts  liberates your energy  and inspires your hopes. Happiness is within you. It comes from doing some certain thing into which you can put all your thought and energy. If you want to be happy  get enthusiastic about something.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The way to happiness: keep your heart free from hate  your mind from worry. Live simply  expect little  give much. Fill your life with love. Scatter sunshine. Forget self  think of others. Do as you would be done by. Try this for a week and you will be surprised.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little  soon-forgotten charities of a kiss or smile  a kind look  a heartfelt compliment  and the countless infinitesimals of pleasurable and genial feeling.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: A happy life is made up of little things . . . a gift sent  a letter written  a call made  a recommendation given  transportation provided  a cake made  a book lent  a check sent.
author: Carol Holmes

quote: Do not worry  eat three square meals a day  say your prayers  be courteous to your creditors  keep your digestion good  exercise  go slow and easy. Maybe there are other things your special case requires to make you happy  but my friend  these I reckon will give you a good life.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The secret of happiness is this: Let your interests be as wide as possible  and let your reactions to the things and persons that interest you be as far as possible friendly rather than hostile.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes  but in liking what one does.
author: J. M. Barrie

quote: The secret of happiness is to count your blessings while others are adding up their troubles.
author: William Penn

quote: The secret of happiness is to count your blessings - not your birthdays.
author: Shannon Rose

quote: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: It is not how much we have  but how much we enjoy  that makes happiness.
author: Charles Spurgeon

quote: Before strongly desiring anything  we should look carefully into the happiness of its present owner.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: We have all been placed on this earth to discover our own path  and we will never be happy if we live someone else's idea of life.
author: James Van Praagh

quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do  something to love  and something to hope for.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads.
author: Albert Camus

quote: We all have 100% to deal with in our lives: 10% is important  90% unimportant. The secret to a happy  productive life is to deal with the 10% and let the 90% slip.
author: Salli Rasberry

quote: With a little discipline and regular self-checks  you can learn to do one thing at a time. And do it better. And be happier doing it.
author: Elaine St. James

quote: I've been riding the carousel in Central Park since I was five years old . . . If I'm very depressed or if something's bothering me today  my husband  Larry  and I go back to the park. We get on the carousel horse and we start riding  and I start singing at the top of my lungs. It is pure and absolute joy and happiness.
author: Eda LeShan

quote: Life holds so much  so much to be happy about always. Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can be felt only if you don't set any conditions.
author: Artur Rubinstein

quote: Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love  grace  and gratitude.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: Better to be happy than wise.
author: John Heywood

quote: Happiness is a butterfly  which  when pursued  is always just beyond your grasp  but which  if you will sit down quietly  may alight upon you.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Your success and happiness lie in you. Resolve to keep happy  and your joy and you shall form an invisible host against difficulties.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Remember that happiness is a way of travel  not a destination.
author: Roy Goodman

quote: When ill luck besets us  to ease the tension we have only to remember that happiness is relative. The next time you are tempted to grumble about what has happened to you  why not pause and be glad that it is no worse than it is?
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: When one door of happiness closes  another opens  but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I have found that most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: It is the happiness that comes from within that is lasting and fulfilling.
author: Leddy Schmeligh

quote: Each person on this planet is inherently  intrinsically capable of attaining "dizzying heights" of happiness and fulfillment.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: The ingredients of happiness are so simple that they can be counted on one hand. Happiness comes from within  and rests most securely on simple goodness and clear conscience.
author: William Ogden

quote: We are never so happy nor so unhappy as we imagine.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: You have to believe in happiness  or happiness never comes.
author: Douglas Malloch

quote: It is a man's proper business to seek happiness and avoid misery.
author: John Locke
