quote: It is not merely cruelty that leads men to love war  it is excitement.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: I am not sending messages with my feet. All I ever wanted was not to come up empty. I did it for the dough  and the old applause.
author: Fred Astaire

quote: My advice about acting? Speak clearly  don't bump into people  and if you must have motivation  think of your pay packet on Friday.
author: Noel Coward

quote: I take it that what all men are really after is some form of  perhaps only some formula of  peace.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: It is the north wind that lashes men into Vikings  it is the soft  luscious south wind which lulls them to lotus dreams.
author: Ouida

quote: One starts an action simply because one must do something.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Action springs not from thought  but from a readiness for responsibility.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: The breakfast of champions is not cereal  it's the opposition.
author: Nick Seitz

quote: There's only one good reason to be a writer-we can't help it! We'd all like to be successful  rich and famous  but if those are our goals  we're off on the wrong foot. ... I just wanted to earn enough money so I could work at home on my writing.
author: Phyllis Whitney

quote: I wish it  I command it. Let my will take the place of a reason.
author: Juvenal

quote: Necessity  who is the mother of our invention.
author: Plato

quote: Urgent necessity prompts many to do things.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: I always felt that I hadn't achieved what I wanted to achieve. I always felt I could get better. That's the whole incentive.
author: Virginia Wade

quote: To have a grievance is to have a purpose in life.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: What you are must always displease you  if you would attain to that which you are not.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: We accept the verdict of the past until the need for change cries out loudly enough to force upon us a choice between the comforts of further inertia and the irksomeness of action.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: I can't concentrate on golf or bowling. Those bowling pins aren't going to hurt me. I can concentrate in the ring because someone is trying to kill me.
author: Carmen Basilio

quote: I happened on the idea of fitting an engine to a bicycle simply because I did not want to ride crowded trains and buses.
author: Soichire Honda

quote: Always in a moment of extreme danger things can be done which had previously been thought impossible.
author: Field Marshal Erwin Rommel

quote: Acting was a way out at first. A way out of not knowing what to do  a way of focusing ambitions. And the ambition wasn't for fame. The ambition was to do an interesting job.
author: Harrison Ford

quote: A loafer never works except when there is a fire  then he will carry out more furniture than anybody.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Hardships  poverty and want are the best incentives  and the best foundation  for the success of man.
author: Bradford Merrill

quote: If you're good to your staff when things are going well  they'll rally when times go bad.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: Praise is the only gift for which people are really grateful.
author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quote: I praise loudly  I blame softly.
author: Catherine II

quote: There are two things that people want more than sex and money- recognition and praise.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: To hear how special and wonderful we are is endlessly enthralling.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: Words are less needful to sorrow than to joy.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: Sandwich every bit of criticism between two heavy layers of praise.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: There isn't much that tastes better than praise from those who are wise and capable.
author: Selma Lagerlof

quote: We treat our people like royalty. If you honor and serve the people who work for you  they will honor and serve you.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: What you praise you increase.
author: Catherine Ponder

quote: What men and women need is encouragement. ... Instead of always harping on a man's faults  tell him of his virtues. Try to pull him out of his rut of bad habits.
author: Eleanor H. Porter

quote: Everyone has an invisible sign hanging from their neck saying  "Make me feel important." Never forget this message when working with people.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: We are all motivated by a keen desire for praise  and the better a man is  the more he is inspired by glory.
author: Cicero

quote: Applause is the spur of noble minds  the end and aim of weak ones.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Most people would rather be seen through than not seen at all.
author: Ada Levenson

quote: When we are listened to  it creates us  makes us unfold and expand. Ideas actually begin to grow within us and come to life.
author: Brenda Ueland

quote: Praise out of season  or tactlessly bestowed  can freeze the heart as much as blame.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: We do not content ourselves with the life we have in ourselves  we desire to live an imaginary life in the minds of others  and for this purpose we endeavor to shine.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The greatest efforts of the race have always been traceable to the love of praise  as the greatest catastrophes to the love of pleasure.
author: John Ruskin

quote: If each of us were to confess his most secret desire  the one that inspires all his plans  all his actions  he would say: "I want to be praised."
author: E. M. Cioran

quote: We talk on principle  but we act on interest.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: What allows us  as human beings  to psychologically survive life on earth  with all of its pain  drama  and challenges  is a sense of purpose and meaning.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: A man will fight harder for his interests than for his rights.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The pitcher cries for water to carry and a person for work that is real.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: The virtues and the vices are all put in motion by interest.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: It's so hard when I have to  and so easy when I want to.
author: Sondra Anice Barnes

quote: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration  I don't think you can go wrong.
author: Ella Fitzgerald

quote: You have to know exactly what you want out of your career. If you want to be a star  you don't bother with other things.
author: Marilyn Home

quote: Interest speaks all sorts of tongues  and plays all sorts of parts  even that of disinterestedness.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Men's actions depend to a great extent upon fear. We do things either because we enjoy doing them or because we are afraid not to do them.
author: John F. Milburn

quote: Some people change their ways when they see the light  others when they feel the heat.
author: Caroline Schoeder

quote: There are only two forces that unite men-fear and interest.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The passion to get ahead is sometimes born of the fear lest we be left behind.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: You can't underestimate the power of fear.
author: Patricia Nixon

quote: There are only two stimulants to one's best efforts: the fear of punishment  and the hope of reward.
author: John M. Wilson

quote: A man who is afraid will do anything.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: Fear of losing is what makes competitors so great. Show me a gracious loser and I'll show you a permanent loser.
author: O. J. Simpson

quote: A team that has character doesn't need stimulation.
author: Tom Landry

quote: Beware of trying to accomplish anything by force.
author: Angela Merici

quote: People who fight fire with fire usually end up with ashes.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: Because it's there.
author: G. H. L. Mallory

quote: Diplomacy is the art of letting someone have your way.
author: Daniele Vare

quote: It is easier to influence strong than weak characters in life.
author: Margot Asquith

quote: Men are not against you  they are merely for themselves.
author: Gene Fowler

quote: No punishment has ever possessed enough power of deterrence to prevent the commission of crimes. On the contrary  whatever the punishment  once a specific crime has appeared for the first time  its reappearance is more likely than its initial emergence could ever have been.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: When the flag is unfurled  all reason is in the trumpet.
author: Ukrainian proverb

quote: No leader can be too far ahead of his followers.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: You will accomplish more by kind words and a courteous manner than by anger or sharp rebuke  which should never be used except in necessity.
author: Angela Merici

quote: Where the willingness is great  the difficulties cannot be great.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: We can do whatever we wish to do provided our wish is strong enough. What do you want most to do? That's what I have to keep asking myself  in the face of difficulties.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Love makes the wildest spirit tame  and the tamest spirit wild.
author: Alexis Delp

quote: Great men undertake great things because they are great  fools  because they think them easy.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: We must each find our separate meaning in the persuasion of our days until we meet in the meaning of the world.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: Fear  desire  hope still push us on toward the future.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: It is for the superfluous things of life that men sweat.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Urgent necessity prompts many to do things.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Acting was a way out at first. A way out of not knowing what to do  a way of focusing ambitions. And the ambition wasn't for fame. The ambition was to do an interesting job.
author: Harrison Ford

quote: To hear how special and wonderful we are is endlessly enthralling.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: If each of us were to confess his most secret desire  the one that inspires all his plans  all his actions  he would say: "I want to be praised."
author: E. M. Cioran

quote: Some people change their ways when they see the light  others when they feel the heat.
author: Caroline Schoeder

quote: No leader can be too far ahead of his followers.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Some people change their ways when they see the light  others when they feel the heat.
author: Caroline Schoeder

quote: No leader can be too far ahead of his followers.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: 'Tis distance lends enchantment to the view  And robes the mountain in its azure hue.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: To make a mountain of a mole-hill.
author: Henry Ellis

quote: If the mountain won't come to Mohammed  Mohammed must go to the mountain.
author: English proverb

quote: The mountain was in labour  and Jove was afraid  but it brought forth a mouse.
author: King of Egypt Tachos

quote: Blessed are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.
author: Matthew

quote: By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept  Remembering thee.
author: Algernon Charles Swinburne

quote: He mourns the dead who lives as they desire.
author: Edward Young

quote: The mouse that hath but one hole is quickly taken.
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: If a man write a better book  preach a better sermon  or make a better mousetrap than his neighbor  though he build his house in the woods  the world will make a beaten path to his door.
author: Sarah S. B. Yule

quote: Beethoven can write music  thank God - but he can do nothing else on earth.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: The public doesn't want new music  the main thing that it demands of a composer is that he be dead.
author: Arthur Honegger

quote: I have sat through an Italian opera  til  for sheer pain  and inexplicable anguish  I have rushed out into the noisiest places of the crowded street  to solace myself with sounds which I was not obliged to follow and get rid of the distracting torment of endless  fruitless  barren attention!
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Let us not forget that the greatest composers were also the greatest thieves. They stole from everyone and everywhere.
author: Pablo Casals

quote: A legend is an old man with a cane known for what he used to do.
author: Miles Davis

quote: A symphony is a stage play with the parts written for instruments instead of for actors.
author: Colin Wilson

quote: An ear for music is very different from a taste for music. I have no ear whatever  I could not sing an air to save my life  but I have the intensest delight in music  and can detect good from bad.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Classic music is th' kind that we keep thinkin'll turn into a tune.
author: Frank McKinney

quote: Discord occasions a momentary distress to the ear  which remains unsatisfied  and even uneasy  until it hears something better.
author: Charles Burney

quote: Discord occasions a momentary distress to the ear  which remains unsatisfied  and even uneasy  until it hears something better. I am convinced...that provided the ear be at length made amends  there are few dissonances too strong for it. Disharmony  to paraphrase Bergson's statement about disorder  is simply a harmony to which many are unaccustomed.
author: John Cage

quote: Canned music is like audible wallpaper.
author: Alistair Cooke

quote: Don't play what's there  play what's not there.
author: Miles Davis

quote: Generally music feedeth that disposition of the spirits which it findeth.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: God tells me how he wants the music played - and you get in his way.
author: Arturo Toscanini

quote: Handel was a man of the world  but Bach was a world of a man.
author: Arnold Stevenson

quote: He was dying all his life.
author: Hector Berlioz

quote: I am sure my music has a taste of codfish in it.
author: Edvard Grieg

quote: I do not mind what language an opera is sung in so long as it is the language I don't understand.
author: Edward Appleton

quote: In the Negro melodies of America I find all that is needed for a great and noble school of music.
author: Antonin Dvorak

quote: It is the best of all trades to make songs  and the second best to sing them.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Jazz came to America 300 years ago in chains.
author: Paul Whiteman

quote: Jazz is about the only form of art existing today in which there is freedom of the individual without the loss of group contact.
author: Dave Brubeck

quote: Jazz is the only music in which the same note can be played night after night but differently each time.
author: Ornette Coleman

quote: Jazz will endure just as long as people hear it through their feet instead of their brains.
author: John Philip Sousa

quote: Mozart is sunshine.
author: Antonin Dvorak

quote: Music sweeps by me as a messenger carrying a message that is not for me.
author: George Eliot

quote: Mozart's music gives us permission to live.
author: John Updike

quote: Music is a strange thing. I would almost say it is a miracle. For it stands halfway between thought and phenomenon  between spirit and matter.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Music is another planet.
author: Alphonse Daudet

quote: Music is the art of thinking with sounds.
author: Jules Combarieu

quote: Music is well said to be the speech of angels.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Music touches places beyond our touching.
author: Keith Bosley

quote: Music with dinner is an insult  both to the cook and the violinist.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Never compose anything unless the not composing of it becomes a positive nuisance to you.
author: Gustav Hoist

quote: Nothing is better than music.... It has done more for us than we have the right to hope for.
author: Nadia Boulanger

quote: Rests always sound well.
author: Arnold Schoenberg

quote: Swans sing before they die - 'twere no bad thing  did certain persons die before they sing.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The basic difference between classical music and jazz is that in the former the music is always graver than its performance - whereas the way jazz is performed is always more important than what is being played.
author: Andre Previn

quote: The devil does not stay where music is.
author: Martin Luther

quote: The Sonata is an essentially dramatic art form  combining the emotional range in vivid presentation of a full-size stage drama with the terseness of a short story.
author: Donald Francis Tovey

quote: The sonatas of Mozart are unique  they are too easy for children  and too difficult for artists.
author: Artur Schnabel

quote: Too many pieces of music finish too long after the end.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: Throughout my career  nervousness and stage-fright have never left me before playing. And each of the thousands of concerts I have played at  I feel as bad as I did the very first time.
author: Pablo Casals

quote: Twelve Highlanders and a bagpipe make a rebellion.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: Wagner has lovely moments but awful quarters of an hour.
author: Gioacchino Rossini

quote: Who is there that  in logical words  can express the effect music has on us? A kind of inarticulate  unfathomable speech  which leads us to the edge of the Infinite and lets us for moments gaze into that!
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: You know what you do when you shit  singing is the same thing  only up!
author: Enrico Caruso

quote: After silence  that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: When people hear good music  it makes them homesick for something they never had  and never will have.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Light quirks of music  broken and uneven  make the soul dance upon a jig of heaven.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Who hears music  feels his solitude peopled at once.
author: Robert Browning

quote: One cannot judge 'Lohengrin' from a first hearing  and I certainly do not intend to hear it a second time.
author: Gioacchino Rossini

quote: He could fiddle all the bugs off a sweet-potato vine.
author: Stephen Vincent Benet

quote: Opera purges men of those hesitations and worries which make it difficult for them to acknowledge their importance to themselves. A good performance of an opera  that is  provides a language for us to speak of ourselves as we have always known we should speak.
author: Hamish Swanston

quote: No one can any longer write in the fat style of Strauss. That was killed by Stravinsky. He stripped the body of much of its clothes. Music is the craft of building structures with sound and that is what Stravinsky represents.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: A nation creates music - the composer only arranges it.
author: Mikhail Glinka

quote: Sentimentally I am disposed to harmony  but organically I am incapable of a tune.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Music produces a kind of pleasure which human nature cannot do without.
author: Confucius

quote: Conductors must give unmistakable and suggestive signals to the orchestra  not choreography to the audience.
author: George Szell

quote: Music is the shorthand of emotion.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: For most singers the first half of the career involves extending one's repertoire  the second half trimming it.
author: Ethan Mordden

quote: How wonderful opera would be if there were no singers.
author: Gioacchino Rossini

quote: Opera in English is  in the main  just about as sensible as baseball in Italian.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Music is only sound expressing certain patterns  so to what extent is that sound architecture and to what extent theatre?
author: Arthur Brown

quote: A jazz musician is a juggler who uses harmonies instead of oranges.
author: Benny Green

quote: Music is a language by whose means messages are elaborated  that such messages can be understood by the many but sent out only by few  and that it alone among all the languages unites the contradictory character of being at once intelligible and untranslatable - these facts make the creator of music a being like the gods.
author: Claude Levi-Strauss

quote: Music is your own experience  your thoughts  your wisdom. If you don't live it  it won't come out of your horn.
author: Charlie Parker

quote: The good composer is slowly discovered  the bad composer is slowly found out.
author: Ernest Newman

quote: The function of pop music is to be consumed.
author: Pierre Boulez

quote: Music first and last should sound well  should allure and enchant the ear. Never mind the inner significance.
author: Thomas Beecham

quote: I am tired before the concert  not afterward.
author: Artur Rubinstein

quote: Music  the greatest good that mortals know  and all of heaven we have below.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: What we play is life.
author: Louis Armstrong

quote: I know that the twelve notes in each octave and the varieties of rhythm offer me opportunities that all of human genius will never exhaust.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: The notes I handle no better than many pianists. But the pauses between the notes - ah  that is where the art resides!
author: Artur Schnabel

quote: Chamber music - a conversation between friends.
author: Catherine Drinker Bowen

quote: Mozart is the human incarnation of the divine force of creation.
author: Goethe

quote: I write as a sow piddles.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

quote: I am an arrogant and impatient listener  but in the case of a few composers  a very few  when I hear a work I do not like  I am convinced that it is my own fault. Verdi is one of those composers.
author: Benjamin Britten

quote: Music hath charms to soothe a savage breast  to soften rocks  or bend a knotted oak.
author: William Congreve

quote: She was an aging singer who had to take every note above 'A' with her eyebrows.
author: Montague Glass

quote: Going to the opera  like getting drunk  is a sin that carries its own punishment with it and that a very severe one.
author: Hannah More

quote: Opera is when a guy gets stabbed in the back and instead of bleeding he sings.
author: Ed Gardner

quote: I think popular music in this country is one of the few things in the twentieth century that have made giant strides in reverse.
author: Bing Crosby

quote: If a literary man puts together two words about music  one of them will be wrong.
author: Aaron Copland

quote: Music is given to us specifically to make order of things  to move from an anarchic  individualistic state to a regulated  perfectly concious one  which alone insures vitality and durability.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: Music should strike fire from the heart of man  and bring tears from the eyes of woman.
author: Beethoven

quote: Music hath charms to soothe the savage breast.
author: William Congreve

quote: Soprano  basso  even the contralto Wished him five fathom under the Rialto.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Music is well said to be the speech of angels.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Why should the devil have all the good tunes?
author: Rowland Hill

quote: The musician who always plays on the same string  is laughed at.
author: Horace

quote: Music is the universal language of mankind.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: All of heaven we have below.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Such sweet compulsion doth in music lie.
author: John Milton

quote: The harp that once through Tara's halls The soul of music shed  Now hangs as mute on Tara's walls  As if that soul were fled.
author: George Moore

quote: Wagner's music is better than it sounds.
author: Bill Nye

quote: Light quirks of music  broken and uneven  Make the soul dance upon a jig to Heav'n.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: There was the door to which I found no key  There was the veil through which 1 might not see.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Mystery is the wisdom of blockheads.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: Sticks and stones will break my bones  but names will never hurt me.
author: English proverb

quote: Father calls me William  sister calls me Will  Mother calls me Willie  but the fellows call me Bill!
author: Eugene Field

quote: And  lo! Ben Adhem's name led all the rest.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: Nationalism is an infantile disease. It is the measles of mankind.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Born in inquity and conceived in sin  the spirit of nationalism has never ceased to bend human institutions to the service of dissension and distress.
author: Thorstein Veblen

quote: The course of nature is the art of God.
author: Edward Young

quote: After a debauch of thundershower  the weather takes the pledge and signs it with a rainbow.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: From the intrinsic evidence of His creation  the Great Architect of the Universe now begins to appear as a pure mathematician .
author: Sir James Jeans

quote: Is dishwater dull? Naturalists with microscopes have told me that it teems with quiet fun.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: It is not necessarily those lands which are the most fertile or most favored climate that seem to me the happiest  but those in which a long stroke of adaptation between man and his environment has brought out the best qualities of both.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Like a gardener  I believe that what goes down must come up.
author: Lynwood L. Giacomini

quote: Nature is a catchment of sorrows.
author: Maxine Kumin

quote: Nature is not human-hearted.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Nature  with equal mind  sees all her sons at play  sees man control the wind  the wind sweep man away.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: The chess-board is the world  the pieces are the phenomena of the universe  the rules of the game are what we call the Laws of Nature. The player on the other side is hidden from us. We know that his play is always fair  just and patient. But also we know  to our cost  that he never overlooks a mistake  or makes the smallest allowance for ignorance.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: The unnatural - that too is natural.
author: Goethe

quote: There is something haunting in the light of the moon  it has all the dispassionateness of a disembodied soul  and something of its inconceivable mystery.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: The universe is not hostile  nor yet is it friendly. It is simply indifferent.
author: John Hughes Holmes

quote: In nature there are neither rewards nor punishments - there are consequences.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Monotony is the law of nature. Look at the monotonous manner in which the sun rises. The monotony of necessary occupations is exhilarating and life-giving.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Men argue  nature acts.
author: Voltaire

quote: Nature is usually wrong.
author: James McNeill Whistler

quote: Flowers have an expression of countenance as much as men or animals. Some seem to smile  some have a sad expression  some are pensive and diffident  others again are plain  honest and upright.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Gie me a spark o' nature's fire  that's a' the learning I desire.
author: Robert Burns

quote: Light may be shed on man and his origins.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: I have called this principle  by which each slight variation  if useful  is preserved  by the term natural selection.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: The expression often used by Mr. Herbert Spencer  of the "Survival of the fittest"  is more accurate  and is sometimes equally convenient.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: I wanted to say something about the universe. There's God  angels  plants... and horseshit.
author: Zero Mostel

quote: When elephants fight it is the grass that suffers.
author: African saying

quote: The dinosaur's eloquent lesson is that if some bigness is good  an overabundance of bigness is not necessarily better.
author: Eric Johnston

quote: Who are we? We find that we live on an insignificant planet of a humdrum star lost in a galaxy tucked away in some forgotten corner of a universe in which there are far more galaxies than people.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: A vacuum is a hell of a lot better than some of the stuff that nature replaces it with.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: We cannot command Nature except by obeying her.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The mastery of nature is vainly believed to be an adequate substitute for self-mastery.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Nature thrives on patience  man on impatience.
author: Paul Boese

quote: The soil  in return for her service  keeps the tree tied to her  the sky asks nothing and leaves it free.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: What mighty battles have I seen and heard waged between the trees and the west wind - an Iliad fought in the fields of air.
author: Edith M. Thomas

quote: Grass is the forgiveness of nature - her constant benediction. Forests decay  harvests perish  flowers vanish  but grass is immortal.
author: Brian Ingalls

quote: The whole of nature is a conjugation of the verb to eat  in the active and passive.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: The universe is like a safe to which there is a combination  but the combination is locked up in the safe.
author: Peter de Vries

quote: When the oak is felled the whole forest echoes with its fall  but a hundred acorns are sown in silence by an unnoticed breeze.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Deep in their roots  all flowers keep the light.
author: Theodore Roethke

quote: By nature's kindly disposition  most questions which it is beyond man's power to answer do not occur to him at all.
author: George Santayana

quote: To demand 'sense' is the hallmark of nonsense. Nature does not make sense. Nothing makes sense.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: There is nothing in which the birds differ more from man than the way in which they can build and yet leave a landscape as it was before.
author: Robert Lynd

quote: The greatest joy in nature is the absence of man.
author: Bliss Carman

quote: When a man wantonly destroys a work of man we call him a vandal  when a man destroys one of the works of God  we call him a sportsman.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: Man is a complex being: he makes deserts bloom and lakes die.
author: Gil Stern

quote: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: God's miracles are to be found in nature itself  the wind and waves  the wood that becomes a tree - all of these are explained biologically  but behind them is the hand of God.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: If you wish to know the divine  feel the wind on your face and the warm sun on your hand.
author: Eido Tai Shimano Roshi

quote: The radiance in some places is so great as to be fairly dazzling . . . every crystal  every flower a window opening into heaven  a mirror reflecting the Creator.
author: John Muir

quote: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Look deep  deep into nature  and then you will understand everything better.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Come forth into the light of things. Let nature be your teacher.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: If you watch how nature deals with adversity  continually renewing itself  you can't help but learn.
author: Bernie Siegel

quote: Rivers and rocks and trees have always been talking to us  but we've forgotten how to listen.
author: Michael Roads

quote: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings: Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine into flowers  the winds will blow their freshness into you  and the storms  their energy and cares will drop off like autumn leaves.
author: John Muir

quote: Nature tops the list of potent tranquilizers and stress reducers. The mere sound of moving water has been shown to lower blood pressure.
author: Patch Adams

quote: The sun - my almighty physician.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Nature uses only the longest threads to weave her patterns  so each small piece of her fabric reveals the organization of the entire tapestry.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: The beauty of the world and the orderly arrangement of everything celestial makes us confess that there is an excellent and eternal nature  which ought to be worshiped and admired by all mankind.
author: Cicero

quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
author: Aristotle

quote: The sun gives us light  but the moon provides inspiration. If you look at the sun without shielding your eyes  you'll go blind. If you look at the moon without covering your eyes  you'll become a poet.
author: Serge Bouchard

quote: The world is full of poetry. The air is living with its spirit  and the waves dance to the music of its melodies  and sparkle in its brightness.
author: Percival

quote: The sky is the daily bread of the eyes.
author: Ralph Walso Emerson

quote: My heart leaps up when I behold a rainbow in the sky.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
author: John Muir

quote: We lose our souls if we lose the experience of the forest  the butterflies  the song of the birds  if we can't see the stars at night.
author: Thomas Berry

quote: Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: As long as the Earth can make a spring every year  I can. As long as the Earth can flower and produce nurturing fruit  I can  because I'm the Earth. I won't give up until the Earth gives up.
author: Alice Walker

quote: I never knew how soothing trees are - many trees and patches of open sunlight  and tree presences  it is almost like having another being.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Our Lord has written the promise of resurrection  not in books alone but in every leaf of springtime.
author: Martin Luther

quote: The nicest thing about the promise of spring is that sooner or later she'll have to keep it.
author: Mark Beltaire

quote: Spring is nature's way of saying  "Let's party!"
author: Robin Williams

quote: It was one of those perfect summer days - the sun was shining  a breeze was blowing  the birds were singing  and the lawnmower was broken.
author: James Dent

quote: Nobody sees a flower - really - it is so small it takes time -  we haven't time - and to see takes time  like to have a friend takes time.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quote: The AmenT of Nature is always a flower.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Next time a sunrise steals your breath or a meadow of flowers leave you speechless  remain that way. Say nothing  and listen as heaven whispers  "Do you like it? I did it just for you."
author: Max Lucado

quote: Every flower is a soul blossoming in Nature.
author: Gerard de Nerval

quote: Flowers always make people better  happier  and more helpful  they are sunshine  food  and medicine to the soul.
author: Luther Burbank

quote: God Almighty first planted a garden. And indeed it is the purest of human pleasures.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Pleasure for an hour  a bottle of wine  pleasure for a year  marriage  pleasure for a lifetime  a garden.
author: Chinese saying

quote: The kiss of sun for pardon  The song of the birds for mirth One is nearer God's Heart in a garden Than anywhere else on earth.
author: Dorothy Gurney

quote: All gardeners live in beautiful places because they make them so.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: All gardening is landscape painting.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The next time it begins to rain ... lie down on your belly  nestle your chin into the grass  and get a frog's-eye view of how raindrops fall . . . The sight of hundreds of blades of grass bowing down and popping back up like piano keys strikes me as one of the merriest sights in the world.
author: Malcolm Margolin

quote: Sunshine is delicious  rain is refreshing  wind braces us up  snow is exhilarating  there is really no such thing as bad weather  only different kinds of good weather.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Don't knock the weather  nine-tenths of the people couldn't start a conversation if it didn't change once in a while.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: After rain comes fair weather.
author: James Howell

quote: Weather means more when you have a garden. There's nothing like listening to a shower and thinking how it is soaking in around your green beans.
author: Marcelene Cox

quote: I have always been delighted at the prospect of a new day  a fresh try  one more start  with perhaps a bit of magic waiting somewhere behind the morning.
author: J. B. Priestly

quote: Whether one is twenty  forty  or sixty  whether one has succeeded  failed or just muddled along  whether yesterday was full of sun or storm  or one of those dull days with no weather at all  life begins each morning I
author: Leigh Mitchell Hodges

quote: Today a new sun rises for me  everything lives  everything is animated  everything seems to speak to me of my passion  everything invites me to cherish it.
author: Anne De Lenclos

quote: Every new day begins with possibilities. It's up to us to fill it with the things that move us toward progress and peace.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: I love the challenge of starting at zero every day and seeing how much I can accomplish.
author: Martha Stewart

quote: Thank God ever morning when you get up that you have something to do which must be done  whether you like it or not.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: Today is a new day. You will get out of it just what you put into it. . . If you have made mistakes  even serious mistakes  there is always another chance for you. . . . for this thing that we call "failure" is not the falling down  but the staying down.
author: Mary Pickford

quote: Live your life each day as you would climb a mountain. An occasional glance toward the summit keeps the goal in mind  but many beautiful scenes are to be observed from each new vantage point. Climb slowly  steadily  enjoying each passing moment  and the view from the summit will serve as a fitting climax for the journey.
author: Harold B. Melchart

quote: Nothing is worth more than this day.
author: Goethe

quote: Normal day  let me be aware of the treasure you are. Let me learn from you  love you  bless you before you depart. Let me not pass you by in quest of some rare and perfect tomorrow.
author: Mary Jean Iron

quote: Yesterday is not ours to recover  but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: When all else is lost  the future still remains.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: When I look at the future  it's so bright  it burns my eyes.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Earth's crammed with Heaven  And every common bush afire with God.
author: E. B. Browning

quote: To him who in the love of Nature holds Communion with her visible forms  she speaks A various language.
author: William Cullen Bryant

quote: I love not man the less  but nature more.
author: Lord Byron

quote: For Art may err  but Nature cannot miss.
author: John Dryden

quote: The woods were made for the hunter of dreams  The brooks for the fishes of song.
author: Sam Walter Foss

quote: Nature is a volume of which God is the author.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Nature  like a kind and smiling mother  lends herself to our dreams and cherishes our fancies.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Accuse not Nature  she hath done her part  Do thou but thine!
author: John Milton

quote: Grass is the forgiveness of nature - her constant benediction. ... Forests decay  harvests perish  flowers vanish  but grass is immortal.
author: John Ingalls

quote: Everything in nature acts in conformity with law.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Nature abhors a vacuum.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: I chatter  chatter  as I flow To join the brimming river  For men may come and men may go  But I go on forever.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Nature has always had more force than education.
author: Voltaire

quote: O pilot! 'tis a fearful night  There's danger on the deep.
author: Thomas Haynes Bayly

quote: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: Oh  I am a cook and a captain bold And the mate of the Nancy brig  And a bo'sun tight and a midshipmate And the crew of the captain's gig.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: Thus  I steer my bark  and sail On even keel  with gentle gale.
author: Matthew Green

quote: Hearts of oak are our ships  Hearts of oak are our men.
author: David Garrick

quote: Now landsmen all  whoever you may be  If you want to rise to the top of the tree. If your soul isn't fettered to an office stool  Be careful to be guided by this golden rule -  Stick close to your desks and never go to to sea  And you may all be Rulers of the Queen's Navee.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: Necessity is often the spur to genius.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Necessity is the plea for every infringement of human freedom. It is the argument of tyrants  it is the creed of slaves.
author: William Pitt

quote: Necessity makes even the timid brave.
author: Sallust

quote: Not for myself I make this prayer  But for this race of mine That stretches forth from shadowed places Dark hands for bread and wine.
author: Countee Cullen

quote: The image of God cut in ebony.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: O black and unknown bards of long ago  How came your lips to touch the sacred fire? How  in your darkness  did you come to know The power and beauty of the minstrel's lyre?
author: James Weldon Johnson

quote: In the Negro countenance you will often meet with strong traits of benignity. I have felt yearnings of tenderness towards some of these faces.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: The best way to uncolor the Negro is to give the white man a white heart.
author: Panin

quote: The Negro is an exotic of the most gorgeous and superb countries of the world  and he has deep in his heart a passion for all that is splendid  rich and fanciful.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: We can live without our friends but not without our neighbors.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: When your neighbor's house is afire your own property is at stake.
author: Horace

quote: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
author: Leviticus

quote: The crop always seems better in our neighbor's field  and our neighbor's cow gives more milk.
author: Ovid

quote: In the field of world policy I would dedicate this nation to the policy of the good neighbor.
author: F. D. Roosevelt

quote: The cold neutrality of an impartial judge.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Neutrality  as a lasting principle  is an evidence of weakness.
author: Louis Kossuth

quote: A wise neuter joins with neither  but uses both  as his honest interest leads him.
author: William Penn

quote: The heart is never neutral.
author: Shaftesbury

quote: Laws die  books never.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: We are never deceived  we deceive ourselves.
author: Goethe

quote: The English never draw a line without blurring it.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Deep experience is never peaceful.
author: Henry James

quote: Never eat more than you can lift.
author: Miss Piggy

quote: Never exaggerate your faults  your friends will attend to that.
author: Robert C. Edwards

quote: You can never plan the future by the past.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough.
author: William Blake

quote: We never live  but we are always in the expectation of living.
author: Voltaire

quote: The body never lies.
author: Martha Graham

quote: Never invest your money in anything that eats or needs repairing.
author: Billy Rose

quote: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Never cut what you can untie.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: I never was ruined but twice - once when I lost a lawsuit  and once when I gained one.
author: Voltaire

quote: I was never less alone than when by myself.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: Never give in  never give in  never  never  never  never - in nothing great or small  large or petty - never give in except to convictions of honour and good sense.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Never trust the teller. Trust the tale.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Never have a friend that's poorer than yourself.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Never mind your happiness  do your duty.
author: Will Durant

quote: We never ask God to forgive anybody except when we haven't.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm.
author: Elizabeth Fuller

quote: Never help a child with a task at which he feels he can succeed.
author: Maria Montessori

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Never have a friend that's poorer than yourself.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Never mind your happiness  do your duty.
author: Will Durant

quote: We never ask God to forgive anybody except when we haven't.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm.
author: Elizabeth Fuller

quote: Never help a child with a task at which he feels he can succeed.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: I like to visit New York  but I wouldn't live there if you gave it to me.
author: American Saying

quote: If there ever was an aviary overstocked with jays it is that Yaptown-on-the-Hudson  called New York.
author: O. Henry

quote: Vulgar of manner  overfed. Overdressed and underbred  Heartless  Godless  hell's delight  Rude by day and lewd by night  Bedwarfed the man  o'ergrown the brute  Ruled by boss and prostitute  Purple-robed and pauper-clad  Raving  rotting  money-mad  A squirming herd in Mammon's mesh  A wilderness of human flesh  Crazed with avarice  lust and rum  New York  thy name's Delirium.
author: Byron R. Newton

quote: Spick and span new.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: What is valuable is not new  and what is new is not valuable.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: If a man bites a dog  that is news.
author: John Bogart

quote: When we hear news we should always wait for the sacrament of confirmation.
author: Voltaire

quote: Freedom of the press in Britain is freedom to print such of the proprietor's prejudices as the advertisers don't object to.
author: Hannen Swaffer

quote: Newspapers have developed what might be called a vested interest in catastrophe. If they can spot a fight  they play up that fight. If they can uncover a tragedy  they will headline that tragedy.
author: Harry A. Overstreet

quote: Everything you read in the newspapers is absolutely true  except for that rare story of which you happen to have first-hand knowledge.
author: Erwin Knoll

quote: I do not take a single newspaper  nor read one a month and I feel myself infinitely the happier for it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Burke said there were three Estates in Parliament  but in the reporters' gallery yonder  there sat a fourth Estate more important than them all.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Comfort the afflicted and afflict the comfortable.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: Remember  son  many a good story has been ruined by over-verification.
author: James Gordon Bennett

quote: Don't be afraid to make a mistake  your readers might like it.
author: William Randolph Hearst

quote: One newspaper a day ought to be enough for anyone who still prefers to retain a little mental balance.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: Journalism is literature in a hurry.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: The sports page records people's accomplishments  the front page usually records nothing but man's failures.
author: Earl Warren

quote: If some great catastrophe is not announced every morning  we feel a certain void. 'Nothing in the paper today ' we sigh.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Carelessness is not fatal to journalism  nor are cliches  for the eye rests lightly on them. But what is intended to be read once can seldom be read more than once  a journalist has to accept the fact that his work  by its very todayness  is excluded from any share in tomorrow.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: He had been kicked in the head by a mule when young  and believed everything he read in the Sunday papers.
author: George Ade

quote: An editor - a person employed on a newspaper  whose business it is to separate the wheat from the chaff  and to see that the chaff is printed.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The day you write to please everyone you no longer are in journalism. You are in show business.
author: Frank Miller

quote: News is the first rough draft of history.
author: Benjamin Bradlee

quote: It is a newspaper's duty to print the news and raise hell.
author: Wilbur F. Storey

quote: What you see is news  what you know is background  what you feel is opinion.
author: Lester Markel

quote: Freedom of the press is guaranteed only to those who own one.
author: A. J. Liebling

quote: A good newspaper is a nation talking to itself.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: The first essence of journalism is to know what you want to know  the second  is to find out who will tell you.
author: John Gunther

quote: Today's reporter is forced to become an educator more concerned with explaining the news than with being first on the scene.
author: Fred Friendley

quote: A writer who takes up journalism abandons the slow tempo of literature for a faster one and the change will do him harm. By degrees the flippancy of journalism will become a habit and the pleasure of being paid on the nail and more especially of being praised on the nail  grow indispensable.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Newspapers are the world's mirrors.
author: James Ellis

quote: Were it left to me to decide whether we should have a government without newspapers or newspapers without government  I should not hesitate a moment to prefer the latter.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Every editor of newspapers pays tribute to the devil.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Four hostile newspapers are more to be feared than a thousand bayonets.
author: Napoleon

quote: Let me make the newspapers  and I care not what is preached in the pulpit or what is enacted in Congress.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: AH I know is what I see in the papers.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The Night has a thousand eyes  The Day but one  Yet the light of the bright world dies With the dying sun.
author: Francis William Bourdillon

quote: For the night Shows stars and women in a better light.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Night's black Mantle covers all alike.
author: Guillaume S. du Bartas

quote: Watchman  what of the night?
author: Isaiah

quote: And the night shall be filled with music And the cares  that infest the day  Shall fold their tents  like the Arabs  And as silently steal away.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: In a real dark night of the soul it is always three o'clock in the morning.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: The nearer the dawn the darker the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The night is dark  and I am far from home.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: To all  to each  a fair good night  And pleasing dreams  and slumbers light.
author: Walter Scott

quote: It is the hour when from the boughs The nightingale's high note is heard  It is the hour when lovers' vows Seem sweet in every whisper'd word.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Hark! that's the nightingale  Telling the self-same tale Her song told when this ancient earth was young: So echoes answered when her song was sung In the first wooded vale.
author: Christina G. Ross

quote: The angel of spring  the mellow-throated nightingale.
author: Sappho

quote: I am not the smartest or most talented person in the world  but I succeeded because I keep going  and going  and going.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: I know the price of success: dedication  hard work and an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Victory belongs to the most persevering.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Success generally depends upon knowing how long it takes to succeed.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
author: William Feather

quote: If you wish success in life  make perseverance your bosom friend.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: They who are the most persistent  and work in the true spirit  will invariably be the most successful.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: If at first you don't succeed  try  try  try again.
author: W. E. Hickson

quote: If at first you don't succeed  you're running about average.
author: M. H. Alderson

quote: The secret of success is constancy of purpose.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The only way to the top is by persistent  intelligent  hard work.
author: A. T. Mercier

quote: The heights by great men reached and kept Were not attained by sudden flight  But they  while their companions slept Were toiling upward in the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: I realized early on that success was tied to not giving up. Most people in this business gave up and went on to other things. If you simply didn't give up  you would outlast the people who came in on the bus with you.
author: Harrison Ford

quote: Call the roll in your memory of conspicuously successful [business] giants and  if you know anything about their careers  you will be struck by the fact that almost every one of them encountered inordinate difficulties sufficient to crush all but the gamest of spirits. Edison went hungry many times before he became famous.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Perseverance is a great element of success. If you only knock long enough and loud enough at the gate  you are sure to wake up somebody.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Four steps to achievement: plan purposefully  prepare prayerfully  proceed positively  pursue persistently.
author: William A. Ward

quote: Flaming enthusiasm  backed up by horse sense and persistence  is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Diamonds are only lumps of coal that stuck to their jobs.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: I'm hardnosed about luck. I think it sucks. Yeah  if you spend seven years looking for a job as a copywriter  and then one day somebody gives you a job  you can say  "Gee  I was lucky I happened to go up there today." But dammit  I was going to go up there sooner or later in the next seventy years. ... If you're persistent in trying and doing and working  you almost make your own fortune.
author: Jerry Delia Femina

quote: It's the plugging away that will win you the day So don't be a piker old pard! Just draw on your grit  it's so easy to quit- It's the keeping your chin up that's hard.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: No one succeeds without effort. ... Those who succeed owe their success to their perseverance.
author: Ramana Maharshi

quote: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: Be of good cheer. Do not think of today's failures  but of the success that may come tomorrow. You have set yourselves a difficult task  but you will succeed if you persevere  and you will find a joy in overcoming obstacles. Remember  no effort that we make to attain something beautiful is ever lost.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The way to succeed is never quit. That's it. But really be humble about it.... You start out lowly and humble and you carefully try to learn an accretion of little things that help you get there.
author: Alex Haley

quote: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: Continuous efforts-not strength or intelligence-is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Plodding wins the race.
author: Aesop

quote: The difficulties and struggles of today are but the price we must pay for the accomplishments and victories of tomorrow.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal: my strength lies solely in my tenacity.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: Men who have attained things worth having in this world have worked while others idled  have persevered when others gave up in despair  have practiced early in life the valuable habits of self-denial  industry  and singleness of purpose. As a result  they enjoy in later life the success so often erroneously attributed to good luck.
author: Grenville Kleiser

quote: In the realm of ideas  everything depends on enthusiasm  in the real world  all rests on perseverance.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: There's such a thin line between winning and losing.
author: John R. Tunis

quote: It is easier to begin well than to finish well.
author: Plautus

quote: I hope I shall have ambition until the day I die.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: When you put your hand to the plow  you can't put it down until you get to the end of the row.
author: Alice Paul

quote: Out of the strain of the Doing  Into the peace of the Done.
author: Julia Louise Woodruff

quote: Great is the art of beginning  but greater is the art of ending.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: There are two parts to the creative endeavor: making something  then disseminating it.
author: Jane Alexander

quote: A chicken doesn't stop scratching just because worms are scarce.
author: Grandma Axiom

quote: Everyone has his superstitions. One of mine has always been when I started to go anywhere  or to do anything  never to turn back or to stop until the thing intended was accomplished.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: I just kept on doing what everyone starts out doing. The real question is  why did other people stop?
author: William Stafford

quote: Men perish because they cannot join the beginning with the end.
author: Alcmaeon

quote: Business is full of brilliant men who started out with a spurt and lacked the stamina to finish. Their places were taken by patient and unshowy plodders who never knew when to quit.
author: J. R. Todd

quote: I can remember walking as a child. It was not customary to say you were fatigued. It was customary to complete the goal of the expedition.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: He that has cut the claws of the lion will not feel quite secure until he has also drawn his teeth.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Courage to start and willingness to keep everlasting at it are the requisites for success.
author: Alonzo Newton Benn

quote: I went for years not finishing anything. Because  of course  when you finish something you can be judged.... I had poems which were rewritten so many times I suspect it was just a way of avoiding sending them out.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Let no one 'til his death be called unhappy. Measure not the work Until the day's out  and the labor done: Then bring your gauges.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: All is well that ends well.
author: John Heywood

quote: Either do not attempt at all  or go through with it.
author: Ovid

quote: In soloing-as in other activities-it is far easier to start something than it is to finish it.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: It is a matter first of beginning-and then following through.
author: Richard L. Evans

quote: Genius begins great works  labor alone finishes it.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: There is but an inch of difference between the cushioned chamber and the padded cell.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The only way to find out if you can write is to set aside a certain period every day and try. Save enough money to give yourself six months to be a full-time writer. Work every day and the pages will pile up.
author: Judith Krantz

quote: I work every day-or at least I force myself into my office or room. I may get nothing done  but you don't earn bonuses without putting in time. Nothing may come for three months  but you don't earn the fourth without it.
author: Mordecai Richler

quote: When nothing seems to help  I go and look at a stonecutter hammering away at his rock perhaps a hundred times without as much as a crack showing in it. Yet at the hundred and first blow it will split in two  and I know it was not that blow that did it  but all that had gone before.
author: Jacob A. Riis

quote: The drops of rain make a hole in the stone not by violence  but by oft falling.
author: Lucretius

quote: It does not matter how slowly you go  so long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

quote: Live with no time out.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: The great thing in this world is not so much where we are  but in what direction we are moving.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: My parents told me that people will never know how long it takes you to do something. They will only know how well it is done.
author: Nancy Hanks

quote: By perseverance the snail reached the Ark.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: Our desire must be like a slow and stately ship  sailing across endless oceans  never in search of safe anchorage. Then suddenly  unexpectedly  it will find mooring for a moment.
author: Etty Hillesum

quote: If we are facing in the right direction  all we have to do is keep on walking.
author: Ancient Buddhist proverb

quote: I'm a slow walker  but I never walk back.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Slow and steady wins the race.
author: Robert Lloyd

quote: Character is built into the spiritual fabric of personality hour by hour  day by day  year by year in much the same deliberate way that physical health is built into the body.
author: E. Lamar Kincaid

quote: No great thing is created suddenly.
author: Epictetus

quote: Be content to grow a little each day. If the improvement is the sort of thing which is very slow  do not measure it too often. Do a self-comparison every two weeks  or every six months  whatever is appropriate.
author: Lewis E Presnall

quote: Pray that success will not come any faster than you are able to endure it.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Plodding wins the race.
author: Aesop

quote: The way of progress is neither swift nor easy.
author: Marie Curie

quote: One thing at a time  all things in succession. That which grows slowly endures.
author: J. G. Hubbard

quote: Make haste slowly.
author: Augustus

quote: Slow motion gets you there faster.
author: Hoagy Carmichael

quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: I am suffocated and lost when I have not the bright feeling of progression.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: The lowest ebb is the turn of the tide.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: You give ioo percent in the first half of the game  and if that isn't enough  in the second half you give what's left.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Don't get hung up on a snag in the stream  my dear. Snags are not so dangerous-it's the debris that clings to them that makes the trouble. Pull yourself loose and go on.
author: Anne Shannon Monroe

quote: One can go a long way after one is tired.
author: French proverb

quote: The great thing  and the hard thing  is to stick to things when you have outlived the first interest  and not yet got the second  which comes with a sort of mastery.
author: Janet Erskine Stuart

quote: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: No one ever did anything worth doing unless he was prepared to go on with it long after it became something of a bore.
author: Douglas V. Steere

quote: I've been failing for like  ten or eleven years. When it turns  it'll turn. Right now I'm just tryin' to squeeze through a very tight financial period  get the movie out  and put my things in order.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: In our day  when a pitcher got into trouble in a game  instead of taking him out  our manager would leave him in and tell him to pitch his way out of trouble.
author: Cy Young

quote: I'm a little wounded  but I am not slain  I will lay me down to bleed a while. Then I'll rise and fight again.
author: John Dryden

quote: The tragedy of life is not that man loses  but that he almost wins.
author: Heywood Broun

quote: Where I am today has everything to do with the years I spent hanging on to a career by my fingernails.
author: Barbara Aronstein Black

quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: Every great work  every big accomplishment  has been brought into manifestation through holding to the vision  and often just before the big achievement  comes apparent failure and discouragement.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

quote: The line between failure and success is so fine that we ... are often on the line and do not know it. How many a man has thrown up his hands at a time when a little more effort  a little more patience  would have achieved success. A little more persistence  a little more effort  and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: When you get to the end of your rope  tie a knot and hang on.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: Saints are sinners who kept on going.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: We can do anything we want to do if we stick to it long enough.
author: Helen Keller

quote: When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you  'til it seems as though you could not hold on a minute longer  never give up then  for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: Men do not fail  they stop trying.
author: Elihu Root

quote: It ain't over 'til it's over.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Triumph often is nearest when defeat seems inescapable.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Don't bother about genius. Don't worry about being clever. Trust to hard work  perseverance and determination. And the best motto for a long march is  "Don't grumble. Plug on!"
author: Sir Frederick Treves

quote: Some men give up their designs when they have almost reached the goal  while others  on the contrary  obtain a victory by exerting  at the last moment  more vigorous efforts than before.
author: Polybius

quote: Never stop. One always stops as soon as something is about to happen.
author: Peter Brook

quote: Many of life's failures are men who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Fight one more round. When your feet are so tired you have to shuffle back to the center of the ring  fight one more round.
author: James J. Corbett

quote: If something doesn't come up the way you want  you have to forge ahead.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: Fortune is like the market  where many times  if you can stay a little  the price will fall.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: This man Wellington is so stupid he does not know when he is beaten  and goes on fighting.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: He never knew when he was whipped ... so he never was.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Entrepreneurs average 3.8 failures before a final success. What sets the successful ones apart is their amazing persistence. There are a lot of people out there with good and marketable ideas  but pure entrepreneurial types almost never accept defeat.
author: Lisa M. Amos

quote: As long as a person doesn't admit he is defeated  he is not defeated-he's just a little behind  and isn't through fighting.
author: Darrell Royal

quote: Only yield when you must  never "give up the ship " but fight on to the last "with a stiff upper lip!"
author: Phoebe Cary

quote: Defeat never comes to any man until he admits it.
author: Josephus Daniels

quote: There is something in me-I just can't stand to admit defeat.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: There was no such thing as defeat if you didn't accept it.
author: Fay Weldon

quote: Never give in! Never give in! Never  never  never  never.... In nothing great or small  large or petty  never give in except to convictions or honor and good sense!
author: Winston Churchill

quote: First there are those who are winners  and know they are winners. Then there are the losers who know they are losers. Then there are those who are not winners  but don't know it. They're the ones for me. They never quit trying. They're the soul of our game.
author: Paul William

quote: It's not worthy of human beings to give up.
author: Alva Reimer Myrdal

quote: Never admit defeat!
author: Arthur Rimbaud

quote: We shall go on to the end. We shall fight in France  we shall fight with growing confidence and growing strength in the air  we shall defend our island  whatever the cost may be. We shall fight on the beaches  we shall fight on the landing grounds  we shall fight in the fields  and in the streets  we shall fight in the halls. We shall never surrender.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Patient endurance attends to all things.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: To be somebody you must last.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: Emotional maturity is the ability to stick to a job and to struggle through until it is finished  to endure unpleasantness  discomfort and frustration.
author: Edward A. Strecker

quote: To bear is to conquer our fate.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: Keep breathing.
author: Sophie Tucker

quote: It helps  I think  to consider ourselves on a very long journey: the main thing is to keep to the faith  to endure  to help each other when we stumble or tire  to weep and press on.
author: Mary Caroline Richards

quote: The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last in it  and not be smashed by it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The first need of being is endurance  to endure with gladness if we can  with fortitude in any event.
author: Bliss Carman

quote: I bend  but I do not break.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Whatever necessity lays upon thee  endure  whatever she commands  do.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: To be somebody you must last.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: In the clutch of circumstance  I have not winced or cried aloud  Under the bludgeoning of chance  my head is bloody  but unbowed.
author: William E. Henley

quote: We shall live to fight again  and to strike another blow.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Giving up is the ultimate tragedy.
author: Robert J. Donovan

quote: God Almighty hates a quitter.
author: Samuel Fessenden

quote: Endurance is one of the most difficult disciplines  but it is to the one who endures that the final victory comes.
author: Buddha

quote: Endure  and preserve yourselves for better things.
author: Virgil

quote: Every kind of fortune is to be overcome by bearing it.
author: Virgil

quote: When we see ourselves in a situation which must be endured and gone through  it is best to make up our minds to meet it with firmness  and accommodate everything to it in the best way practical. This lessons the evil  while fretting and fuming only serve to increase your own torments.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: If you want to see the sun shine  you have to weather the storm.
author: Frank Lane

quote: If you want the rainbow  you gotta put up with the rain.
author: Dolly Parton

quote: What cannot be altered must be borne  not blamed.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: He that can't endure the bad will not live to see the good.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: To struggle when hope is banished. To live when life's salt is gone! To dwell in a dream that's vanished- To endure  and go calmly on!
author: Ben Johnson

quote: A high heart ought to bear calamities and not flee them  since in bearing them appears the grandeur of the mind  and in fleeing them the cowardice of the heart.
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: Endurance is nobler than strength  and patience than beauty.
author: John Ruskin

quote: They merit more praise who know how to suffer misery than those who temper themselves with contentment.
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: We must endure what fortune sends.
author: Greek proverb

quote: People can bear anything.
author: Philip Slater

quote: We must learn from life how to suffer it.
author: French proverb

quote: This is courage in a man: to bear unflinchingly what heaven sends.
author: Euripides

quote: Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit.
author: Bern Williams

quote: Obstacles cannot crush me  every obstacle yields to stern resolve.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Hold on with a bulldog grip  and chew and choke as much as possible.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: There remain times when one can only endure. One lives on  one doesn't die  and the only thing that one can do is to fill one's mind and time as far as possible with the concerns of other people. It doesn't bring immediate peace  but it brings the dawn nearer.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: When I look at the kids training today ... I can tell which ones are going to do well. It's not necessarily the ones who have the most natural talent or who fall the least. Sometimes it's the kids who fall the most  and keep pulling themselves up and trying again.
author: Michelle Kwan

quote: It takes far less courage to kill yourself than it takes to make yourself wake up one more time.
author: Judith Rossner

quote: Success consists of getting up just one more time than you fall.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: If I don't get off the mat  I'll lose the fight.
author: Archie Moore

quote: Persistent people begin their success where others end in failure.
author: Edward Eggleston

quote: Think of a fine painter attempting to capture an inner vision  beginning with one corner of the canvas  painting what he thinks should be there  not quite pulling it off  covering it over with white paint  and trying again  each time finding out what his painting isn't  until he finally finds out what it is. And when you finally do find out what one corner of your vision is  you're off and running.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: Vitality shows not only in the ability to persist  but in the ability to start over.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Regression in grief must be seen and supported as a means toward adaptation and health.
author: Lily Pincus

quote: To be happy  drop the words "if only" and substitute instead the words "next time."
author: Smiley Blanton

quote: Life is a maze in which we take the wrong turning before we learn to walk.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Education is hanging around until you've caught on.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: You go back to the gym and you just do it again and again until you get it right.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: As long as one keeps searching  the answers come.
author: Joan Baez

quote: How many years you have to keep on doing  until you know what to do and how to do!
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: There is no wisdom equal to that which comes after the event.
author: Geraldine Jewsbury

quote: Tolerate the ... process of coming to knowledge or certainty or clarity through sometimes apparently hopeless thickets of confusion or bewilderment. Learn not to be surprised or disheartened by the muddle you inhabit  and not to press too soon for a superficial reprieve.
author: Joe David Bellamy

quote: Learn to self-conquest  persevere thus for a time  and you will perceive very clearly the advantage which you gain from it.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: What can any of us do with his talent but try to develop his vision  so that through frequent failures we may learn better what we have missed in the past.
author: William Carlos Williams

quote: All effort is in the last analysis sustained by faith that it is worth making.
author: Ordway Tead

quote: Competition is easier to accept if you realize it is not an act of oppression or abrasion. ... I've worked with my best friends in direct competition.
author: Diane Sawyer

quote: Life has no smooth road for any of us  and in the bracing atmosphere of a high aim the very roughness stimulates the climber to steadier steps till the legend  "over steep ways to the stars " fulfills itself.
author: W. C. Doane

quote: The one who cares the most wins. ... That's how I knew I'd end up with everyone else waving the white flags and not me. That's how I knew I'd be the last person standing when it was all over. ... I cared the most.
author: Roseanne Barr

quote: If I had refused to institute a negotiation or had not persevered in it  I would have been degraded in my own estimation as a man of honor.
author: John Adams

quote: I read my own books sometimes to cheer me when it is hard to write  and then I remember that it was always difficult  and how nearly impossible it was sometimes.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The difference between perseverance and obstinacy is that one comes from a strong will  and the other from a strong won't.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: When you're a professional  you come back no matter what happened the day before.
author: Billy Martin

quote: We can do whatever we wish to do provided our wish is strong enough. ... What do you want most to do? That's what I have to keep asking myself  in the face of difficulties.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Desire and hope will push us on toward the future.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The champ may have lost his stuff temporarily or permanently  he can't be sure. When he can no longer throw his high hard one  he throws his heart instead. He throws something. He just doesn't walk off the mound and weep.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: We attempt nothing great but from a sense of the difficulties we have to encounter  we persevere in nothing great but from a pride in overcoming them.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: He turns not back who is bound to a star.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: What helps me go forward is that I stay receptive  I feel that anything can happen.
author: Anouk Aimee

quote: There was a Texas Ranger one time who said that there's no stopping a man who knows he's in the right and keeps a-coming.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: When you get to the end of your rope  tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: People with good intentions never give up!
author: Jane Smiley

quote: If I see a door comin' my way  I'm knockin' it down. And if I can't knock down the door  I'm sliding through the window.
author: Rosie Perez

quote: All my life I've been competing-and competing to win. I came to realize that in this way  this cancer was the toughest competition I had faced yet. I made up my mind that I was going to lick it all the way. I not only wasn't going to let it kill me  I wasn't even going to let it put me on the shelf.
author: Babe Didrikson Zaharias

quote: I have accepted fear as a part of life-specifically the fear of change. ... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back. ...
author: Erica Jong

quote: The unifying of opposites is the eternal process.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: "Brave admiral  say but one good word: What shall we do when hope is gone?" The words leapt like a leaping sword: "Sail on! sail on! and on!"
author: Joaquin Miller

quote: In Hollywood  all marriages are happy. It's trying to live together afterwards that causes problems.
author: Shelley Winters

quote: We must dare  and dare again  and go on daring.
author: Georges Jacques Danton

quote: Austere perseverance  harsh and continuous  may be employed by the least of us and rarely fails of its purpose  for its silent power grows irresistibly greater with time.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Grant me the courage not to give up  even though I think it is hopeless.
author: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz

quote: I try. I am trying. I was trying. I will try. I shall in the meantime try. I sometimes have tried. I shall still by that time be trying.
author: Diane Glancy

quote: Hard times ain't quit and we ain't quit.
author: Meridel Le Sueur

quote: All the sugar was in the bottom of the cup.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: I have often been adrift  but I have always stayed afloat.
author: David Berry

quote: God helps those who persevere.
author: Koran
