quote: Like ships  men flounder time and time again.
author: Henry Miller

quote: To strive  to seek  to find  and not to yield.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: To keep a lamp burning we have to keep putting oil in it.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: If you stop struggling  then you stop life.
author: Huey Newton

quote: One thing we learned. To make a start and keep plugging. When I had fights at school  the little while I went  I just bowed my neck and kept swinging until something hit the dirt. Sometimes it was me  but I always got up.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Jesus taught that perseverance is the essential element of prayer. Men must be in earnest when they kneel at God's footstool. Too often we get faint-hearted and quit praying at the point when we ought to begin. We let go at the very point where we should hold on strongest. Our prayers are weak because they are not impassioned by an unfailing and resistless will.
author: E. M. Bounds

quote: Be strong! It matters not how deep entrenched the wrong How hard the battle goes  the day how long Faint not-fight on! Tomorrow comes the song.
author: Maltbie D. Babcock

quote: Never grow a wishbone  daughter  where your backbone ought to be.
author: Clementine Paddleford

quote: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure.
author: William Saroyan

quote: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Send your noble blood to market and see what it will bring.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Noble blood is an accident of fortune  noble actions characterize the great.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: Be noble in every thought And in every deed!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The Owl and the Pussy-Cat went to sea In a beautiful pea-green boat.
author: Edward Lear

quote: No one is exempt from talking nonsense  the misfortune is to do it solemnly.
author: Michel Montaigne

quote: Plain as a nose in a man's face.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: Give me a man with a good allowance of nose ... when I want any good head-work done I choose a man - provided his education has been suitable - with a long nose.
author: Napoleon

quote: If the nose of Cleopatra had been a little shorter the whole face of the world would have been changed.
author: Pascal

quote: Nothing to do but work  Nothing to eat but food  Nothing to wear but clothes  To keep one from going nude.
author: Ben King

quote: Blessed be he who expects nothing  for he shall never be disappointed.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: They laboriously do nothing.
author: Seneca

quote: A life of nothing's nothing worth  From that first nothing ere his birth  To that last nothing under earth.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: You can have no oath registered in heaven to destroy the Government  while I shall have the most solemn one to "preserve  protect  and defend" it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Let they child's first lesson be obedience  and the second will be what thou wilt.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Women are perfectly well aware that the more they seem to obey the more they rule.
author: Jules Michelet

quote: I give the fight up  let there be an end  A privacy  an obscure nook for me  I want to be forgotten even by God.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Full many a flower is born to blush unseen  And waste its sweetness on the desert air.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: How happy is the blameless vestal's lot! The world forgetting  by the world forgot.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: How many a rustic Milton has passed by  Stifling the speechless longings of his heart In unremitting drudgery and care! How many a vulgar Cato has compelled His energies  no longer tameless then  To mold a pin  or fabricate a nail!
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Thus let me live  unseen  unknown  Thus unlamented let me die  Steal from the world  and not a stone Tell where I lie.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: 'Tis distance lends enchantment to the view  and robes the mountain in its azure hue.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: All of us are watchers - of television  of time clocks  of traffic on the freeway - but few are observers. Everyone is looking  not many are seeing.
author: Peter M. Leschak

quote: As a man is  so he sees.
author: William Blake

quote: I keep six honest serving-men they taught me all I know  their names are What and Why and When and How and Where and Who
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: I rather like the world. The flesh is pleasing and the Devil does not trouble me.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: It is the theory that decides what can be observed.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Mystery is not profoundness.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The eyes are the window of the soul.
author: Old saying

quote: To survive the day is triumph enough for the walking wounded among the great many of us.
author: Studs Terkel

quote: The eyes believe themselves  the ears believe other people.
author: German proverb

quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: The things we see are the mind's best bet as to what is out front.
author: Adelbert Ames

quote: You can observe a lot just by watching.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: The ear tends to be lazy  craves the familiar and is shocked by the unexpected  the eye  on the other hand  tends to be impatient  craves the novel and is bored by repetition.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: One must always tell what one sees. Above all  which is more difficult  one must always see what one sees.
author: Charles Peguy

quote: A fool sees not the same tree that a wise man sees.
author: William Blake

quote: Cultivated men and women who do not skim the cream of life  and are attached to the duties  yet escape the harsher blows  make acute and balanced observers.
author: George Meredith

quote: The lower classes of men  though they do not think it worthwhile to record what they perceive  nevertheless perceive everything that is worth noting  the difference between them and a man of learning often consists in nothing more than the latter's facility for expression.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: There's none so blind as those who won't see.
author: English proverb

quote: Obstinacy and vehemency in opinion are the surest proofs of stupidity.
author: Bernard Barton

quote: An obstinate man does not hold opinions  but they hold him.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I hold every man a debtor to his profession  from the which as men of course do seek to receive countenance and profit  so ought they of duty to endeavor themselves  by way of amends  to be a help and ornament thereunto.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: The ugliest of trades have their moments of pleasure. Now  if I were a grave-digger  or even a hangman  there are some people I could work for with a great deal of enjoyment.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Full many a gem of purest ray serene  The dark unfathomed caves of ocean bear.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: The breaking waves dashed high On a stern and rock-bound coast. And the woods against a stormy sky  Their giant branches toss'd.
author: Felicia D. Hemans

quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Praise the sea  but keep on land.
author: George Herbert

quote: Rocked in the cradle of the deep  I lay me down in peace to sleep.
author: Emma Willard

quote: The very essence of a free government consists in considering offices as public trusts  bestowed for the good of the country  and not for the benefit of an individual or a party.
author: John Caldwell Calhoun

quote: If a due participation of office is a matter of right  how are vacancies to be obtained? Those by death are few: by resignation  none.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: This struggle and scramble for office  for a way to live without work  will finally test the strength of our institutions.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.
author: Euripides

quote: Youth troubles over eternity  age grasps at a day and is satisfied to have even the day.
author: Dame Mary Gilmore

quote: Nothing is worth more than this day.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: I have come to understand that every day is something to cherish.
author: Kerri Strug

quote: What a folly to dread the thought of throwing away life at once  and yet have no regard to throwing it away by parcels and piecemeal.
author: John Howe

quote: Not a day passes over this earth but men and women of note do great deeds  speak great words and suffer noble sorrows.
author: Charles Reed

quote: We create our fate every day we live.
author: Henry Miller

quote: May you live all the days of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: If we only knew the real value of a day.
author: Joseph Farrell

quote: We are involved in a life that passes understanding: our highest business is our daily life.
author: John Cage

quote: We die daily. Happy those who daily come to life as well.
author: George Macdonald

quote: He who has lived a day has lived an age.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Life  we learn too late  is in the living  in the tissue of every day and hour.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: To sensible men  every day is a day of reckoning.
author: John W. Gardner

quote: A day's impact is better than a month of dead pull.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: They deem me mad because I will not sell my days for gold  and I deem them mad because they think my days have a price.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: The proper function of man is to live  not to exist. I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them.
author: Jack London

quote: A day  an hour  of virtuous liberty is worth a whole eternity in bondage.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Live mindful of how brief your life is.
author: Horace

quote: Gladly accept the gifts of the present hour.
author: Horace

quote: Everyone once  once only. Just once and no more. And we also once. Never again.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Most of us spend our lives as if we had another one in the bank.
author: Ben Irwin

quote: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
author: Sister Elizabeth Kenny

quote: While we live  let us live.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: No objects of value ... are worth risking the priceless experience of waking up one more day.
author: Jack Smith

quote: Every possession and every happiness is but lent by chance for an uncertain time  and may therefore be demanded back the next hour.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Some days you tame the tiger. And some days the tiger has you for lunch.
author: Tug McGraw

quote: You have got to own your days and live them  each one of them  every one of them  or else the years go right by and none of them belong to you.
author: Herb Gardner

quote: The ideal never comes. Today is ideal for him who makes it so.
author: Horatio W. Dresser

quote: True wisdom lies in gathering the precious things out of each day as it goes by.
author: E. S. Bouton

quote: He possesses dominion over himself  and is happy  who can every day say  "I have lived." Tomorrow the heavenly Father may either involve the world in dark clouds  or cheer it with clear sunshine  he will not  however  render ineffectual the things which have already taken place.
author: Horace

quote: Each day  each hour  an entire life.
author: Juan Ramon Jimenez

quote: Your daily life is your temple and your religion.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Life is now ... this day  this hour ... and is probably the only experience of the kind one is to have.
author: Charles Macomb Flandrau

quote: Seize the hour.
author: Sophocles

quote: Time  like money  is measured by our needs.
author: George Eliot

quote: Nothing is ours except time.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Nothing in business is so valuable as time.
author: John H. Patterson

quote: Many people take no care of their money till they come nearly to the end of it  and others do just the same with their time.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Possessions dwindle: I mourn their loss. But I mourn the loss of time much more  for anyone can save his purse  but none can win back lost time.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Riches are chiefly good because they give us time.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: One realizes the full importance of time only when there is little of it left. Every man's greatest capital asset is his unexpired years of productive life.
author: Paul W. Litchfield

quote: Know the true value of time  snatch  seize  and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness  no laziness  no procrastination: never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: A sense of the value of time ... is an essential preliminary to efficient work  it is the only method of avoiding hurry.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: All my possessions for a moment of time.
author: Queen Elizabeth I

quote: Let me tell thee  time is a very precious gift of God  so precious that it's only given to us moment by moment.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: Pick my left pocket of its silver dime  but spare the right-it holds my golden time!
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: We work not only to produce  but to give value to time.
author: Eugene Delacroix

quote: Dollars cannot buy yesterday.
author: Admiral Harold R. Stark

quote: As every thread of gold is valuable  so is every moment of time.
author: John Mason

quote: Minutes are worth more than money. Spend them wisely.
author: Thomas P. Murphy

quote: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have  and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Every minute of life carries with it its miraculous value  and its face of eter1nal youth.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: If a person gives you his time  he can give you no more precious gift.
author: Frank Tyger

quote: You may ask me for anything you like except time.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The laboring man and the artificer knows what every hour of his time is worth  and parts not with it but for the full value.
author: Lord Clarendon

quote: Time isn't a commodity  something you pass around like cake. Time is the substance of life. When anyone asks you to give your time  they're really asking for a chunk of your life.
author: Antoinette Bosco

quote: Love and time-those are the only two things in all the world and all of life that cannot be bought  but only spent.
author: Gary Jennings

quote: There is nothing good in this world which time does not improve.
author: Alexander Smith

quote: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Laertius Diogenes

quote: The great rule of moral conduct is  next to God  to respect Time.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: One hour of life  crowded to the full with glorious action and filled with noble risks  is worth whole years of those mean observances of paltry decorum.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: Don't be fooled by the calendar. There are only as many days in the year as you make use of. One man gets only a week's value out of a year while another man gets a full year's value out of a week.
author: Charles Richards

quote: Our costliest expenditure is time.
author: Theophrastus

quote: The Importance of Using Time Well How pleasant it is  at the end of the day  No follies to have to repent  But reflect on the past  and be able to say  That my time has been properly spent.
author: Ann Taylor

quote: I must govern the clock  not be governed by it.
author: Golda Meir

quote: You are no more exempt from time's inexorable passing than Macbeth. Whether time is your friend or foe depends on how you use it
author: Patricia Fripp

quote: Millions long for immortality who do not know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
author: Susan Ertz

quote: The organized person ... makes the most of his time and goes to his bed for the night perfectly relaxed for rest and renewal.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Have regular hours for work and play  make each day both useful and pleasant  and prove that you understand the worth of time by employing it well. Then youth will be delightful  old age will bring few regrets  and life will become a beautiful success.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: He who every morning plans the transactions of the day and follows out that plan carries a thread that will guide him through the labyrinth of the most busy life. ... If the disposal of time is surrendered merely to the chance of incident  chaos will soon reign.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Have a time and place for everything  and do everything in its time and place  and you will not only accomplish more  but have far more leisure than those who are always hurrying.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: It is not how many years we live  but rather what we do with them.
author: Evangeline Cory Booth

quote: During a very busy life I have often been asked  "How did you manage to it all?" The answer is very simple: it is because I did everything promptly.
author: Sir Richard Tangye

quote: Seize time by the forelock.
author: Pittacus

quote: Time is a tyranny to be abolished.
author: Eugene Jolus

quote: The time which we have at our disposal every day is elastic  the passions that we feel expand it  those that we inspire contract it  and habit fills up the rest.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: The ability to concentrate and to use time well is everything.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: Time is an equal opportunity employer. Each human being has exactly the same number of hours and minutes every day. Rich people can't buy more hours. Scientists can't invent new minutes. And you can't save time to spend it on another day. Even so  time is amazingly fair and forgiving. No matter how much time you've wasted in the past  you still have an entire tomorrow. Success depends upon using it wisely-by planning and setting priorities.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: Timely service  like timely gifts  is doubled in value.
author: George Macdonald

quote: Time is the one thing that can never be retrieved.
author: C. R. Lawton

quote: We must use time as a tool  not as a crutch.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: O  for an engine to keep back all clocks!
author: Ben Johnson

quote: You may delay  but time will not.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He who would make serious use of his life must always act as though he had a long time to live and schedule his time as though he were about to die.
author: Emile Littre

quote: The highest value in life is found in the stewardship of time.
author: Robert M. Fine

quote: A stale mind is the devil's breadbox.
author: Mary Bly

quote: I wish I could stand on a busy corner  hat in hand  and beg people to throw me all their wasted hours.
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: Every day I live I am more convinced that the waste of life lies in the love we have not given  the powers we have not used  the selfish prudence that will risk nothing and which  shirking pain  misses happiness as well.
author: Mary Cholmondeley

quote: Wasted time means wasted lives.
author: R. Shannon

quote: Regret for time wasted can become a power for good in the time that remains  if we will only stop the waste and the idle  useless regretting.
author: Arthur Brisbane

quote: Economy is the thief of time.
author: Ethel Watts Mumford

quote: All that time is lost which might be better employed.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Lost  yesterday  somewhere between sunrise and sunset  two golden hours  each set with sixty diamond minutes. No reward is offered  for they are gone forever.
author: Horace Mann

quote: Thrift of time will repay you in afterlife  with a usury of profit beyond your most sanguine dreams  waste of it will make you dwindle  alike in intellectual and moral stature  beyond your darkest reckoning.
author: William Gladstone

quote: Time is lost when we have not lived a full human life  time unenriched by experience  creative endeavor  enjoyment  and suffering.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: Still on it creeps  Each little moment at another's heels  Till hours  days  years  and ages are made up Of such small parts as these  and men look back Worn and bewilder'd  wondering how it is.
author: Joanna Baillie

quote: Does't thou love life? Then do not squander time  for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Time wasted is a theft from God.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Lost time is like a run in a stocking. It always gets worse.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Killing time is the chief end of our society.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: You can kill time or kill yourself  it comes to the same thing in the end.
author: Elsa Triolet

quote: No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Time is that which man is always trying to kill  but which ends in killing him.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Do not wait for leaders  do it alone  person to person.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Men talk of killing time  while time quietly kills them.
author: Dion Boucicault

quote: Modern man thinks he loses something-time-when he does not do things quickly. Yet he does not know what to do with the time he gains- except kill it.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: If you want to kill time  try working it to death.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of life has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: If time be of all things most precious  wasting time must be the greatest prodigality  since lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Don't agonize. Organize.
author: Florynce Kennedy

quote: Curse ruthless time! Curse our mortality. How cruelly short is the allotted span for all we must cram into it!
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Death and taxes and childbirth! There's never any convenient time for any of them!
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: There is a time for work. And a time for love. That leaves no other time.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: You will never "find" time for anything. If you want time you must make it.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: We have as much time as we need.
author: Melody Beattie

quote: Ah! the clock is always slow  it is later than you think.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: The forty-four-hour week has no charm for me. I'm looking for a forty-hour day.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: Those who make the worst use of their time most complain of its brevity.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: I still find each day too short for all the thoughts I want to think  all the walks I want to take  all the books I want to read  and all the friends I want to see.
author: John Burroughs

quote: What we love to do we find time to do.
author: John Lancaster Spalding

quote: There is time for everything.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: It is nonsense to say there is not enough time to be fully informed. ... Time given to thought is the greatest timesaver of all.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: We all find time to do what we really want to do.
author: William Feather

quote: Time is a fixed income and  as with any income  the real problem facing most of us is how to live successfully within our daily allotment.
author: Margaret B. Johnstone

quote: We shall never have more time. We have  and have always had  all the time there is. No object is served in waiting until next week or even until to-morrow. Keep going. ... Concentrate on something useful.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: There is time enough for everything in the course of the day if you do but one thing at once  but there is not time enough in the year if you will do two things at a time.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Much may be done in those little shreds and patches of time which every day produces  and which most men throw away.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Learn to use ten minutes intelligently. It will pay you huge dividends.
author: William A. Irwin

quote: It is better to do the most trifling thing in the world than to regard half an hour as trifle.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: I recommend you to take care of the minutes  for the hours will take care of themselves.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: The real secret of how to use time is to pack it as you would a portmanteau  filling up the small spaces with small things.
author: Sir Henry Haddow

quote: One must learn a different... sense of time  one that depends more on small amounts than big ones.
author: Sister Mary Paul

quote: An earnest purpose finds time  or makes it. It seizes on spare moments  and turns fragments to golden account.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments  and has time enough.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: That man is happiest who lives from day to day and asks no more  garnering the simple goodness of life.
author: Euripides

quote: It is only possible to live happily-ever-after on a day-to-day basis.
author: Margaret Bonnano

quote: Happiness is produced not so much by great pieces of good fortune that seldom happen  as by little advantages that occur every day.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: All the great blessings of my life are present in my thoughts today.
author: Phoebe Cary

quote: The best way to secure future happiness is to be as happy as is rightfully possible today.
author: Charles W. Eliot

quote: A fool bolts pleasure  then complains of indigestion.
author: Minna Antrim

quote: Happiness is to be found along the way  not at the end of the road  for then the journey is over and it is too late. Today  this hour  this minute is the day  the hour  the minute for each of us to sense the fact that life is good  with all of its trials and troubles  and perhaps more interesting because of them.
author: Robert R. Updegraff

quote: Each day provides its own gifts.
author: Martial

quote: Let us savour the swift delights of the most beautiful of our days!
author: Alphonse de Lamartine

quote: Death accompanies us at every step and enables us to use those moments when life smiles at us to feel more deeply the sweetness of life. The more certain the end  the more tempting the minute.
author: Theodore Fontane

quote: Happiness is not a state to arrive at  but a manner of traveling.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quote: My advice to you is not to inquire why or whither  but just to enjoy your ice cream while it's on your plate.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Those who face that which is actually before them  unburdened by the past  undistracted by the future  these are they who live  who make the best use of their lives  these are those who have found the secret of contentment.
author: Alban Goodier

quote: And that was victory. The freedom to sprawl loosely upon a city street  heat his coffee and eat a can of beans ... with no enemy bullets forcing him to toss the can aside while diving behind another wall for momentary survival.
author: David Douglas Duncan

quote: Taking time to live is taking time to appreciate simple silence as better than any kind of talk  or watching a flower  or watching a guy wash the windows on a skyscraper and wondering what he is thinking.
author: Gersi Douchan

quote: If you observe a really happy man  you will find ... that he is happy in tiie course of living life twenty-four crowded hours each day.
author: W. Beran Wolfe

quote: Live your life each day as you would climb a mountain. An occasional glance toward the summit keeps the goal in mind  but many beautiful scenes are to be observed from each new vantage point. Climb slowly  steadily  enjoying each passing moment  and the view from the summit will serve as a fitting climax for the journey.
author: Harold B. Melchart

quote: Present joys are more to flesh and blood Than the dull prospect of a distant good.
author: John Dryden

quote: In order to be utterly happy the only thing necessary is to refrain from comparing this moment with other moments in the past  which I often did not fully enjoy because I was comparing them with other moments of the future.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Live in day-tight compartments.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: If you are not happy here and now  you never will be.
author: Taisen Deshimaru

quote: People who postpone happiness are like children who try chasing rainbows in an effort to find the pot of gold at the rainbow's end. ... Your life will never be fulfilled until you are happy here and now.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: He's one of those Christmas Eve guys. There are people like that. . . every day in their lives is Christmas Eve.
author: Joe Garagiola

quote: Learn to drink the cup of life as it comes.
author: Agnes Turnbull

quote: Every day give yourself a good mental shampoo.
author: Sara Jordon

quote: There is no other solution to man's progress but the day's honest work  the day's honest decisions  the day's generous utterances and the day's good deed.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: Leisure for reverie  gay or somber  does much to enrich life.
author: Miriam Beard

quote: A man should hear a little music  read a little poetry  and see a fine picture every day of his life  in order that worldly cares may not obliterate the sense of the beautiful which God has implanted in the human soul.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: You have to set new goals every day.
author: Julie Krone

quote: I have resolved that from this day on  I will do all the business I can honestly  have all the fun I can reasonably  do all the good I can willingly  and save my digestion by thinking pleasantly.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Make the most of today. Translate your good intentions into actual deeds.
author: Grenville Kleiser

quote: Today is the day in which to express your noblest qualities of mind and heart  to do at least one worthy thing which you have long postponed.
author: Grenville Kleiser

quote: Do what you can  with what you have  where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Our grand business undoubtedly is not to see what lies dimly at a distance but to do what lies clearly at hand.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: My formula for living is quite simple. I get up in the morning and I go to bed at night. In between I occupy myself as best I can.
author: Cary Grant

quote: If we cannot meet our everyday surroundings with equanimity and pleasure and grow each day in some useful direction  then ... life is on the road toward misfortune  misery and destruction.
author: Luther Burbank

quote: Add each day something to fortify you against poverty and death.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: It isn't hard to be good from time to time in sports. What's tough is being good every day.
author: Willie Mays

quote: Realize life as an end in itself. Functioning is all there is.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: A homer a day will boost my pay.
author: Josh Gibson

quote: Act well at the moment  and you have performed a good action to all eternity.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: If I had my life to live over  I would start barefoot earlier in the spring and stay that way later in the fall. I would go to more dances. I would ride more merry-go-rounds. I would pick more daisies.
author: Nadine Stair

quote: Nothing determines who we will become so much as those things we choose to ignore.
author: Sandor Minab

quote: Love  and do what you like.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Take the time to come home to yourself everyday.
author: Robin Casarjean

quote: The power of a man's virtue should not be measured by his special efforts  but by his ordinary doing.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Know what you want to do  hold the thought firmly  and do every day what should be done  and every sunset will see you that much nearer the goal.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: It is no easy thing for a principle to become a man's own unless each day he maintains it and works it out in his life.
author: Epictetus

quote: Follow your bliss. -Joseph Campbell Resolve to perform what you ought. Perform without fail what you resolve.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Resolve to edge in a little reading every day  if it is but a single sentence. If you gain fifteen minutes a day  it will make itself felt at the end of the year.
author: Horace Mann

quote: I work every day-or at least I force myself into my office or room. I may get nothing done  but you don't earn bonuses without putting in time. Nothing may come for three months  but you don't get the fourth without it.
author: Mordecai Richler

quote: Take short views  hope for the best  and trust in God.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Each day can be one of triumph if you keep up your interests.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: When action grows unprofitable  gather information  when information grows unprofitable  sleep.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task  but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: To do the useful thing  to say the courageous thing  to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Showing up is 80 percent of life.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Do you know that disease and death must needs overtake us  no matter what we are doing? ... What do you wish to be doing when it overtakes you? If you have anything better to be doing when you are so overtaken  get to work on that.
author: Epictetus

quote: Have patience with all things  but chiefly have patience with yourself. Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections  but instantly set about remedying them-every day begin the task anew.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Without duty  life is soft and boneless.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: A man may fulfill the object of his existence by asking a question he cannot answer  and attempting a task he cannot achieve.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: And each man stands with his face in the light of his own drawn sword. Ready to do what a hero can.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Every day give yourself a good mental shampoo.
author: Sara Jordan

quote: To look up and not down  To look forward and not back  To look out and not in  and To lend a hand.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: I like the man who faces what he must  With steps triumphant and a heart of cheer  Who fights the daily battle without fear.
author: Sarah Knowles Bolton

quote: To accomplish our destiny ... we must cover before nightfall the distance assigned to each of us.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: Each day should be passed as though it were our last.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: One should count each day a separate life.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: If  every day  I dare to remember that I am here on loan  that this house  this hillside  these minutes are all leased to me  not given  I will never despair.
author: Erica Jong

quote: To live each day as though one's last  never flustered  never apathetic  never attitudinizing-here is perfection of character.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Look at everything as though you were seeing it for the first time or the last time. Then your time on earth will be filled with glory.
author: Betty Smith

quote: The years seem to rush by now  and I think of death as a fast approaching end of a journey-double and treble reason for loving as well as working while it is day.
author: George Eliot

quote: Study as if you were going to live forever  live as if you were going to die tomorrow.
author: Maria Mitchell

quote: Every day is a little life ... live every day as if it would be the last. Those that dare lose a day are dangerously prodigal  those that dare misspend it are desperate.
author: Joseph Hall

quote: You have to count on living every single day in a way you believe will make you feel good about your life- so that if it were over tomorrow  you'd be content with yourself.
author: Jane Seymour

quote: No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.
author: Euripides

quote: Happy the man  and happy he alone He who can call today his own He who  secure within  can say "Tomorrow  do thy worst For I have lived today."
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Do your best every day and your life will gradually expand into satisfying fullness.
author: Horatio W. Dresser

quote: There are only three colors  ten digits  and seven notes  it's what we do with them that's important.
author: Ruth Ross

quote: Any man's life will be filled with constant and unexpected encouragement if he makes up his mind to do his level best each day.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: Do each daily task the best we can  act as though the eye of opportunity were always upon us.
author: William Feather

quote: What a man accomplishes in a day depends upon the way in which he approaches his tasks. When we accept tough jobs as a challenge to our ability and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm  miracles can happen.
author: Arland Gilbert

quote: Look at a day when you are supremely satisfied at the end. It's not a day when you lounge around doing nothing  it's when you've had everything to do  and you've done it.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: So get a few laughs and do the best you can.
author: Will Rogers

quote: I come to the office each morning and stay for long hours doing what has to be done to the best of my ability. And when you've done the best you can  you can't do any better. So when I go to sleep I turn everything over to the Lord and forget it.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: That man is blest who does his best and leaves the rest.
author: Charles F. Deems

quote: When you rise in the morning  form a resolution to make the day a happy one for a fellow creature.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: He who allows his day to pass by without practicing generosity and enjoying life's pleasures is like a blacksmith's bellows  he breathes  but does not live.
author: Sanskrit proverb

quote: You have not lived a perfect day  even though you have earned your money  unless you have done something for someone who will never be able to repay you.
author: Ruth Smeltzer

quote: Think that day lost whose descending sun  views from thy hand no noble action done.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: I expect to pass through life but once. If  therefore  there can be any kindness I can show  or any good thing I can do to any fellow human being  let me do it now.
author: William Penn

quote: Be ashamed to die until you have won some victory for humanity.
author: Horace Mann

quote: The most thoroughly wasted of all days is that on which one has not laughed.
author: Nicolas de Chamfort

quote: Each day  and the living of it  has to be a conscious creation in which discipline and order are relieved with some play and pure foolishness.
author: May Sarton

quote: Sweets are good for the nerves.
author: Margarete Bieber

quote: Fat gives things flavor.
author: Julia Child

quote: Friends  I beg you do not shirk your daily task of indolence.
author: Don Marquis

quote: If someone said  "Write a sentence about your life " I'd write  "I want to go outside and play."
author: Jenna Elfman

quote: Life is about enjoying yourself and having a good time.
author: Cher

quote: Put a little fun into your life. Try dancing.
author: Kathryn Murray

quote: He who does not get fun and enjoyment out of every day ... needs to reorganize his life.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Take time every day to do something silly.
author: Philipa Walker

quote: It's fun to get together and have something good to eat at least once a day. That's what human life is all about-enjoying things.
author: Julia Child

quote: Come  let us give a little time to folly ... and even in a melancholy day let us find time for an hour of pleasure.
author: Saint Bonaventura

quote: No matter what looms ahead  if you can eat today  enjoy the sunlight today  mix good cheer with friends today  enjoy it and bless God for it.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Be Satisfied with a Good Day's Work There are hundreds of tasks we feel we must accomplish in the day  but if we do not take them one at a time ... we are bound to break our own physical or mental structure.
author: Ted Bengermino

quote: A man can do only what he can do. But if he does that each day he can sleep at night and do it again the next day.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: If I had my life to live over  I would start barefoot earlier in the spring and stay that way later in the fall. I would go to more dances. I would ride more merry-go-rounds. I would pick more daisies.
author: Nadine Stair

quote: I finally figured out the only reason to be alive is to enjoy it.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: We cannot do everything at once  but we can do something at once.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Always do one thing less than you think you can do.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: I come to the office each morning and stay for long hours doing what has to be done to the best of my ability. And when you've done the best you can  you can't do any better. So when I go to sleep I turn everything over to the Lord and forget it.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Sufficient to each day are the duties to be done and the trials to be endured.
author: T. L. Gayler

quote: I look back on my life like a good day's work  it is done  and I am satisfied with it.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: The moment we pass out of our habits we lose all sense of permanency and routine.
author: George Moore

quote: Manners are a sensitive awareness of the feelings of others. If you have that awareness  you have good manners  no matter what fork you use.
author: Emily Post

quote: And hearts have been broken from harsh words spoken That sorrow can ne'er set right.
author: Margaret Elizabeth Sangster

quote: That which is horrifying to you don't do to anybody else.
author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

quote: It is too bad if you have to do everything upon reflection and can't do anything from early habit.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: Most of life is routine-dull and grubby  but routine is the mountain that keeps a man going. If you wait for inspiration you'll be standing on the corner after the parade is a mile down the street.
author: Ben Nicholas

quote: Good habits  which bring our lower passions and appetites under automatic control  leave our natures free to explore the larger experiences of life.
author: Ralph W Sockman

quote: Without the aid of prejudice and custom  I should not be able to find my way across the room.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Ryuh

quote: Habits are safer than rules  you don't have to watch them. And you don't have to keep them  either  they keep you.
author: Dr. Frank Crane

quote: Habit is not mere subjugation  it is a tender tie  when one remembers habit it seems to have been happiness.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: To learn new habits is everything  for it is to reach the substance of life. Life is but a tissue of habits.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Choose always the way that seems the best  however rough it may be  custom will soon render it easy and agreeable.
author: Pythagoras

quote: Quality is not an act. It is a habit.
author: Aristotle

quote: It is not in novelty but in habit that we find the greatest pleasure.
author: Raymond Radiguet

quote: Habit is stronger than reason.
author: George Santayana

quote: Character is simply habit long enough continued.
author: Plutarch

quote: Nothing is more powerful than habit.
author: Ovid

quote: If you do the same thing every day at the same time for the same length of time  you'll save yourself from many a sink. Routine is a condition of survival.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Have a time and place for everything  and do everything in its time and place  and you will not only accomplish more  but have far more leisure than those who are always hurrying.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: Anyone can carry his burden  however hard  until nightfall. Anyone can do his work  however hard  for one day. Anyone can live sweetly  patiently  lovingly  purely  till the sun goes down. And this is all life really means.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: At any rate  you can bear it for a quarter of an hour!
author: Theodore Haecker

quote: The longest day is soon ended.
author: Pliny, the Younger

quote: The secret of my success is that I always managed to live to fly another day.
author: Chuck Yeager

quote: The time which we have at our disposal every day is elastic  the passions that we feel expand it  those that we inspire contract it  and habit fills up what remains.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: One day  with life and heart  is more than time enough to find a world.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: When a man sits with a pretty girl for an hour  it seems like a minute. But let him sit on a hot stove for a minute  and it's longer than any hour. That's relativity.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Too slow for those who wait  Too swift for those who fear  Too long for those who grieve  Too short for those who rejoice. But for those who love  time is not.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: The less one has to do  the less time one finds to do it in. One yawns  one procrastinates  one can do it when one will  and  therefore  one seldom does it at all  whereas those who have a great deal of business must buckle to it  and then they always find time enough to do it.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Time is nothing absolute  its duration depends on the rate of thought and feeling.
author: John Draper

quote: Time is a fluid condition which has no existence except in the momentary avatars of individual people.
author: William Faulkner

quote: What then is time? If no one asks me  I know what it is. If I wish to explain it to him who asks  I do not know.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Time is the product of changing realities  beings  existences.
author: Nicholas Berdyaev

quote: Time is a part of eternity  and of the same piece with it.
author: Moses Mendelssohn

quote: Each day is a little life  every waking and rising a little birth  every fresh morning a little youth  every going to rest and sleep a little death.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Time is eternity begun.
author: James Montgomery

quote: Time is not a line  but a series of now-points.
author: Taisen Deshimaru

quote: You can't measure time in days the way you can money in dollars  because each day is different.
author: Phillip Hewett

quote: The value of life lies not in the length of days  but in the use we make of them  a man may live long yet live very little.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Reality is a staircase going neither up nor down  we don't move  today is today  always is today.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: What runs through a person like water through a sieve.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Scrolls: write on them what you want to be remembered for.
author: Joseph Ibn Pakuda

quote: Every day is a messenger of God.
author: Russian proverb

quote: A little space of time before time expires  a little way of breath.
author: Algernon Swinburne

quote: Time is an avid gambler who has no need to cheat to win every time.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Time is the only critic without ambition.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Theophrastus

quote: Time is a storm in which we are all lost.
author: William Carlos Williams

quote: Time is the wisest counsellor of all.
author: Pericles

quote: Time is the moving image of eternity.
author: Plato

quote: Time is the soul of this world.
author: Plutarch

quote: Time is a sandpile we run our fingers in.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Time is one kind of robber whom the law does not strike at  and who steals what is most precious to men.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Time is that in which all things pass away.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Time is a file that wears and makes no noise.
author: English proverb

quote: Time is what we want most  but... what we use worst.
author: William Penn

quote: Time ... is the life of the soul.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Time is an available instrument for reaching the eternal.
author: John W. Lynch

quote: Time itself is an element.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Time is the devourer of all things.
author: Ovid

quote: Time is the subtle thief of youth.
author: John Milton

quote: Time is the rider that breaks youth.
author: George Herbert

quote: Time is an eternal guest that banquets on our ideals and bodies.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Time is an illusion-to orators.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Time is a great manager: it arranges things well.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: Time is a river without banks.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: Time is the greatest and longest-established spinner of all. ... His factory is a secret place  his work noiseless  and his hands are mutes.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Time is the stuff life's made of.
author: David Belasco

quote: Time is my estate: to Time I'm heir.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Time is change  transformation  evolution.
author: Isaac L. Peretz

quote: Time is a circus always packing up and moving away.
author: Ben Hecht

quote: Time is a dressmaker specializing in alterations.
author: Faith Baldwin

quote: Time is the greatest innovator.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Time is a wealth of change  but the clock in its parody makes it mere change and no wealth.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Time is the silent  never-resting thing ... rolling  rushing on  swift  silent  like an all-embracing oceantide  on which we and all the universe swim.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Time is a flowing river. Happy those who allow themselves to be carried  unresisting  with the current. They float through easy days. They live  unquestioning  in the moment.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: Time is a very shadow that passeth away.
author: Apocrypha

quote: Time is the author of authors.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Time is a stream which glides smoothly on and is past before we know.
author: Ovid

quote: Time is a sort of river of passing events  and strong is its current  no sooner is a thing brought to sight than it is swept by and another takes its place  and this too will be swept away.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Time is the sea in which men grow  are born  or die.
author: Freya Stark

quote: Time is the longest distance between two places.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: I'd like to introduce a man with a lot of charm  talent  and wit. Unfortunately  he couldn't be here tonight  so instead . . .
author: Melvin Helitzer

quote: I do not stand on protocol. If you just call me Excellency  it will be okay.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: The number-one fear in life is public speaking  and the number-two fear is death. This means that if you go to a funeral  you're better off in the casket than giving the eulogy.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: At the end of a long introduction: You omitted perhaps one thing - that in 1974 I had a hemorrhoidectomy.
author: Howell Heflin

quote: My father gave me these hints on speech making: Be sincere ... be brief ... be seated.
author: James Roosevelt

quote: A good speech  like a woman's skirt  should be long enough to cover the subject and short enough to create interest. I have been asked to give my address in the remaining five minutes. That I can do! Here it is: 10 Carlton Gardens  London  England.
author: Lord Balfour

quote: I sort of feel like Cindy Crawford's new husband on their wedding night. I know what's expected of me. I'm just not sure I've got the ability to make it interesting.
author: Melvin Helitzer

quote: If any of you are related to our main guest  let me know so I can speak slowly.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: As Spinoza  or someone very much like him  once said . . .
author: Judith Viorst

quote: Speeches are like steer horns - a point here  a point there  and a lot of bull in between.
author: Evelyn Anderson

quote: My job is to talk to you  and your job is to listen. If you finish first  please let me know.
author: Harry Hershfield

quote: I have noticed that the people who are late are often so much jollier than the people who have to wait for them.
author: E. V. Lucas

quote: I don't want to be patronizing . . . that means "talking down."
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: speaker: I have only ten minutes and hardly know where to begin. voice in back: Begin at the ninth.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: After such an introduction  I can hardly wait to hear what I'm going to say.
author: Evelyn Anderson

quote: I'd like to tell you some jokes now  but you'd only laugh.
author: Milton Berle

quote: I was told to be accurate  be brief  and then be seated. ... So I promise I shall be brief as possible - no matter how long it takes me.
author: Willard Pearson

quote: Thank you for the privilege of speaking to you in this magnificent auditorium. You know the meaning of the word auditorium  don't you? It is derived from two Latin words  audio  "to hear " and taurus  "the bull."
author: Larry Wilde

quote: I was chosen to speak today based on my senility.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: A toastmaster is a man who eats a meal he doesn't want so he can get up and tell a lot of stories he doesn't remember to people who've already heard them.
author: George Jessel

quote: I'm an idealist: I don't know where I'm going but I'm on my way.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: A bore is a man who spends so much time talking about himself that you can't talk about yourself.
author: Melville Landon

quote: Buffet: A French word that means "get up and get it yourself."
author: Ron Dentinger

quote: Wit is the salt of conversation  not the food.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: On how to become a good speaker: Practice all the time. One of the best ways is to put a bunch of marbles in your mouth while you talk. Slowly but surely you take away a marble. And then  when you've lost all your marbles  you're a public speaker.
author: George Jessel

quote: Once you get people laughing  they're listening and you can tell them almost anything.
author: Herb Gardner

quote: Goldie Hawn is funny  sexy  beautiful  talented  intelligent  warm  and consistently sunny. Other than that  she doesn't impress me at all.
author: Neil Simon

quote: A lot of you want me to hurry through the introduction. That's because you're so much older you don't want to waste a minute of your life.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: Even more exasperating than the guy who thinks he knows it all is the one who really does.
author: Al Bernstein

quote: We will then hear from the founder of the Mayo Clinic  . . . Dr. Ted Clinic.
author: Dave Barry

quote: The first Rotarian was the first man to call John the Baptist Jack.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Will the people in the cheaper seats clap your hands? All the rest of you  if you'll just rattle your jewelry.
author: John Lennon

quote: I thought I'd begin by reading a poem by Shakespeare  but then I thought  Why should I? He never reads any of mine.
author: Spike Milligan

quote: It has been discovered experimentally that you can draw laughter from an audience anywhere in the world  of any class or race  simply by walking on a stage and uttering the words "I am a married man."
author: Ted Kavanaugh

quote: This gathering is what I call "intimate " which really means "Where is everybody?"
author: Tim Conway

quote: Do not choose to be wrong for the sake of being different.
author: Lord Samuel

quote: If you want people to think well of you  do not speak well of yourself.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: New opinions are always suspected  and usually opposed  without any other reason but because they are not already common.
author: John Locke

quote: So many men  so many opinions.
author: Terence

quote: Three Spaniards  four opinions.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: We are so vain that we even care for the opinion of those we don't care for.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: One should respect public opinion in so far as it is necessary to avoid starvation and to keep out of prison  but anything that goes beyond this is voluntary submission to an unnecessary tyranny.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Public opinion  a vulgar  impertinent  anonymous tyrant who deliberately makes life unpleasant for anyone who is not content to be the average man.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: You've no idea what a poor opinion I have of myself - and how little I deserve it.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: Predominant opinions are generally the opinions of the generation that is vanishing.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To be positive: to be mistaken at the top of one's voice.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: When I want your opinion I'll give it to you.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: The sound of tireless voices is the price we pay for the right to hear the music of our own opinions.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: It is always considered a piece of impertinence in England if a man of less than two or three thousand a year has any opinions at all upon important subjects.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: The pressure of public opinion is like the pressure of the atmosphere  you can't see it - but all the same  it is sixteen pounds to the square inch.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The right to be heard does not automatically include the right to be taken seriously.
author: Hubert Humphrey

quote: The world is not run by thought  nor by imagination  but by opinion.
author: Elizabeth Drew

quote: 'No' and 'Yes' are words quickly said  but they need a great amount of thought before you utter them.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: I disapprove of what you say  but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is not truth  but opinion that can travel the world without a passport.
author: Walter Raleigh

quote: There never were two opinions alike in all the world  no more than two hours or two grains: the most universal quality is diversity.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: A difference of opinion is what makes horse racing and missionaries.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Public opinion is a compound of folly  weakness  prejudice  wrong feeling  right feeling  obstinacy  and newspaper paragraphs.
author: Robert Peel

quote: The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinions.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: All empty souls tend to extreme opinion.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Too often we . . . enjoy the comfort of opinion without the discomfort of thought.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Opinions cannot survive if one has no chance to fight for them.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: There are a great many opinions in this world  and a good half of them are professed by people who have never been in trouble.
author: Mavis Gallant

quote: It were not best that we should all think alike  it is difference of opinion that makes horseraces.
author: S. L. Clemens

quote: Stiff in opinion  always in the wrong.
author: John Dryden

quote: It is rare that the public sentiment decides immorally or unwisely  and the individual who differs from it ought to distrust and examine well his own opinion.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Those who never retract their opinions love themselves more than they love truth.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Public opinion  though often formed upon a wrong basis  yet generally has a strong underlying sense of justice.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Opinions cannot survive if one has no chance to fight for them.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinion.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Force and not opinion is the queen of the world  but it it opinion that uses the force.
author: Pascal

quote: Public opinion is a compound of folly  weakness  prejudice  wrong feeling  right feeling  obstinacy  and newspaper paragraphs.
author: Robert Peel

quote: The feeble tremble before opinion  the foolish defy it  the wise judge it  the skillful direct it.
author: Mme. Jeanne Roland

quote: I know where there is more wisdom than is found in Napoleon  Voltaire  or all the ministers present and to come - in public opinion.
author: Talleyrand

quote: You create your opportunities by asking for them.
author: Patty Hansen

quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Look for opportunity. You can't wait for it to knock on the door. ... You might not be home.
author: Jinger Heath

quote: If you want to succeed in the world  you must make your own opportunities.
author: John B. Gough

quote: Life is a narrative that you have a hand in writing.
author: Henriette Anne Klauser

quote: Mediocre men wait for opportunity to come to them. Strong  able  alert men go after opportunity.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: A filly who wants to run will always find a rider.
author: Jacques Audiberti

quote: Life is what we make it  always has been  always will be.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: God forgives those who invent what they need.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Many things are lost for want of asking.
author: English proverb

quote: You don't just luck into things ... you build step by step  whether it's friendships or opportunities.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
author: Sallust

quote: He that waits upon fortune is never sure of a dinner.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: There is no security on this earth. Only opportunity.
author: General Douglas MacArthur

quote: Too many people are thinking of security instead of opportunity  they seem more afraid of life than of death.
author: James F. Byrnes

quote: Freedom is nothing else but a chance to be better  whereas enslavement is a certainty of the worst.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The opportunity is often lost by deliberating.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: I have always been waiting for something better-sometimes to see the best I had snatched from me.
author: Dorothy Reed Mendenhall

quote: The sad truth is that opportunity doesn't knock twice. You can put things off until tomorrow but tomorrow may never come. Where will you be a few years down the line? Will it be everything you dreamed of? We seal our fate with the choices we take  but don't give a second thought to the chances we take.
author: Gloria Estefan

quote: You decide you'll wait for your pitch. Then as the ball starts toward the plate  you think about your stance. And then you think about your swing. And then you realize that the ball that went past you for a strike was your pitch.
author: Bobby Murcer

quote: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.
author: Demosthenes

quote: Any ritual is an opportunity for transformation.
author: Starhawk

quote: Ability is of little account without opportunity.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Our opportunities to do good are our talents.
author: Cotton Mather

quote: Opportunity knocks at every man's door once. On some men's door it hammers till it breaks down the door and then it goes in and wakes him up if he's asleep  and ever afterward it works for him as a night watchman.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: It is less important to redistribute wealth than it is to redistribute opportunity.
author: Arthur Vandenberg

quote: You can't make souffle rise twice.
author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

quote: A door that seems to stand open must be a man's size  or it is not the door that Providence means for him.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Next to knowing when to seize an opportunity  the most important thing in life is to know when to forgo an advantage.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The follies which a man regrets most in his life are those which he didn't commit when he had the opportunity.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: To see a shadow and think it is a tree-that is a pity  but to see a tree and to think it a shadow can be fatal.
author: Phyllis Bottome

quote: Great opportunities come to all  but many do not know they have met them. The only preparation to take advantage of them is simple fidelity to watch what each day brings.
author: Albert E. Dunning

quote: Opportunities are everywhere.
author: Lucy Benington

quote: Opportunities are usually disguised as hard work  so most people don't recognize them.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Great opportunities to help others seldom come  but small ones come daily.
author: Ivy Baker Priest

quote: Men do with opportunities as children do at the seashore  they fill their little hands with sand  and then let the grains fall through  one by one  till all are gone.
author: T. Jones

quote: Do not wait for ideal circumstances  nor for the best opportunities  they will never come.
author: Janet Erskine Stuart

quote: Nothing is so often irretrievably missed as a daily opportunity.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: If a man looks sharply and attentively  he shall see fortune  for though she be blind  yet she is not invisible.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Know thine opportunity.
author: Pittacus

quote: In great affairs we ought to apply ourselves less to creating chances than to profiting from those that are offered.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Opportunity is as scarce as oxygen  men fairly breathe it and do not know it.
author: Doc Sane

quote: Opportunities do not come with their values stamped upon them. ... To face every opportunity of life thoughtfully  and ask its meaning bravely and earnestly  is the only way to meet supreme opportunities when they come  whether open-faced or disguised.
author: Maltbie D. Babcock

quote: We are told that talent creates its own opportunities. But it sometimes seems that intense desire creates not only its own opportunities  but its own talents.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: How many opportunities present themselves to a man without his noticing them?
author: Arab proverb

quote: Luck affects everything. Let your hook be always cast. In the stream where you least expect it  there will be a fish.
author: Ovid

quote: The opportunity that God sends does not wake up him who is asleep.
author: Senegalese proverb

quote: Opportunities multiply as they are seized  they die when neglected. Life is a long line of opportunities.
author: John Wicker

quote: It is often hard to distinguish between the hard knocks in life and those of opportunity.
author: Frederick Phillips

quote: I think luck is the sense to recognize an opportunity and the ability to take advantage of it. Everyone has bad breaks  but everyone also has opportunities. The man who can smile at his breaks and grab his chances gets on.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: The greatest achievement of the human spirit is to live up to one's opportunities  and make the most of one's resources.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: When one door closes  another opens. But we often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door that we do not see the one which has opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The opportunities for enjoyment in your life are limitless. If you feel you are not experiencing enough joy  you have only yourself to blame.
author: David E. Bresler

quote: Opportunities are often things you haven't noticed the first time around.
author: Catherine Deneuve

quote: The successful man is one who had the chance and took it.
author: Roger Babson

quote: Vigilance in watching opportunity  tact and daring in seizing upon opportunity  force and persistence in crowding opportunity to its utmost possible achievement-these are the martial virtues which must command success.
author: Austin Phelps

quote: To avoid an occasion for our virtues is a worse degree of failure than to push forward pluckily and make a fall.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: If Fortune calls  offer him a seat.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: What the student calls a tragedy  the master calls a butterfly.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls  and looks like work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Times of stress and difficulty are seasons of opportunity when the seeds of progress are sown.
author: Thomas F. Woodlock

quote: We must look for the opportunity in every difficulty instead of being paralyzed at the thought of the difficulty in every opportunity.
author: Walter E. Cole

quote: The best impromptu speeches are the ones written well in advance.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: Opportunity can benefit no man who has not fitted himself to seize it and use it. Opportunity woos the worthy  shuns the unworthy. Prepare yourself to grasp opportunity  and opportunity is likely to come your way. It is not so fickle  capricious and unreasoning as some complain.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Opportunity rarely knocks until you are ready. And few people have ever been really ready without receiving opportunity's call.
author: Channing Pollock

quote: The secret to success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: I always keep myself in a position of being a student.
author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

quote: I think the young actor who really wants to act will find a way ... to keep at it and seize every opportunity that comes along.
author: Sir John Gielgud

quote: If you want greater prosperity in your life  start forming a vacuum to receive it.
author: Catherine Ponder

quote: Unless a man has trained himself for his chance  the chance will only make him ridiculous.
author: William Matthews

quote: Do not suppose opportunity will knock twice at your door.
author: Sebastien Chamfort

quote: Make hay while the sun shines.
author: English proverb

quote: Plough deep while sluggards sleep.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The opportunity for doing mischief is found a hundred times a day  and of doing good once in a year.
author: Voltaire

quote: In the midst of winter  I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
author: Albert Camus

quote: One cloud is enough to eclipse all the sun.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The progress of rivers to the ocean is not so rapid as that of man to error.
author: Voltaire

quote: When I look in the glass I see that every line in my face means pessimism  but in spite of my face - that is my experience - I remain an optimist.
author: Richard Jeffries

quote: An optimist is a guy that has never had much experience.
author: Don Marquis

quote: An optimist is a fellow who believes what's going to be will be postponed.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: My pessimism goes to the point of suspecting the sincerity of the pessimists.
author: Jean Rostand

quote: A pessimist is one who has been compelled to live with an optimist.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Pessimism is only the name that men of weak nerves give to wisdom.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: When it is dark enough  you can see the stars.
author: Charles A. Beard

quote: There is not enough darkness in all the world to put out the light of even one small candle.
author: Robert Alden

quote: When things come to the worst  they generally mend.
author: Susanna Moodie

quote: The optimist claims we live in the best of all possible worlds  and the pessimist fears this is true.
author: James Branch Cabell

quote: Still round the corner there may wait  a new road  or a secret gate.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: When Fortune empties her chamberpot on your head  smile and say 'We are going to have a summer shower.'
author: John A. Macdonald

quote: The world gets better every day - then worse again in the evening.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: A man he seems of cheerful yesterdays And confident tomorrows.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: There is a budding morrow in midnight.
author: John Keats

quote: To look up and not down  To look forward and not back  To look out and not in  and To lend a hand.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: Two men look out through the same bars: One sees the mud  and one the stars.
author: Frederick Langbridge

quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadow.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Oratory is the power to talk people out of their sober and natural opinions.
author: Paul Chatfield

quote: I am not fond of uttering platitudes In stained-glass attitudes.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: The object of oratory is not truth  but persuasion.
author: Macaulay

quote: What the orators want in depth  they give you in length.
author: Charles Montesquieu

quote: It is much safer to obey than to rule.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: There is no right to strike against the public safety by anybody  anywhere  anytime.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: When liberty destroys order  the hunger for order will destroy liberty.
author: Will Durant

quote: Those who are fond of setting things to rights have no great objection to setting them wrong.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: To have his path made clear for him is the aspiration of every human being in our beclouded and tempestuous existence.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Crude classifications and false generalizations are the curse of organized life.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Timing  degree and conviction are the three wise men in this life.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: We put things in order - God does the rest. Lay an iron bar east and west  it is not magnetized. Lay it north and south and it is.
author: Horace Mann

quote: I must create a system  or be enslaved by another man's.
author: William Blake

quote: Out of intense complexities intense simplicities emerge.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: There is no course of life so weak and sottish as that which is managed by order  method and discipline.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Large organization is loose organization. Nay  it would be almost as true to say that organization is always disorganization.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: That's what learning is. You suddenly understand something you understood all your life  but in a new way.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: Order is Heaven's first law.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Utter originality is  of course  out of the question.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: We do not inherit this land from our ancestors  we borrow it from our children.
author: Haida saying

quote: Why can't somebody give us a list of things that everybody thinks and nobody says  and another list of things that everybody says and nobody thinks.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Originality is nothing but judicious imitation. The most original writers borrowed one from another. The instruction we find in books is like fire. We fetch it from our neighbours  kindle it at home  communicate it to others and it becomes the property of all.
author: Voltaire

quote: Originality does not consist in saying what no one has ever said before  but in saying exactly what you think yourself.
author: James Stephens

quote: All cases are unique and very similar to others.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: I invent nothing. I rediscover.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: When people are free to do as they please  they usually imitate each other. Originality is deliberate and forced  and partakes of the nature of a protest.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: All profoundly original work looks ugly at first.
author: Clement Greenberg

quote: Riding hard for glory.
author: Irving Layton

quote: What is originality? Undetected plagiarism.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: The dogmas of the quiet past are inadequate to the stormy present. The occasion is piled high with difficulty  and we must rise with the occasion. As our case is new  so we must think anew and act anew. We must disenthrall ourselves.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: You always admire what you really don't understand.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: What you can't get is just what suits you.
author: French proverb

quote: The dream is real  my friends. The failure to realize it is the only reality.
author: Toni Cade Bambara

quote: The true exercise of freedom is-can-nily and wisely and with grace-to move inside what space confines-and not seek to know what lies beyond and cannot be touched or tasted.
author: A. S. Byatt

quote: Death and taxes and childbirth! There's never any convenient time for any of them!
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: No one is content with his own lot.
author: Horace

quote: Let us accept truth  even when it surprises us and alters our views.
author: George Sand

quote: To have ideals is not the same as to have impracticable ideals.
author: L. Susan Stebbing

quote: There has never been an age that did not applaud the past and lament the present.
author: Lillian Eichler Watson

quote: Every stage of life has its troubles  and no man is content with his own age.
author: Ausonius

quote: We love in others what we lack ourselves  and would be everything but what we are.
author: R. H. Stoddard

quote: There is less in this than meets the eye.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: When you don't have any money  the problem is food. When you have money  it's sex. When you have both  it's health. If everything is simply jake  then you're frightened of death.
author: J. P. Donleavy

quote: Diogenes was asked what wine he liked best  and he answered  "Somebody else's."
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Nothing is so good as it seems beforehand.
author: George Eliot

quote: Happiness is ... usually attributed by adults to children  and by children to adults.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: None of us is ever satisfied with what we are.
author: Terence

quote: We always long for forbidden things  k and desire what is denied us.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: Man's heart is never satisfied  the snake would swallow the elephant.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: We all envy other people's luck.
author: Latin proverb

quote: When every blessed thing you have is made of silver  or of gold  you long for simple pewter.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: I'd rather have written "Cheers" than anything I've written.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: When a man's busy  leisure strikes him as a wonderful pleasure  and at leisure once is he? Straightway he wants to be busy.
author: Robert Browning

quote: Happiness to a dog is what lies on the other side of the door.
author: Charlton Ogburn

quote: Man would be otherwise. That is the essence of the specifically human.
author: Antonio Machado

quote: He who would be happy should stay at home.
author: Greek proverb

quote: It is not irritating to be where one is. It is only irritating to think one would like to be somewhere else.
author: John Cage

quote: Pioneers may be picturesque figures  but they are often rather lonely ones.
author: Nancy Astor

quote: He that is discontented in one place will seldom be happy in another.
author: Aesop

quote: We are under the spell always of what is distant from us. It is not in our nature to desire passionately what is near at hand.
author: Alec Waugh

quote: In all climates  under all skies  man's happiness is always somewhere else.
author: Giacomo Leopardi

quote: In Rome you long for the country. In the country you praise to the skies the distant town.
author: Horace

quote: He who would be happy should stay at home.
author: Greek proverb
