quote: Life is a hospital in which every patient is possessed by the desire of changing his bed. One would prefer to suffer near the fire  and another is certain he would get well if he were by the window.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Happiness grows at our firesides  and is not to be picked in strangers' gardens.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: The proper means of increasing the love we bear our native country is to reside some time in a foreign one.
author: William Shenstone

quote: If solid happiness we prize  within our breast this jewel lies  And they are fools who roam  the world has nothing to bestow  From our own selves our bliss must flow  And that dear hut-our home.
author: Nathaniel Cotton

quote: A child on a farm sees a plane fly overhead and dreams of a faraway place. A traveler on the plane sees the farmhouse and dreams of home.
author: Carl Burns

quote: Life has no smooth road for any of us  and in the bracing atmosphere of a high aim the very roughness stimulates the climber to steadier steps till the legend  "over steep ways to the stars " fulfills itself.
author: W. C. Doane

quote: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
author: Foe Ancis

quote: Before we set our hearts too much upon anything  let us examine how happy they are who already possess it.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Nobody's problem is ideal. Nobody has things just as he would like them.
author: Dr. Frank Crane

quote: Everybody in the world ought to be sorry for everybody else. We all have our little private hell.
author: Bettina von Hutton

quote: Men would be angels  angels would be gods.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: None think the great unhappy but the great.
author: Edward Young

quote: If every man's internal care Were written on his brow  How many would our pity share Who raise our envy now?
author: Pietro Metastasio

quote: Misfortunes come to all men.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: You have no idea how big the other fellow's troubles are.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: I have been very happy  very rich  very beautiful  much adulated  very famous and very unhappy.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: I feel successful when the writing goes well. This lasts five minutes. Once  when I was on the bestseller list  I also felt successful. That lasted three minutes.
author: Jacqueline Briskin

quote: Great and small suffer the same mishaps.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: I thought I had reached a point in life where everything would be smooth. But it is not. It just gets more jagged and pitted and filled with turns that take you into the dark recesses of your mind. It never seems to get easy.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: If I were given a change of life  I'd like to see how it would be to live as a mere six-footer.
author: Wilt Chamberlain

quote: I just want to be an ordinary girl.
author: Princess Stephanie of Monaco

quote: Money is another pressure. I'm not complaining  I'm just saying that there's a certain luxury in having no money. I spent ten years in New York not having it  not worrying about it. Suddenly you have it  then you worry  where is it going? Am I doing the right thing with it?
author: Dustin Hoffman

quote: On the outside one is a star. But in reality  one is completely alone  doubting everything. To experience this loneliness of soul is the hardest thing in the world.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: There is no man in this world without some manner of tribulation or anguish  though he be king or pope.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: The only incurable troubles of the rich are the troubles that money can't cure.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: There is no man in any rank who is always at liberty to act as he would incline  in some quarter or other he is limited by circumstances.
author: Bonnie Blair

quote: None of us can be free of conflict and woe. Even the greatest men have had to accept disappointments as their daily bread. ... The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: Renown is a source of toil and sorrow  obscurity is a source of happiness.
author: Johann L. von Mosheim

quote: If I had my life to live over  I wish I could be a great pianist or something.
author: Woody Allen

quote: There is no armour against fate  death lays his icy hands on kings.
author: James Shirley

quote: Pale death with impartial tread beats at the poor man's cottage door and at the palaces of kings.
author: Horace

quote: I want to be able to live without a crowded calendar. I want to be able to read a book without feeling guilty  or go to a concert when I like.
author: Golda Meir

quote: I'd like to be a truck driver. I think you could run your life that way. It wouldn't be such a bad way of doing it. It would offer a chance to be alone.
author: Princess Anne of England

quote: There is as much confusion in the world of the gods as in ours.
author: Euripides

quote: Pray the gods do not envy your happiness!
author: Euripides

quote: The suffering of the rich is among the sweetest pleasures of the poor.
author: R. M. Huber

quote: Oh God  don't envy me  I have my own pains.
author: Barbra Streisand

quote: Success is counted sweetest by those who never succeed.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: I have known no man of genius who had not to pay  in some affliction or defect either physical or spiritual  for what the gods had given him.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: I have been very happy  very rich  very beautiful  much adulated  very famous and very unhappy.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: I feel successful when the writing goes well. This lasts five minutes. Once  when I was on the bestseller list  I also felt successful. That lasted three minutes.
author: Jacqueline Briskin

quote: Men are all the same. They always think that something they are going to get is better than what they have got.
author: John Oliver Hobbes

quote: Not all speed is movement.
author: Toni Cade

quote: Success is not greedy  as people think  but insignificant. That's why it satisfies nobody.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Oh  I wish that God had not given me what I prayed for! It was not so good as I thought.
author: Johanna Spyri

quote: Beggars do not envy millionaires  though of course they will envy other beggars who are more successful.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Ambition  having reached the summit  longs to descend.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: What we call progress is the exchange of one nuisance for another nuisance.
author: Henry Havelock Ellis

quote: The superpowers often behave like two heavily armed blind men feeling their way around a room  each believing himself in mortal peril from the other  who he assumes to have perfect vision.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: Wanting to change  to improve  a person's situation means offering him  for difficulties in which he is practiced and experienced  other difficulties that will find him perhaps even more bewildered.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Being considered beautiful at a young age sends confusing signals. You think people only like you because of your beauty.
author: Priscilla Presley

quote: Youth is not a question of years: one is young or old from birth.
author: Natalie Clifford Barney

quote: When I was fourteen  I was the oldest I ever was. ... I've been getting younger ever since.
author: Shirley Temple Black

quote: A child's world is fresh and new and beautiful  full of wonder and excitement. It is our misfortune that for most of us that clear-eyed vision  that true instinct for what is beautiful and awe-inspiring  is dimmed and even lost before we reach adulthood.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: Sure  I'm for helping the elderly. I'm going to be old myself someday.
author: Lillian Carter

quote: Youth is something very new: twenty years ago no one mentioned it.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: A comfortable old age is the reward of a well-spent youth. Instead of its bringing sad and melancholy prospects of decay  it would give us hopes of eternal youth in a better world.
author: Lydia M. Child

quote: We turn not older with years  but newer every day.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Old age is when the liver spots show through your gloves.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: The middle years  caught between children and parents  free of neither: the past stretches back too densely  it is too thickly populated  the future has not yet thinned out.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: It is not how old you are  but how you are old.
author: Marie Dressier

quote: One of the many things nobody ever tells you about middle age is that it's such a nice change from being young.
author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher

quote: When you become 100  life changes completely.
author: Lady Willie Forbus

quote: This is a youth-oriented society  and the joke is on them because youth is a disease from which we all recover.
author: Dorothy Fuldheim

quote: Old age  believe me  is a good and pleasant thing. It is true you are gently shouldered off the stage  but then you are given such a comfortable front stall as spectator.
author: Jane Harrison

quote: I look forward to growing old and wise and audacious.
author: Glenda Jackson

quote: It is so comical to hear oneself called old  even at ninety I suppose!
author: Alice James

quote: I enjoy my wrinkles and regard them as badges of distinction-I've worked hard for them!
author: Maggie Kuhn

quote: Time-our youth-it never really goes  does it? It is all held in our minds.
author: Helen Hoover Santmyer

quote: Even I don't wake up looking like Cindy Crawford.
author: Cindy Crawford

quote: We all lose our looks eventually  better develop your character and interest in life.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

quote: The lovely thing about being forty is that you can appreciate twenty-five-year-old men more.
author: Colleen McCullough

quote: The only thing that makes one place more attractive to me than another is the quantity of heart I find in it.
author: Jane Welsh Carlyle

quote: A woman may develop wrinkles and cellulite  lose her waistline  her bust-line  her ability to bear a child  even her sense of humor  but none of that implies a loss of her sexuality  her femininity.
author: Barbara Gordon

quote: Old age is like a plane flying through a storm. Once you are aboard there is nothing you can do.
author: Golda Meir

quote: In youth the days are short and the years are long. In old age the years are short and day's long.
author: Nikita Ivanovich Panin

quote: How long can you be cute?
author: Goldie Hawn

quote: Being pretty on the inside means you don't hit your brother and you eat all your peas-that's what my grandma taught me.
author: Elizabeth Heller

quote: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
author: Margaret Wolfe Hungerford

quote: When you're fifty  you start thinking about things you haven't thought about before. I used to think getting old was about vanity-but actually it's about losing people you love. Getting wrinkles is trivial.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: I am desperate and vulnerable. ... I am always terrified.... Beauty can sometimes be so very troublesome.
author: Faye Dunaway

quote: I hate myself on the screen. I want to die ... my voice is either too high or too gravelly. I want to dive under the carpet.... I'd love to be tall and willowy ... I'm short.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: After a certain number of years  our faces become our biographies.
author: Cynthia Ozick

quote: I don't like my voice. I don't like the way I look. I don't like the way I move. I don't like the way I act. I mean  period. So  you know  I don't like myself.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: Not always the fanciest cake that's there Is the best to eat!
author: Margaret Elizabeth Sangster

quote: No  Doctor  I don't want to grow young again. I just want to keep on growing old.
author: Madame de Rothschild

quote: It is quite wrong to think of old age as a downward slope. On the contrary  one climbs higher and higher with the advancing years  and that  too  with surprising strides.
author: George Sand

quote: I look forward to being older  when what you look like becomes less and less an issue and what you are is the i point.
author: Susan Sarandon

quote: When you've got the personality  you don't need the nudity.
author: Mae West

quote: The only real elegance is in the mind  if you've got that  the rest really comes from it.
author: Diana Vreeland

quote: Beauty can get a woman what she wants: love and money. But when beauty leaves you  so can the things it brought.
author: Paulina Porizkova

quote: If you're considered a beauty  it's hard to be accepted doing anything but standing around.
author: Cybil Shepherd

quote: Just because you're beautiful  they think you can't act.... I've got a lot more to prove.
author: Carol Alt

quote: I intimidate men.... People look a lot  but there's no line outside my door.
author: Joan Severance

quote: People see you as an object  not as a person  and they project a set of expectations onto you. People who don't have it think beauty is a blessing  but actually it sets you apart.
author: Candice Bergen

quote: I can count the number of dates I've had on one hand. I wish that guys would approach me  but they don't.
author: LaToya Jackson

quote: When you step on the first tee it doesn't matter what you look like. ... It doesn't help your 5-iron if you're pretty.
author: Laura Baugh

quote: For years I stopped reading beauty magazines because I couldn't look at one without wanting to blow my brains out. How can those women look so good?
author: Jamie Lee Curtis

quote: Each time I get off a plane in Hollywood  I don't think I'm pretty enough.
author: Christine Lahti

quote: Frankly  I like the fact that I no longer fit the young beauty type-people take me more seriously now.
author: Cybil Shepherd

quote: You know how many stunning women told me they can't stand a good-looking man? ... Women feel secure with an ugly guy because a man in bad shape isn't gonna cheat.
author: Jackie Mason

quote: Outstanding beauty  like outstanding gifts of any kind  tends to get in the way of normal emotional development  and thus of that particular success in life which we call happiness.
author: Milton R. Sapirstein

quote: A full bosom is actually a millstone around a woman's neck. ... [Breasts] are not parts of a person but lures slung around her neck  to be kneaded and twisted like magic putty  or mumbled and mouthed like lolly ices.
author: Germaine Greer

quote: Plain women know more about men than beautiful ones do.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: People are crying up the rich and variegated plumage of the peacock  and he is himself blushing at the sight of his ugly feet.
author: Sa'di

quote: I'm walking insecurity. Without all this makeup  I look like a refugee when I get up in the morning.... I generally look like one major bowwow. I mean arf.
author: Connie Chung

quote: You start out happy that you have no hips or boobs. All of a sudden you get them  and it feels sloppy. Then just when you start liking them  they start dropping.
author: Cindy Crawford

quote: The problem with beauty is that it's like being born rich and getting poorer.
author: Joan Collins

quote: Guys think that if a girl is pretty  she's automatically going to say no. Most of the guy's I've gone out with  I've had to make it completely obvious that I'd like them to ask me out. Or  I've had to ask them.
author: Brooke Shields

quote: I think if I weren't so beautiful  maybe I'd have more character.
author: Jerry Hall

quote: Not many people ask me out.
author: Marina Sirtis

quote: The striking point about our model family is not simply the compete-compete  consume-consume style of life it urges us to follow. The striking point  in the face of all the propaganda  is how few Americans actually live this way.
author: Louise Kapp Howe

quote: Instead of comparing our lot with that of those who are more fortunate than we are  we should compare it with the lot of the great majority of our fellow men. It then appears that we are among the privileged.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I murmured because I had no shoes  until I met man who had no feet.
author: Persian proverb

quote: Comparison  more than reality  makes men happy or wretched.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: If you compare yourself with others  you may become vain or bitter  for always there will be greater and lesser persons than yourself.
author: Max Ehrmann

quote: I look at what I have not and think myself unhappy  others look at what I have and think me happy.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: Enjoy your own life without comparing it with that of another.
author: The Condorcet

quote: If we only wanted to be happy it would be easy  but we want to be happier than other people  which is almost always difficult  since we think them happier than they are.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: I never admired another's fortune so much that I became dissatisfied with my own.
author: Cicero

quote: Every horse thinks his own pack heaviest.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Comparisons of one's lot with others' teaches us nothing and enfeebles the will.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: To think well of every other man's condition  and to dislike our own  is one of the misfortunes of human nature.
author: Robert Burton

quote: Other people's eggs have two yolks.
author: Hungarian proverb

quote: No story ever looks as bad as the story you've just bought  no story ever looks as good as the story the other fellow just bought.
author: Irving Thalberg

quote: If all our misfortunes were laid in one common heap  whence every one must take an equal portion  most people would be content to take their own and depart.
author: Solon

quote: Money  it turned out  was exactly like sex  you thought of nothing else if you didn't have it and thought of other things if you did.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Envy is an insult to oneself.
author: Yevgeny Yevtushenko

quote: Jealousy is no more than feeling alone against smiling enemies.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Envy has the ugliness of a trapped rat that has gnawed its own foot in its effort to escape.
author: Angus Wilson

quote: Jealousy is never satisfied with anything short of omniscience that would detect the subtlest fold in the heart.
author: George Eliot

quote: Envy eats nothing but its own heart.
author: German proverb

quote: Jealousy is all the fun you think they had.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Jealousy would be far less torturous if we understood that love is a passion entirely unrelated to our merits.
author: Paul Eldridges

quote: In jealousy there is more of self-love than love.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Jealousy is an inner consciousness of one's own inferiority. It is a mental cancer.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Jealousy  that dragon which slays love under the pretense of keeping it alive.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: There is no greater glory than love  nor any greater punishment than jealousy.
author: Lope de Vega

quote: As a moth gnaws a garment  so doth envy consume a man.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

quote: Envy is the most stupid of vices  for there is no single advantage to be gained from it.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The jealous are troublesome to others  but torment to themselves.
author: William Penn

quote: Envy and fear are the only passions to which no pleasure is attached.
author: John Churton Collins

quote: If malice or envy were tangible and had a shape  it would be the shape of a boomerang.
author: Charley Reese

quote: Envy is a kind of praise.
author: John Gay

quote: Envy  among other ingredients  has a mixture of the love of justice in it. We are more angry at undeserved than at deserved good fortune.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Envy comes from people's ignorance of  or lack of belief in  their own gifts.
author: Jean Vanier

quote: To cure jealousy is to see it for what it is  a dissatisfaction with self.
author: Joan Didion

quote: If envy were a fever  all the world would be ill.
author: Danish proverb

quote: Jealousy is not a barometer by which the depth of love can be read. It merely records the degree of the lover's insecurity.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: The heaven of the envied is hell for the envious.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: You can't be envious and happy at the same time.
author: Frank Tyger

quote: The whole art of life is knowing the right time to say things.
author: Maeve Binchy

quote: It is not until you become a mother that your judgment slowly turns to compassion and understanding.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship  we must love friends for their sake rather than for our own.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: Friendship  which is of its nature a delicate thing  fastidious  slow of growth  is easily checked  will hesitate  demur  recoil where love  good old blustering love  bowls ahead and blunders through every obstacle.
author: Colette

quote: It is all right to say exactly what you think if you have learned to think exactly.
author: Marcelene Cox

quote: Silence sweeter is than speech.
author: Dinah Maria Mulock Craik

quote: When we get to wishing a great deal for ourselves  whatever we get soon turns into mere limitation and exclusion.
author: George Eliot

quote: The opposite of talking isn't listening. The opposite of talking is waiting.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: Listening is not merely not talking  though even that is beyond most of our powers  it means taking a vigorous  human interest in what is being told us.
author: Alice Duer Miller

quote: Why is it that people who cannot show feeling presume that that is a strength and not a weakness?
author: May Sarton

quote: True love grows by sacrifice and the more thoroughly the soul rejects natural satisfaction the stronger and more detached its tenderness becomes.
author: Therese of Lisieux

quote: The nice thing about teamwork is that you always have others on your side.
author: Margaret Carty

quote: If you wish to fear nothing  consider that everything is to be feared.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: I survived my childhood by birthing many separate identities to stand in for one another in times of great stress and fear.
author: Roseanne Barr

quote: How does one kill fear? ... How do you shoot a specter through the heart  slash off its spectral head  take it by its spectral throat?
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: The brave man is not he who feels no fear  For that were stupid and irrational  But he  whose noble soul its fear subdues  And barely dares the danger nature shrinks from.
author: Joanna Baillie

quote: Perhaps the most important thing we can undertake toward the reduction of fear is to make it easier for people to accept themselves  to like themselves.
author: Bonaro Overstreet

quote: When fear seizes  change what you are doing. You are doing something wrong.
author: Jean Craighead George

quote: Grab the broom of anger and drive off the beast of fear.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: We will not be driven by fear ... if we remember that we are not descended from fearful men.
author: Edward R. Murrow

quote: When we are afraid we ought not to occupy ourselves with endeavoring to prove that there is no danger  but in strengthening ourselves to go on in spite of the danger.
author: Mark Rutherford

quote: Every time I start a picture ... I feel the same fear  the same self-doubts . . . and I have only one source on which I can draw  because it comes from within me.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: Fear is met and destroyed with courage.
author: James F. Bell

quote: A cheerful frame of mind  reinforced by relaxation  which in itself banishes fatigue  is the medicine that puts all ghosts of fear on the run.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: To hell with pleasure that's haunted by fear!
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: What I emphasize is for people to make choices based not on fear  but on what really gives them a sense of fulfillment.
author: Pauline Rose Chance

quote: I steer my bark with hope in my heart  leaving fear astern.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Why should a man fear  since chance is all in all for him  and he can clearly fore-know nothing? Best to live lightly as one can  unthinking.
author: Sophocles

quote: Any device whatever by which one frees himself from fear is a natural good.
author: Epicurus

quote: Joking about death-or anything else that oppresses us-makes it less frightening.
author: Allen Klein

quote: Humor acts to relieve fear.
author: Dr. William F. Fry

quote: If you can keep your head when all about are losing theirs  it's just possible you haven't grasped the situation.
author: Jean Kerr

quote: Fear is a kind of bell  or gong  which rings the mind into quick life and avoidance upon the approach of danger. It is the soul's signal for rallying.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: If you can keep your head when all about are losing theirs  it's just possible you haven't grasped the situation.
author: Jean Kerr

quote: Fear is an emotion indispensable for survival.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Fear is the single strongest motivating force in our lives. ... The more frightened you become  the better your chances of achieving success.
author: Lois Korey

quote: We only really face up to ourselves when we are afraid.
author: Thomas Bernhard

quote: If you're never scared or embarrassed or hurt  it means you never take any chances.
author: Julia Sorel

quote: Fear makes us feel our humanity.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A coward's fear can make a coward valiant.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Fear drives you and makes you better.
author: Donna E. Shalala

quote: Just as courage imperils life  fear protects it.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: In order to feel anything  you need strength.
author: Anna Maria Ortese

quote: There are times when fear is good. It must keep its watchful place at the heart's controls.
author: Aeschylus

quote: A danger foreseen is half avoided.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A good scare is worth more to a man than good advice.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Fear is a fine spur.
author: Irish proverb

quote: Fear is a question: What are you afraid of  and why? Just as the seed of health is an illness  because illness contains information  our fears are a treasure house of self-knowledge if we explore them.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: Men who fear God face life fearlessly. Men who do not fear God end up fearing everything.
author: Richard Halverson

quote: It is only the fear of God that can deliver us from the fear of men.
author: John Witherspoon

quote: Being scared can keep a man from getting killed  and often makes a better fighter of him.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Nerves provide me with energy.... It's when I don't have them  when I feel at ease  that I get worried.
author: Mike Nichols

quote: Fear is an emotion indispensable for survival.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Fear gives sudden instincts of skill.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: I quit being afraid when my first venture failed and the sky didn't fall down.
author: Allen H. Neuharth

quote: Fear of losing is what makes competitors so great. Show me a gracious loser and I'll show you a permanent loser.
author: O. J. Simpson

quote: Fear is the father of courage and the mother of safety.
author: Henry H. Tweedy

quote: Fear is the needle that pierces us  that it may carry a thread to bind us to heaven.
author: James Hastings

quote: Fear is the thought of admitted inferiority.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Fear is nature's warning signal to get busy.
author: Henry Link

quote: Fear is an uneasiness of the mind  upon the thought of a future evil likely to befall us.
author: John Locke

quote: Fear is a cloak which old men huddle about their love  as if to keep it warm.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Fear is pain arising from the anticipation of evil.
author: Aristotle

quote: Fear is the soul's signal for rallying.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Fear is static that prevents me from hearing myself.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Fear is the main source of superstition  and one of the main sources of cruelty.
author: Bertrand A. Russell

quote: Fear is a slinking cat I find beneath the lilacs of my mind.
author: Sophie Tunnell

quote: Fear is the start of wisdom.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: Fear is the lengthened shadow of ignorance.
author: Arnold Glasow

quote: Fear is the highest fence.
author: Dudley Nichols

quote: Fear is uncertainty.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Fear is sand in the machinery of life.
author: E. Stanley Jones

quote: Nothing is more despicable than respect based on fear.
author: Albert Camus

quote: I am not afraid. ... I was born to do this.
author: Joan of Arc

quote: I have a lot of things to prove to myself. One is that I can live my life fearlessly.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Fear betrays unworthy souls.
author: Virgil

quote: Fear is not a good teacher. The lessons of fear are quickly forgotten.
author: Mary Bateson

quote: Fear could never make a virtue.
author: Voltaire

quote: Considering how dangerous everything is  nothing is really very frightening.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Were the diver to think on the jaws of the shark  he would never lay hands on the precious pearl.
author: Sa'di

quote: Every problem in your life goes away in front of a bull because this problem  the bull  is bigger than all other problems. Of course  I have fear  but it is fear that I will fail the responsibility I have taken on in front of all those people-not fear of the bull.
author: Cristina Sanchez

quote: Fear is stronger than arms.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Fear is sharp-sighted  and can see things under ground  and much more in the skies.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: It is better to have a right destroyed than to abandon it because of fear.
author: Phillip Mann

quote: A great philosophy is not a philosophy without reproach  it is philosophy without fear.
author: Charles Peguy

quote: There is a time to take counsel of your fears  and there is a time to never listen to any fear.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: I  a stranger and afraid  in a world I never made.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: While we wait in silence for that final luxury of fearlessness  the weight of that silence will choke us.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: All we are asked to bear we can bear. That is a law of the spiritual life. The only hindrance to the working of this law  as of all benign laws  is fear.
author: Elizabeth Goudge

quote: "But" is a fence over which few leap.
author: German proverb

quote: There are always two voices sounding in our ears-the voice of fear and the voice of confidence. One is the clamor of the senses  the other is the whispering of the higher self.
author: Charles B. Newcomb

quote: Fear nothing  for every renewed effort raises all former failures into lessons  all sins into experience.
author: Katherine Tingley

quote: Better hazard once than always be in fear.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Pitching is the art of instilling fear by making a man flinch.
author: Sandy Koufax

quote: Fear has a large shadow  but he himself is small.
author: J. Ruth Gendler

quote: Stripped of all their masquerades  the fears of men are quite identical: the fear of loneliness  rejection  inferiority  unmanageable anger  illness and death.
author: Joshua L. Liebman

quote: What is there to be afraid of? The worst thing that can happen is you fail. So what? I failed at a lot of things. My first record was horrible.
author: John Mellencamp

quote: There is no hope unmingled with fear  and no fear unmingled with hope.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Leaders are visionaries with a poorly developed sense of fear and no concept of the odds against them. They make the impossible happen.
author: Dr. Robert Jarvik

quote: Those who love to be feared  fear to be loved. Some fear them  but they fear everyone.
author: Jean Pierre Camus

quote: Keep your fears to yourself  but share your courage with others.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: There is a courageous wisdom  there is also a false reptile prudence  the result  not of caution  but of fear.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The man who fears nothing is as powerful as he who is feared by everybody.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Who is more foolish  the child afraid of the dark  or the man afraid of the light?
author: Maurice Freehill

quote: The one permanent emotion of the inferior man is fear-fear of the unknown  the complex  the inexplicable. What he wants beyond everything else is safety.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Fear is only an illusion. It is the illusion that creates the feeling of separ-ateness-the false sense of isolation that exists only in your imagination.
author: Jeraldine Saunders

quote: A fool without fear is sometimes wiser than an angel with fear.
author: Nancy Astor

quote: Fear can be headier than whiskey  once man has acquired a taste for it.
author: Donald Dowes

quote: The first and great commandment is  don't let them scare you.
author: Elmer Davis

quote: You got a harem of seventy girls  you don't get to know any of them very well.
author: Billy Rose

quote: It is preoccupation with possession  more than anything else  that prevents men from living freely and nobly.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Ownership is to fear (tener es temer)
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Broad acres are a patent of nobility  and no man but feels more of a man in the world if he have a bit of ground that he can call his own. However small it is on the surface  it is 4000 miles deep  and that is a very handsome property.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: The landscape should belong to the people who see it all the time.
author: Le Roi Jones

quote: Whatever is not nailed down is mine. Whatever I can pry loose is not nailed down.
author: Collis P. Huntington

quote: I don't want to own anything that won't fit into my coffin.
author: Fred Allen

quote: Lives based on having are less free than lives based either on doing or on being.
author: William James

quote: The possession of gold has ruined fewer men than the lack of it.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: The want of a thing is perplexing enough  but the possession of it is intolerable.
author: John Vanbrugh

quote: Our life on earth is  and ought to be  material and carnal. But we have not yet learned to manage our materialism and carnality properly  they are still entangled with the desire for ownership.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: You must lose a fly to catch a trout.
author: George Herbert

quote: He who wants a rose must respect the thorn.
author: Persian proverb

quote: A man never feels the want of what it never occurs to him to ask for.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: I feel when people say 'bigger and better' they should say 'bigger and badder'.
author: Marie Elizabeth Kane

quote: People are so overwhelmed with the prestige of their instruments that they consider their personal judgement of hardly any account.
author: Wyndham Lewis

quote: It is unseasonable and unwholesome in all months that have not an R in their names to eat an oyster.
author: William Butler

quote: He was a bold man that first ate an oyster.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Pain and pleasure  like light and darkness  succeed each other.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Nothing begins  and nothing ends  That is not paid with moan  For we are born in others' pain  And perish in our own.
author: Francis Thompson

quote: The pain of the mind is worse than the pain of the body.
author: Syrus

quote: Buy old masters. They fetch a better price than old mistresses.
author: Lord Beaverbrook

quote: Every time I paint a portrait I lose a friend.
author: John Singer Sargent

quote: There is nothing more difficult for a truly creative painter than to paint a rose  because before he can do so he has first to forget all the roses that were ever painted.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: If you could say it in words there would be no reason to paint.
author: Edward Hopper

quote: Everyone wants to understand painting. Why don't they try to understand the singing of birds? People love the night  a flower  everything that surrounds them without trying to understand them. But painting - that they must understand.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: I cannot pretend to feel impartial about colours. I rejoice with the brilliant ones and am genuinely sorry for the poor browns.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I hope with all my heart there will be painting in heaven.
author: Jean Baptiste Corot

quote: Painting is a blind man's profession. He paints not what he sees  but what he feels  what he tells himself about what he has seen.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Painting  n: the art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather and exposing them to the critic.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: To say to the painter that Nature is to be taken as she is  is to say to the player that he may sit on the piano.
author: James McNeill Whistler

quote: I paint objects as I think them  not as I see them.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: The idea is in my head  to put it down is nothing.
author: Milton Avery

quote: There are three kinds of people in the world: those who can't stand Picasso  those who can't stand Raphael and those who've never heard of either of them.
author: John White

quote: I dream my painting  and then I paint my dream.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: For me  painting is a way to forget life. It is a cry in the night  a strangled laugh.
author: Georges Rouault

quote: Landscape painting is the obvious resource of misanthropy.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: I paint from the top down. First the sky  then the mountains  then the hills  then the houses  then the cattle  and then the people.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: A good painter is to paint two main things  namely men and the working of man's mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: I do not paint a portrait to look like the subject  rather does the person grow to look like his portrait.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: All colours are the friends of their neighbours and the lovers of their opposites.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: The purest and most thoughtful minds are those which love colour the most.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Sir  when their backsides look good enough to slap  there's nothing more to do.
author: Peter Paul Rubens

quote: A painter who has the feel of breasts and buttocks is saved.
author: Auguste Renoir

quote: Some day they will know what I mean.
author: Tom Thomson

quote: Modern art is what happens when painters stop looking at girls and persuade themselves they have a better idea.
author: John Ciardi

quote: When I look at a painting it isn't only the painting that I see but the thing that I am. If there is more in the painting than I am  then I won't see it.
author: Ivan Eyre

quote: If we could but paint with the hand as we see with the eye!
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: A picture is a poem without words.
author: Horace

quote: I mix them with my brains  sir.
author: John Opie

quote: A book of Verses underneath the Bough  A Jug of Wine  a Loaf of Bread - and Thou Beside me singing in the Wilderness -  Oh  Wilderness were Paradise enow!
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: In this fool's paradise  he drank delight
author: George Grabbe

quote: There is no friendship  no love  like that of the parent for the child.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The first half of our lives is ruined by our parents and the second half by our children.
author: Clarence S. Darrow

quote: Next to God  thy parents.
author: William Penn

quote: A Jewish man with parents alive is a 15-year-old boy  and will remain a 15-year-old boy until they die.
author: Philip Roth

quote: A rich child often sits in a poor mother's lap.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Every beetle is a gazelle in the eyes of its mother.
author: Moorish proverb

quote: Parents accept their obsolescence with the best grace they can muster. . . they do all they can to make it easy for the younger generation to surpass the older  while secretly dreading the rejection that follows.
author: Christopher Lasch

quote: Parents are sometimes a bit of a disappointment to their children. They don't fulfill the promise of their early years.
author: Anthony Powell

quote: Parenthood remains the greatest single preserve of the amateur.
author: Alvin Toffler

quote: Everyone likes to think that he has done reasonably well in life  so that it comes as a shock to find our children believing differently. The temptation is to tune them out  it takes much more courage to listen.
author: John D. Rockefeller III

quote: You don't have to deserve your mother's love. You have to deserve your father's. He's more particular.
author: Robert Frost

quote: I demand for the unmarried mother  as a sacred channel of life  the same reverence and respect as for the married mother  for Maternity is a cosmic thing and once it has come to pass  our conventions must not be permitted to blaspheme it.
author: Ben Lindsey

quote: Who takes the child by the hand takes the mother by the heart.
author: German proverb

quote: Diogenes struck the father when the son swore.
author: Robert Burton

quote: Perhaps host and guest is really the happiest relation for father and son.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: Mother is the name for God in the lips and hearts of children.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: To bring up a child in the way he should go  travel that way yourself once in a while.
author: Josh Billings

quote: A father is a banker provided by nature.
author: French proverb

quote: To become a father is not hard  to be a father is  however.
author: Wilhelm Busch

quote: Our sons  who so easily recognize our errors  and rightly denounce them  will have to confess their own  later on  and they may be as bad as ours  perhaps worse.
author: Bruce Hutchison

quote: A mother who is really a mother is never free.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: God could not be everywhere and therefore he made mothers.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: The first half of our lives is ruined by our parents and the second half by our children.
author: Clarence S. Darrow

quote: Tired mothers find that spanking takes less time than reasoning and penetrates sooner to the seat of the memory.
author: Will Durant

quote: Every parent is at some time the father of the unreturned prodigal  with nothing to do but keep his house open to hope.
author: John Ciardi

quote: The fundamental defect of fathers is that they want their children to be a credit to them.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Don't limit a child to your own learning  for he was born in another time.
author: Rabbinical saying

quote: An ounce of mother is worth a pound of clergy.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: No matter how old a mother is  she watches her middle-aged children for signs of improvement.
author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

quote: Whatever you would have your children become  strive to exhibit in your own lives and conversation.
author: Lydia H. Sigourney

quote: I must study politics and war  that my sons may have the liberty to study mathematics and philosophy  geography  natural history  and naval architecture  navigation  commerce  and agriculture  in order to give their children a right to study painting  poetry  music  architecture  statuary  tapestry and porcelain.
author: John Adams

quote: The thing about having a baby is that thereafter you have it.
author: Jean Kerr

quote: The best way to bring up some children is short.
author: Anthony J. Pettito

quote: What the mother sings to the cradle goes all the way down to the coffin.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The mother-child relationship is paradoxical and  in a sense  tragic. It requires the most intense love on the mother's side  yet this very love must help the child grow away from the mother and to become fully independent.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Who doesn't desire his father's death?
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: Insanity is hereditary - you can get it from your children.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Parents are the bones on which children cut their teeth.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Your children need your presence more than your presents.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: People should be free to find or make for themselves the kinds of educational experiences they want their children to have.
author: John Holt

quote: It is the malady of our age that the young are so busy teaching us that they have no time left to learn.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Oh has thou forgotten how soon we must sever? Oh hast thou forgotten this day we must part? It may be for years and it may be forever  Oh why art thou silent  thou voice of my heart?
author: Julia Crawford

quote: Fare thee well! and if for ever  Still for ever  fare thee well.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Departure should be sudden.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The sweetest flower that blows  I give you as we part. For you it is a rose For me it is my heart.
author: Frederick Peterson

quote: Political parties serve to keep each other in check  one keenly watching the other.
author: Henry Clay

quote: I always voted at my party's call  And I never thought of thinking for myself at all.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: He serves his party best who serves the country best.
author: R. B. Hayes
